With this loan of 1,500 soles ($525), which she will repay over 5 months, she will buy two dozen chickens, condiments, and ingredients to prepare her food. Adita is a very enterprising woman who knows how to get ahead. She has succeeded in educating her children and feels very grateful because an organization like Manuela Ramos has trusted her and given her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adita, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Jr. Lino Velásquez Mzc Lt.3, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre de 4 hijos. Adita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de comida. Adita sale a vender su comida todas las noches en el patio de su casa, sus clientes se siente muy contentos con ellos de saborear ese exquisito sazón que solo ella sabe hacerlo. Con este préstamo de S/ 1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 doc. Pollos (aves), condimentos y víveres para que pueda preparar su comida. Adita es una mujer muy emprendedora que ha sabido salir adelante, ha logrado la educación de sus hijos y se siente agradecida porque una institución como Manuela Ramos haya confiado en darle un crédito.

loans.use: Buy ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Juan Conrado

texts.es:
Juan started the business because he had a many friends to whom he could offer meals and because he has the ability to prepare them with the help of his wife. He wanted to offer wellbeing to his family and, because he didn’t have a job and a steady salary, he had to look for another way to earn an income to be able to pay for household necessities and because his oldest son was about to start elementary school and so those expenses were going to increase. He started in April of 2005 when he began to to sell meals on his own because before he helped his mother-in-law with her business preparing and delivering meals. But then he became independent and thanks to that now works full time in this business. It has gone very well for him and now has a large number of clients.

Juan needs a loan for US$500, which he plans to repay in five months, to buy products and utensils to be used in the preparation of meals that will allow him to handle his clients orders.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan inició el negocio porque tenía muchas amistades entre las cuales podía ofrecer comidas y porqué tiene la facilidad de prepararlas con la ayuda de su esposa. El quería ofrecerle bienestar a su familia y como no tenía un empleo y un sueldo seguro tenía que buscar la forma de obtener un ingreso para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar ya que su hijo mas grande iba a entrar y a estudiar la primaria y los gastos se iban a incrementar. Comenzó en Abril de 2005 cuando empezo a vender comidas por su cuenta, ya que antes le ayudaba a su suegra en su negocio preparando comidas y entregándolas a domicilio, pero entonces se independizó y gracias a ella ahora se dedico a esta actividad en la cual le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad cuenta con un buen número de clientes.

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima y utensilios para la elaboración de comidas que le permitan atender los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase products and utensils used to prepare meals

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Mrs. Águeda, is a member of the El Arenal Community Bank, located in Jr. Callao #427, of the Calleria district, Ucayali Department. She is 43 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of $100, Águeda decided to invest in the sales of general goods. Beacuse she is in the business of selling products, her first need was to incorporate the sales of undergarments and other clothing articles. With this loan of $450, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 1/2 a sack of rice, a 1/2 sack of sugar, 1/2 crate of eggs, sweets, 15 meters of fabric, elastic, padding, and thread. Águeda is a seasoned woman who continues to see different business opportunities and sees how to make her business grow so that she can support her family's economic needs.

Tranlsated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Águeda, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr Callao # 427, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 4 hijos. Su esposo es obrero. Águeda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de abarrotes. Además de la venta de productos de primera necesidad esta incorporando en el mismo local la venta de lencería y otros Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 1/2 saco de arroz, 1/2 saco de azúcar, 1/2 caja de huevo y golosinas y 15 metros de tela, elásticos, blondas, hilos. Águeda, es una mujer aguerrida que continua viendo diferentes oportunidades de negocio porque esta viendo en hacer crecer mas su negocio y así pueda brindar y apoyar económicamente a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of various products at wholesale (general goods)

loans.name: Agustina Ilmer

texts.es:
Agustina belongs to Las Románticas Community Bank located in the AA.HH 7 D. Junio Avenue Colonización Mzc. Lt.3, in the San Fernando District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband works in a company. With the first loan of S/. 300 that Agustina received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in a small grocery store. Today she continues with her grocery store and day by day she has more will to continue advancing her business. In the evenings she has another type of income which is the sale of “salchipapas,” a dish that combines sausages and potatoes. With this loan of S/ 700.00, which will be paid over 4 months, she will expand her business with the purchase of groceries like packages of noodles, sugar, rice, oil, sweets and others. Agustina is satisfied with Manuela Ramos because it has given her the opportunity to continue expanding her business and she hope to start a store to sell auto parts so that she can continue improving her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Agustina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Románticas, ubicado en el AA.HH 7 D. Junio Av. Colonización Mzc. Lt.3, del Distrito D. San Fernando, del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una compañía. Agustina con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en bodega. Hoy continua con su bodega y que día a día le pone muchas ganas para seguir surgiendo en su negocio. y por las noches también tiene otro tipo D. un ingreso que es vender sus salchipapas. Con este préstamo D. S/ 700.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, incrementará su negocio con la compra D. abarrotes como: paquetes D. fideos, azúcar, arroz, aceite, golosinas y otros. Agustina esta satisfecha con Manuela Ramos porque le da la oportunidad D. que pueda seguir aumentado su negocio y que tiene toda la esperanza D. poner una tienda para venta D. repuestos D. motokar para que así pueda seguir incrementando su economía.

loans.use: Purchase of diverse products (groceries).

loans.name: Juan Armando

texts.es:
Juan started the business because he has always liked sales and it’s a way to feel useful and productive. Besides that, in this way he can sometimes help his children and grandchildren. Due to a very difficult financial situation he was facing at that time, because the money wasn’t sufficient, he had to look for a way to get ahead and to support his son who was still in school. He started in February of 2004 when his mother, who worked selling clothing, asked him to sell the extra clothes that she had to his neighbors. He did that and was able to sell them. Then his neighbors and friends started to order more and, because things started going very well, he decided to dedicate himself completely to this activity.

Juan needs a loan for US$500, which he plans to repay in five months, that will help him to buy school clothes, taking advantage of the fact that the 2008-2009 shool year is starting.

Translated form Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan inició el negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y es una forma de sentirse útil y productivo, además que de esta forma puede a veces ayudar a sus hijos y a sus nietos. Ante la situación económica tan difícil por la que estaba pasando en ese tiempo, ya que el dinero no les alcanzaba tenía que buscar la manera de salir adelante y apoyar a su hijo que todavía estaba estudiando. Comenzó en Febrero de 2004 cuando su madre se dedicaba a vender ropa le pidió que la ofreciera entre sus vecinos unas prendas que le habían sobrado, las ofrecío y pudo venderlas entonces los vecinos y amistades le empezaron a encargar mas y como le empezó a ir muy bien decidío dedicarse totalmente a esta actividad.

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar ropa escolar que le ayudará a surtir los pedidos aprovechando que comienza el período escolar 2008-2009.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Itzel

texts.es:
Itzel started the business in order to make money to help her husband with the expenses of their household, supporting him mainly because their son was born recently and she wanted to give him the best and support him so that he can study at the university and have better opportunities. She started in 2005 and first helped her mother with her business selling books either as a cashier or delivering orders. Her mother was her example because, in spite of the fact that she was single without the support of a husband, she helped her children get ahead. Because of her advice, Itzel became motivated to have her own business and she joined a friend who works selling jewelry. May 10th, Mother’s Day, was approaching and it was in her best interest to make an investment in jewelry because during that time, people buy a lot to give to their mothers. Since then she has done well in this business.

Itzel needs a loan for US$400, which she plans to repay in four months, to buy more silver jewelry and have a better selection for her clients who buy more all the time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Itzel inició el negocio para poder ganar dinero para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar apoyando a su esposo sobre todo porque acaba de nacer su hijo y queria darle lo mejor y apoyarlo para que estudie una carrera universitaria y tenga mejores oportunidades. Comenzó en el 2005, primero le ayudaba a su mamá en su negocio de ventas de libros, ya sea cobrando o entregando pedidos, y ella fue su ejemplo pues a pesar que se quedó sola sin el apoyo de un esposo ella sacó adelante a su hijos. Fue por consejo de ella que se animó a tener su propio negocio y se presentó con una amiga que también se dedica a la venta de joyería ya que se acercaba el 10 de Mayo, día de las madres, y le convenía hacer una inversión en joyería ya que en esa época la gente compra mucho para regalar a sus mamás, desde entonces me ha ido muy bien en esta actividad.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar más joyería de plata y tener un mejor surtido para mis clientes que cada vez se incrementan más.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es:
Ana belongs to Las Románticas Community Bank located in the Jr. Talara # 208 of the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 31 years old and is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a motortaxi driver. Ana decided to invest the first loan of S/. 300 she received from Manuela Ramos in food sales. Ana prepares a variety of dishes to satisfy the clients’ different tastes. They are certainly demanding but Ana continues food sales where she makes different types of stews such as chicken anticuchos, chaufa rice, juanes, tacacho, patarashca, and others. This loan of S/ 700.00, which will be paid over 4 months, will be invested in the purchase of ½ sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, 1 package of noodles, 13 chickens, and 2 packages of oil. Ana is very charismatic which is why her customers feel comfortable with her and she is very proud to belong to Manuela Ramos because it helps all of the women who have businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Románticas, ubicado en el Jr. Talara # 208, del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Ana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de comida Ana prepara una variedad de platos para satisfacer los diferentes gustos de los clientes , por cierto son exigentes, pero Ana continua la venta de comida donde realiza diferente tipos de potajes como (anticuchos de pollo, arroz chaufa, juanes, tacacho, patarashca, y otros), Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, será invertido en la compra de ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideos, 13 pollos, 2 paquetes de aceite. Ana es muy carismática por ello sus clientes se sienten a gusto y esta muy orgullosa de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos porque ayuda a todas las mujeres que tienen negocios.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Beatriz has been making hammocks for 10 years now. She was a little girl when she learned how to make hammocks from her mother. Today she is grateful for having learned to make her hammocks because she now sells them and she can support her family's expenses. She compliments her husband's income as it is not enough to cover their expenses. She is a mother of 2 children.

She needs a loan in the amount of $400 that will be repaid in a term of 5 months. She will purchase more merchandise and increase her inventory of materials to make hammocks. With your support Beatriz will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Beatriz tiene mas de 10 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy pequeña aprendió a elaborarlas gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, por lo que ahora aprovecha de lo aprendido para elaborar sus hamacas y luego venderlas y así tener un apoyo para el gasto familiar, ya que con el suedlo de su esposo no le alcanza para solventarlos, ella es madre de 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y asi tener inventario para poder elaborar sus hamacas. Con tu apoyo Beatriz saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro started working in this job since a very young age. With a great deal of hard work and with the help of his wife they managed to gather a small capital that they invested in the hammock business. This business grants them an income that covers their family's expenses.

He needs a loan in the amount of $400 that will be repaid in a term of 5 months. These funds will be invested in the purchase of strings and ropes to have more material with which they can make more hammocks. With your support Pedro will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro desde muy temprana edad se dedica al comercio, y a base de mucho esfuerzo, y con la ayuda de su esposa, logro juntar un pequeño capital el cual puso a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares.

El necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar hilos y asi tener más material para elaborar sus hamacas. Con tu apoyo Pedro saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase string and rope.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the Mujeres Audaces Community Bank located in Jr. Tarapacá # 775 of the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband works in pool installation. Blanca invested her first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos in jewelry sales. At the present time Blanca is working in agriculture and raising chickens. With this loan of S/ 1,200, which will be paid over 5 months, see will buy chemicals to fumigate her fields and then be able to plant. She will also buy 200 chickens and balanced feed for her chickens. Each day is a challenge for Blanca as she is going through difficult times due to the great loss of her beloved son Rudy; but day by day she tries to overcome her pain now that her son has predeceased her. Blanca says that the only thing she has left to do is to continue with life and not be discouraged. She feels very happy because of the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has allowed her to receive a loan and invest it as her children and one grandchild still depend on her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Audaces, ubicado en el Jr. Tarapacá # 775, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 6 hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la instalación de piscinas. Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en venta de joyas. En la actualidad Blanca esta con lo que es agricultura y crianza de pollos. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará insumos químicos para que fumigue su chacra y seguidamente pueda sembrar; también comprará 200 pollos y alimentos balanceado para sus pollos. Cada día, para Blanca es un reto ya que esta pasando por momentos muy difíciles por la gran perdida de su queridísimo hijo Rudy; Pero ella día a día trata de superar su dolor ya que su hijo se le adelanto a la fecha e parto. Blanca dice que lo único que le queda es seguir con la vida y no desmayar. Ella Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir ya que tiene a sus hijos y un nieto que dependen de ella todavía.

loans.use: To purchase chickens (birds) and balanced feed.  To buy chemical products for pest control.

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia belongs to the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, she lives at Jr 2 de Mayo AA. HH 9 de Octubre, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 33 years old and mother to one small boy. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling cosmetics.

Today she continues selling a variety of cosmetics. She gets up very early to make her son’s breakfast and then he goes to school; she then is able to go out and offer her products as well as collect any payments due.

With the current loan for S/1.200 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in buying 2 hair creams, 2 perfumes, 2 lipsticks, and 1 pair of earrings.

She is very happy with her business, and therefore she puts a lot of effort and dedication so she will be able to best support her small son, who is her reason for living. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity and confidence provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elia, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr 2 de Mayo AA. HH 9 de Octubre, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es madre de un pequeño hijo. Elia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de cosméticos

En la actualidad continua con la venta de cosméticos . Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de su hijo que va a la escuela; para luego poder salir a ofrecer sus productos como también hacer su cobranza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de 2 cremas para pelo,2 perfumes, 2 lápiz labial y 1 juego de aretes.

Elia esta muy feliz con su negocio, es por eso que le pone mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ya que de tal manera podrá darle de lo mejor a su pequeño hijo que es la razón de su vivir. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad y confianza brindado.

loans.use: Buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Siliva started raising her pigs in the patio of her house to help her husband with the household expenses because he did not have a steady income. Their income was not enough to cover the household costs and the necessities of their 3 children. So far it has gone very weill and they see an even greater demand for their livestock.

She needs a loan in the amount of $400 that will be rapaid in a term of 5 months to finish building her corral and to purchase more livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia empezó a criar cerdos en el patio de su casa para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que el no cuenta con un sueldo seguro y no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus 3 hijos. Actualmente le ha ido bien y tienen mayor demanda de animales.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para terminar de construir otro corral y comprar mas animales.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and finish building the corral.

loans.name: Elizabeth Koska

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a member of Banco Comunal El Arenal, a communal bank, which is located in Jr Ricardo Palma #577, in the district of Calleria in the region of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and is a mother of 3 children. Her huband is a teacher. Elizabeth invested the first loan of $106 from Manuela Ramos in her food business.

Elizabeth wakes up early everyday to prepare breakfast for her husband who has to go to work with their children who are students. Later, Elizabeth goes to the market so she can prepare the food that she sells in the evenings.

With a loan of $425 that will be repaid in 6 months, she will use it to buy ½ sack of rice, 3 chickens, 4 liters of oil, vegetables, and also do some maintenance on her 2 cars. Elizabeth is grateful to Manuela Ramos' Movement for its support and the accomplishments that has been achieved in her life. She is very happy for the income that she has been able to make for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr Ricardo Palma # 577, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 3 hijos. Su esposo es Docente. Elizabeth con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de comida.

Elizabeth se levanta muy temprano todos lo días para preparar el desayuno de su esposo que tiene que ir a trabajar como para sus hijos que tienen que ir a estudiar; para luego Elizabeth pueda ir al mercado a realizar sus compras para que prepara su comida para que salir a vender en las noches.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de ½ saco de arroz, 3 pollos, 4 litros de aceite, verduras y también hizo el mantenimiento de sus 2 motokar. Elizabeth, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el respaldo brindado, ya que gracias a ello sigue logrando muchos éxitos en su vida y esta muy feliz por los ingresos que puede generar para su familia.

loans.use: Buy supplies at wholesale and maintain her cars

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana is married and has 2 children. Facing the need to cover the family expenses, five years ago she started selling shoes by catalogue to her friends and family. Little by little her sales started to increase and soon, her customers started to request she sell clothing as well. In this manner she has been expanding her business and every day her roster of clients grows even more.

She requests a loan in the amount of $1000 US that she will repay in a term of 6 months. She will use the funds to purchase merchandise and offer her clients a greater seletionof clothing and shoes. With your help she will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana es casada y tiene 2 hijos, ante la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos familiares, hace 5 años empezó a vender entre sus conocidos zapatos por catalogo, poco a poco sus ventas fueron incrementando y comenzaron a pedirle que vendiera ropa de esta manera ella ha ido creciendo en el negocio y cada día su cartera de clientes crece mas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes mas variedad en ropa y zapatos. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther belongs to Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, a communal bank, located in Jr. Senor de los Milagros #128, in the district of Calleria, which is in the region of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and is a mother of one young son. Her husband is in woodwork. Esther invested in broomsticks with her first loan of $70 from Manuela Ramos.

Esther makes and sells brooms. With a loan of $500, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy supplies to make her brooms like fiber hairs, wooden sticks, plastic straws, etc. Esther works everyday to improve her family's financial situation. She is very happy to be part of the communal bank, for she has had the opportunity to share loans and experiences with many other women.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Señor de los Milagros # 128, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años es madre de 1 pequeño hijo, su esposo trabaja en madera. Esther con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 200 decidió invertir en venta de escobas.

Esther esta con el negocio de escoba que ella misma elabora para luego sacar a la venta. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,400 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará implementos para elaborar escobas como: fibra de pieza, cabezales de madera, tambichi, paja sintética. Esther trabaja día a día para conseguir un mejor ingreso económico en su familia y esta muy contenta de pertenecer a un banquito comunal por que además de tener la oportunidad de un crédito comparte experiencias con muchas señoras.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca belongs to the Teresa Ramos Community Bank located in Jr. Callao # 427 of the Yarina Cocha District of the Ucayali Department. She is 26 years old. Her husband is a sales agent. She decided to invest her first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of fishing products. Her stand is located in a market close to the port, allowing her to sell these products to the fishermen that work there. With this loan of S/ 1,000, which will be paid over 5 months, she will increase her business by buying fish hooks of all sizes, nets, nylon and line preparation products. Francisca is a very happy person because she feels very accomplished as a woman, a businesswoman and a wife and thanks the opportunity that has been given in giving her a loan to invest in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Francisca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr. Callao # 427, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años. Su esposo es agente vendedor. Francisca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de productos par pesca. Su puesto se encuentra en un mercado que esta cerca del puerto donde le permite vender estos productos a los pescadores que trabajan allí. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementara su negocio comprando anzuelos de todo tamaño, redes. Nailon y productos de pasamanería. Francisca es una persona muy alegre dado que se siente muy realizada como mujer, empresaria y como esposa y agradece la oportunidad que se le dio en darle un crédito para invertir en este negocio.

loans.use: To purchase fishing supplies (nets, fish hooks, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria Ysabel started buying clothes 6 years ago in Belice as well as shoe sales by catalogue and up until a few months ago she conducted sales from her home. But recently she saw that there were regional fairs and government sponsored activities in the neighbouring regions and clients increased dramatically in those areas. She started attending these areas to tap in to a new market and since then her sales have increased, and her family's financial situation has improved. Now she needs to acquire a greater volume of merchandise to satisfy the demand she has seen.

She needs a loan in the amount of $1000 US that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will use these funds to acquire a greater volume of merchandise to provide a better selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Ysabel hace 6 años que empezó a comprar ropa en Belice y a vender zapatos por catálogo, hasta hace algunos meses vendía en su casa , pero recientemente observo que habían diversos pagos de apoyos de gobierno y fiestas en poblaciones cercanas durante las cuales los clientes aumentaban de esta manera empezó a acudir a esos sitios iniciando así un mercado potencial diferente que le ha incrementado sus ventas y con ello mejorado su situación económica y la de sus hijos, ahora requiere adquirir mayor cantidad de mercancía para satisfacer la demanda que tiene .

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercancía para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Grimanesca

texts.es:
Grimanesca belongs to Las Románticas Community Bank located in AA.HH Manantay Jr. Ucayali MzLL Lt.3 in the San Fernando District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, the mother is 4 children and a widow. Grimanesca decided to invest her first S/. 300 loan from Manuela Ramos in charcoal sales. At the present time she continues with this charcoal business. Grimanesca gets up very early to build her fires so that she can make her charcoal. With this loan of S/ 700.00, which will be paid over 4 months, she will buy 3 truckloads of firewood. Grimanesca does not get discouraged as she moves forward and is very thankful to the institution because with the loan that she received she has been able to grow her business and she also could help pay for one of her daughter’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Grimanesca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Románticas, ubicado en el AA.HH Manantay Jr. Ucayali MzLL Lt.3, del Distrito de San Fernando, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años es madre de 4 hijos, es viuda. Grimanesca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de carbón. En la actualidad continua con el negocio de carbón. Grimanesca se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus volcanes para que pueda hacer su carbón. Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 camionadas de leña. Grimanesca no desmaya sigue adelante y esta muy agradecida con la institución por que con el préstamo que recibió le ayudo a crecer más su negocio y también le pudo ayudar a pagar sus estudios a una de sus hijas.

loans.use: To buy firewood wholesale.

loans.name: Iris Diana

texts.es:
Iris belongs to the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, she lives at Jr. Arenal # 1063, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 24 years old and is single. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling candy.

Today she continues selling a variety of candy and soda pop.

With the current loan for S/1.100 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 3 boxes of small soda pop, 3 packages of large soda pop, and a variety of candy

Everyday is a challenge for Iris. So she is happy for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos provides her to receive a loan and invest in her business. This way she can bring income to her family. She has always liked being independent and this is why she likes her business as she can converse with her customers and make many friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Iris, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal # 1063, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años es soltera. Iris con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de golosinas.

Actualmente continua con la venta de variedad de golosinas y gaseosas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de 3 cajas de gaseosa chica, 3 paquetes de gaseosa grande, y variedad de golosinas.

Para Iris cada día es un reto. Es por ello que Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir. Y de tal forma ella pueda llevar un ingreso a su familia. A ella Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente de tal manera le gusta mucho su negocio ya que de esa manera puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer muchos amigos.

loans.use: Buy soda pop and candy

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier started his business following some financial needs when he found himself out of work. With the hlep of his mother he renovated his house to accomodate for food preparation and sales. Seeing a need to have an income they both decided to start a business on their own to cover the family expenses.

He requires a loan in the amount of $500 US that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. He will use these funds to purchase ingredients and to have more clients in his region. With your support he will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier incio su negocio por necesidades economicas ya que no tenia trabajo y con ayuda de su madre acondiciono en su casa la venta de comidas apoyando a su mama en la elaboracion de comidas, ya que ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso decidieron emprender un negocio por su cuenta para solventar en los gastos familiares,

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materia prima y tener mas clientes en su colonia. Con tu apoyo el saldra delante.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
Wayan W. is a very diligent worker. She farms rice and pigs at her home. Every mornings and evenings, she always feeds and cleans her pigs to produce the best quality meats. She needs about $130 to take care of 4 pigs and the rest are used to purchase feeds. She earns about $20 profit per month. She comes back to DINARI to increase her working capital to farm more pigs. This second loan will be used to purchase piglets, feeds and medicines. Wayan is very serious in her farm business after realizing that it provides her with excellent income potential. Wayan hopes that her income for the next 6 months will be better than previous periods.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Wayan W. sangat tekun dengan pekerjaannya. Disamping sebagai petani, Wayan W. juga menggeluti usaha beternak babi di rumahnya. Setiap pagi dan sore harinya Wayan W. selalu rajin memberi makan serta memandikan babi-babinya untuk dapat menghasilkan panen babi yang bermutu baik. Modal yang dibutuhkan sebagai peternak babi sekitar Rp.1.300.000,- untuk memelihara 4 ekor babi dan sisanya dipakai untuk membeli pakan babi. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perbulannya sekitar Rp.200.000,-. Karena itulah Wayan kembali meminjam ke DINARI untuk menambah modal usaha sehingga babi peliharaannya bisa bertambah banyak. Pinjaman kedua ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi serta sisanya untuk pakan dan obat-obatnya. Melihat hasil dari beternak babi ini sangat bagus untuk menghidupi keluarga bersama dengan suaminya maka Wayan sangat serius untuk menekuninya. Wayan berharap pemeliharaan kedepan selama 6 bulan akan memberikan keuntungan yang melebihi sebelumnya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, feeds and medications

loans.name: Ni Made Lina

texts.id:
Made Lina R. decided to farm pigs because she foresaw good prospects in the business. Her first loan from DINARI was used to grow her farm by purchasing a breeder pig and a slaughter pig. Her diligence resulted in good production from her farm. She earns $20 per month for each 6 months growing cycle. This earnings helped supplement her husband who works as a mechanic in a local garage. She is now applying for second loan that Made Lina plans to use to increase her pig farm population and buy more feeds. She hopes to earn more profit by farming more pigs. She hopes to be able to save more money for her little baby's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tinggal di desa membuat Made Lina R. mengambil keputusan untuk beternak babi. Karena prospek yang dilihatnya sangat bagus untuk mengembangkan usaha babinya. Pinjaman pertama ke DINARI digunakannya sebagai modal usaha ternak babinya dengan dibelikan 1 induk babi serta 1 babi penggemukan. Dari ketekunannya memelihara babi itu Made mampu menghasilkan keuntungan sebesar Rp.200.000,- per bulan selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan. Hasil ini sangat membantu suaminya yang bekerja di bengkel untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Setelah permohonan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman periode kedua ke DINARI disetujui, Made Lina R akan memanfaatkannya untuk menambah populasi babinya serta sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi. Nantinya diharapkan akan menghasilkan hasil yang lebih bagus dari sebelumnya sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak dan bisa disisihkan untuk ditabung yang kelak akan digunakan untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang masih kecil.

loans.use: Purchase Pig Feeds

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
In the midst of toughening economic condition, Ketut K. has a sizable responsibility to fulfill her family's needs. Her husband's farming income is not enough to fill all her family's needs, especially that their children are still infants. Ketut K. decided to start a pig farm at home with training and financial assistance from DINARI. From her first loan, she bought 1 breeding pis and 1 slaughter pig. After 6 months, she earned $30 profit per month. Because of this positive experience, Ketut Kartni decided to apply for second loan from DINARI that she plan to use to purchase 2 slaughter pigs and feeds for her newly purchased breeding pig. Ketut is hopeful that from these additional pigs will bring her increased profit. The profit from her pig farm really makes a difference in her family's quality of life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Di tengah himpitan ekonomi yang semakin berat Ketut K. memiliki tanggung jawab yang besar untuk dapat menghidupi keluarganya. Suaminya yang sebagai petani tidak dapat mencukupi semua keperluan keluarga ditambah dengan kebutuhan anaknya yang masih kecil. Akhirnya Ketut K. memutuskan untuk memelihara babi di rumahnya dengan pinjaman modal dari program DINARI. Setelah pinjaman terealisasi dibelikannya 1 ekor induk babi serta 1 babi penggemukan. Setelah 6 bulan pemeliharaan diperoleh keuntungan dari penjualannya sebesar Rp.300.000,- sebulannya. Karena keuntungan yang bagus inilah maka Ketut K. melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan DINARI. Pinjaman kedua ini digunakannya untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan 2 ekor serta pakan babi untuk induk babi yang masih dipeliharanya. Ketut sangat berharap ada pertambahan keuntungan yang diperoleh dari penjualan selanjutnya. Karena hasil beternak babinya ini besar pengaruhnya terhadap kelangsungan keluarganya sehari-har

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and feeds

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
Despite her age, Wayan J. is very diligent in farming her pigs. She develops this business to help her husband that works as a farmer providing income to the family. With the training and financial help from DINARI, Wayan J. managed to grow her pigs so that they bring her a lot of profit. From 4 piglets that she grew for 6 months, she managed to earn $30 profit per month. So she decided to apply for second loan from DINARI. With the bigger loan, Wayan plans to purchase more piglets and feeds. She hopes to increase her sales and consequently bring more income to fulfill her daily needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Meskipun sudah cukup tua, Wayan J. sangat ulet menekuni usaha beternak babi. Hal ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya yang sebagai petani dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan pemeliharaan yang sederhana serta pinjaman modal dan training dari DINARI Wayan J. mampu mengembangkan ternak babinya sehingga dapat memberikan keuntungan yang lumayan banyak. Dari penjualan babi penggemukan sejumlah 4 ekor selama 6 bulan diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.300.000,- per bulannya. Kemudian selanjutnya melakukan peminjaman kedua ke DINARI dengan jumlah pinjaman yang bertambah besar dan Wayan menggunakannya untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan yang lebih banyak serta untuk pakan. Keuntungan dari penjualan berikutnya diharapkan bertambah besar juga sehingga dapat digunakan untuk keperluan sehari-hari serta menambah modal ternak babinya kelak.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Bartini

texts.id:
Although her husband supports the family relatively well, Ketut Bartini nonetheless also works hard because the cost of living keeps rising these days. Outside of tending to her garden, Ketut Bartini main activity is breeding pigs. The first loan from DINARI enabled Ketut Bartini to earn Rp.400.000 per month (approx. US$40) in her business. Ketut Bartini will use this second loan to purchase three pigs to rear alongside the female pig that she already owns. The rest of the loan she will use to purchase feed. After breeding pigs for five months or so, she hopes to earn as much as Rp.500.000 (approx. US$50). She will use the additional income earned to pay for her child’s education and to help meet the daily household needs. Ketut Bartini is grateful for the assistance from KIVA via the DINARI foundation. She also finds helpful the training she receives from DINARI’s staff to help her care for her livestock.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Meskipun suaminya sudah lumayan memberikan penghasilan bagi keluarga tapi Ketut Bartini tetap ulet dalam bekerja sebab biaya hidup semakin hari terus meningkat. Selain mengolah kebunnya Ketut Bartini juga memelihara babi di rumahnya. Dari pinjaman pertama ke DINARI Ketut Bartini memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 400.000,- per bulannya. Lewat pinjaman kedua ini Ketut Bartini membeli bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 3 ekor disamping induk yang telah dimilikinya. Sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak. Setelah pemeliharaan kurang lebih selama 5 bulan dengan perhitungan sudah dipotong biaya pakan diharapkan keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.500.000,-. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari penjualan babi berikutnya ini akan digunakan untuk membiayai pendidikan anaknya serta memenuhi biaya kehidupan sehari-harinya. Ketut Bartini juga merasa dibantu dengan program KIVA dari DINARI melalui modal yang diberikan ke peternak babi di pedesaan. Training tentang cara memelihara babi yang baik dari staf DINARI juga dirasakan sangat menolong keberhasilan para peternak dalam memperoleh hasil panen babi yang baik.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou P. grows rice and vegetables on her farmland in Phteah Prey Commune, Pursat Province. She has been growing rice since 1993 and earns approximately $1.50 per day. She is married and has four children, all young and in school. Chanthou and her husband work hard every day due to increasing family expenses.

Because her farmland is infertile, she needs to use fertilizer to increase her rice yield. She faces the obstacle of a lack of money, so she decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer. She hopes to increase her rice yield using the loan. In the picture, Chanthou, her husband, and her children are growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Suparmi

texts.id:
A pensioner's salary does not go very far for Suparmi and her retired army veteran husband. As a result, Suparmi works hard to help her husband in fulfilling the family needs. She has opened a stall that sells fried foods such as fried banana, fried tofu, fried yam and other such items. This stall serves the locals who work nearby as fishermen. In a day usually Suparmi needs about Rp.50.000-Rp.70.000 (approx. US$5-$7) in working capital and her net earnings total about Rp.30.000-Rp.40.000 (approx. US$3-$4). This business helps Suparmi sufficiently meet the needs of her family as well as care for her grandchild, who is under five years of age at this time. From the funds granted by DINARI foundation, Suparmi has big hopes of expanding her business and also fixing her house which is very simple at the moment.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari seorang pensiunan tentara dengan gaji yang tidak seberapa membuat Suparmi ikut bekerja keras membantu suaminya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yaitu dengan membuka usaha warung yang menjual gorengan seperti pisang goreng, tahu goreng, ketela goreng dan lain-lainnya. Warungnya ini melayani warga disekitarnya yang bekerja sebagai nelayan. Dalam sehari biasanya Suparmi memerlukan modal Rp 50.000,- sampai dengan Rp 75.000,- dan keuntungan yang bisa diperolehnya sekitar Rp.30.000,- sampai Rp 40.000,-. Dari usahanya ini Suparmi bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya juga termasuk untuk membesarkan cucunya yang masih balita yang ikut diasuhnya sampai saat ini. Dari pinjaman modal yang diperolehnya dari Dinari Suparmi memiliki harapan besar untuk mengembangkan usahanya agar bisa lebih maju lagi dan juga bisa untuk memperbaiki rumahnya yang masih sangat sederhana.

loans.use: Increase working capital to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of M. and lives in the small area of Kot Radha Kishan, Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 9 years. She is a mother of one son. His name is M.Nadeem and he is 3 years old. Her husband is a vegetable seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Razia baji is a housewife and takes care of her family. She has successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). Now she is applying for a loan to expand her husband's vegetable selling business.

Razia baji is joined in her loan group by four more members. Haseena baji and Kosar baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for milk selling. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is the wife of N. M. and lives in the small area of Kot Radha Kishan, in Kasur Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 12 years. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. None of her children go to school because of their poor financial condition. Her husband works in a kiln where he makes bricks. N. M. is the only breadwinner. He wants to improve his financial condition and therefore his wife has requested for a loan from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). He wants to advance money for use of the kiln to the kiln owner so that he is able to make bricks according to his need.

Ghulam is joined in her loan group by four more members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy milk for her milk business. Zareena baji wants a loan to give an advance to the kiln contractor for making bricks. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy furniture to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To give money in advance to the kiln owner for brick making

loans.name: Fajri's Group

texts.en:
Fajri baji is the wife of Z. K. and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Fajri baji lives in a small area named Kot Radha Kishan in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years. Her elder son works in a factory and runs his own grocery shop in the evening. Her next eldest son is in the 10th standard. Her elder daughter is in the 7th standard. Her younger daughter is in the 5th standard. Fajri baji's husband belongs to an agricultural profession. He rents land on contract from the owner. Fajri baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute of). Now she is applying for a loan to rent a land for growing seasonal fruit from the landowner.

Fajri baji is joined in her loan group by five other members. Safia baji and Khatoon baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Rushdan baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Heena baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To rent  land for seasonal fruit

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of Mr.A. and lives in the small area of Kot Radha Kishan in Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Sugran baji is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a donkey cart and uses this cart for loading. The next eldest son is involved in scrap work. Her husband has a business re-selling clothing and has been in this profession since last year. Sugran baji and her daughters prefer to stay at home and like to do domestic work. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothing to expand her husband's business.

Sugran baji is joined in her loan group by four other members. Gulzar baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling business. Kubran baji wants a loan to buy scrap (empty plastic bottles, papers) for her scrap business. Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Varn

texts.en:
Mrs. Varn C., 55, is a farmer who grows rice in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She has been growing rice since 1990. She is married and lives with her husband and five children. Two children work as bricklayers. The other one is a garment worker in Phnom Penh and helps provide support for her loan repayment.

In addition to her farming business, Varn has a business selling fertilizer to other farmers in her village. She purchases fertilizer from a wholesaler and resells it for a profit, providing the fertilizer to other farmers and collecting the money for it, plus interest, when they harvest the rice. Now it is time for her to run this business. Varn would like to request a loan to run the business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer from wholesaler and resell for profit

loans.name: Heanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heanh K. is the leader of a small group in Orchar Commune, Battambang Province. She purchases fish from fishermen and stock places, and then sells them in the town market. She has been selling since 1985, and her husband sells by transporting to customers' homes. Heanh has seven children. One is a carver and one works as a car repairer, and their income helps to support the family's expenses and loan repayment.

To grow her business, Heanh need to increase the stock of fish she has to sell, but she faces the obstacle of lacking capital, so she decided to request a loan to purchase fish to stock and sell.

Her group members include Mr. Tha C., who is requesting a loan to add to his money in order to purchase car tools for a car repair business; and Mrs. Phoeurn Y., who is a requesting a loan to purchase fish to stock her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Davlatbubi

texts.ru: Исломова Давлатбуби жительница города Вахдат. Замужем , имеет пятерых детей. 15 лет как уже занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Сама живет в кишлаке. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Наценки ставит небольшие , поэтому у нее много клиентов. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы привезти осенне-зимнюю одежду. Это поможет удовлетворить спрос покупателей , а так же ей самой заработать  в сезон. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davlatbubi I. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is married and has five children. She has been in the retail business for the last fifteen years. She has her own vending space in the central town market. She lives in the village. Davlatbubi brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe. Her prices are not too high and this is why she has a lot of customers. She wants to get a loan to buy clothes for the fall-winter season. This will help to satisfy the demands of her customers and also earn good profits during the season. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Muharamhon

texts.ru: Адалиева Мухарамхон проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Клиентка вместе со своим мужем имеют семейный бизнес. Имеют лепешечную , где пекут лепешки. Муж работает в пекарне , а она продает продукцию на базаре. Вместе они запланировали  получить кредит , чтобы закупить муку. Это поможет им бесперебойно производить лепешки  и продавать по тем же ценам . Так как цены на муку с каждым днем растут и цены на хлеб тоже увеличиваются. Погасить кредит смогут в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muharamhon A. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is married and has four children. She together with her husband have a family business. They own a bakery where they make flat breads. Her husband works in the bakery and she sells the products on the market. Together they have planned to get a loan to buy flour. This will help them continuously produce flat breads and keep selling them at the same price, because the price for flour grows every day and price for bread also increases. They can pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru: Тагаев Изатулло проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 40 лет. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Из-за того , что заработная плата  очень маленькая , ему приходится заниматься земледелием. Сеет злаковые культуры . В данный момент дехкане обрабатывают землю, подготавливая ее к посевному сезону. Поэтому сейчас Изатулло планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Получаемый урожай продает на рынке по низким ценам , что дает возможность населению употреблять дорогие продукты питания.
texts.en:
Izatullo T. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 40 years old, married and has five children. He has university level education and works as a teacher in a school. His salary is very small and he is forced to work in agriculture. He sows cereal crops and is currently cultivating the soil in Dekhan and preparing it for the sowing season. Izatullo plans to get a loan which he can use to buy seeds and fertilizer. He can pay off the loan within 12 months. He will then sell the harvest on the market at reasonable prices which will help the local population buy other food products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Меликов Абдулло житель города Вахдат. Женат . Имеет троих детей. Ему 68 лет , но 20 лет из них он занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин рядом с домом и продает продукты питания . Его дом находится в одном из отдаленных кишлаков города. Поэтому его магазин имеет большой спрос. Он помогает населению приобретать товар прямо там не выезжая за приделы кишлака. Цены у него доступные и очень низкие. Сейчас хочет расширить ассортимент товара , поэтому ему необходимо подготовить новые стелажи. Для этого он планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdullo M. lives in Vakhdat. Abdullo is 68 years old and is married with 3 children. He has been working in retail for the past twenty years. Abdullo owns a food store, which is located next to his house. As Abdullo's store is located in a remote village. As Abdullo's store gives people an opportunity to buy food without leaving the village, there is high demand for the food he sells. The prices in his store are fair and even low. Abdullo wants to increase his store's assortment, and in order to be able to do so, he would like to build new shelves. Therefore he is appying for a loan that he plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shelves

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.ru: Шапоатова Чинигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей . Работает на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. Торгует детской одеждой. Товар привозит и з города Душанбе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 27 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Хочет привезти к осенне-зимнему сезону теплую одежду. Это поможет ей не останавливать дело из-за перемены сезона. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев. Чинигуль 46 лет  и она имеет двоих детей. Муж умер десять лет назад.
texts.en:
Chinigul S. is a businesswoman. She sells children's clothes at the Hair market of Vakhdat town and has twenty-seven years of experience in this business. Chinigul buys clothes in Dushanbe. Chinigul would like to obtain a loan for increasing her cash flow. She wants to bring warm clothes in time for the fall and winter season. This would keep her business going without interruption. Chinigul plans to pay off the loan within 10 months. Chinigul is 46 years old and has two children. Her husband died ten years ago.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Mohbigul.

texts.ru: Давлатова Мохбигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 6 лет. Имеет магазин , который арендует , продает продукты питания. Бизнес дает неплохой доход , но для увеличения объема продаж необходимо финансовое вливание. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Ее магазин является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж не работает , а дети еще совсем маленькие. Но несмотря на это все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев
texts.en:
Давлатова Мохбигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 6 лет. Имеет магазин , который арендует , продает продукты питания. Бизнес дает неплохой доход , но для увеличения объема продаж необходимо финансовое вливание. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Ее магазин является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж не работает , а дети еще совсем маленькие. Но несмотря на это все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Увеличить товарооборот

loans.name: Mohbigul

texts.ru: Давлатова Мохбигуль бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 6 лет. Имеет магазин , который арендует , продает продукты питания. Бизнес дает неплохой доход , но для увеличения объема продаж необходимо финансовое вливание. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Ее магазин является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж не работает , а дети еще совсем маленькие. Но несмотря на это все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев
texts.en:
Mohbigul D. is a businesswoman. She has been involved in retail business for the past six years. Mohbigul sells food in a shop that she rents. The business is quite profitable but in order to increase cash flow, Mohbigul needs more capital. She would like to obtain a loan to increase the assortment of goods. Her shop is the only source of income for her family. Her husband does not work and her children are very little. The family is very friendly and merry. Mohbigul willl be able to pay off the loan within the next six months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.en:
D. Rukhsora is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. The difficult living conditions forced her husband to leave for Moscow to earn money. Rukhsora is an enterprising woman with a big desire of improving the quality of life of her family. She has been running her own small business for 2 years already. In her store, Rukhsora sells sweets, sugar, canning products, potted goods, soft drinks, and tea. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m.

The love of her children is the biggest reason Rukhsora makes the effort she does. Her daughter helps her in the store, registering the stock and serving clients.

Now her business is stable and her family's main source of income. To grow her business, she requests a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 US dollars). Rukhsora is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods, and increase the range of what she sells. She promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her. Rukhsora and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods at her store.

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.en:
M. Ilyos is 38 years old. He is married and has three children. Ilyos sells potted goods, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and many other grocery items. He rents a place at the local market to sell his goods and has been running his own small business for 2 years. His wife, who is pictured in the photo, helps Ilyos with the business, which is their main source of income. Ilyos works very hard to give his children a good education and to make them happy.

In order to cover the higher education expenses of his oldest son at the university, Ilyos is planning to increase his working capital to increase his range of goods. For this reason, Ilyos requests 2000 Somoni (600 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. He thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time. He is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Ilyos’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of goods for his business.

loans.name: Yorkinoy

texts.en:
O. Yorkinoy is 39 years old. She is married with three children. For more than 8 years, Yorkinoy has sold vegetables such as onions, potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Her older sons help Yorkinoy with the business. Yorkinoy begins her workday early in the morning. She buys vegetables wholesale from the neighboring country of Uzbekistan, in the village of Besharik, which enables her to sell her vegetables for a lower price. In the market she is known among people because of the attractive prices and friendly features. All this allows Yorkinoy’s business to generate a stable income for her family.

Now it is the busy season and her goods are in great demand. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new and fresh vegetables to sell, to earn more income so she can provide her children with a good education. For this purpose she requests 600 US dollars for the term of 8 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Yorkinoy’s business.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
O. Dilorom is 32 years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education. Dilorom has 3 years of experience preparing and selling dried apricots. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself.

Dilorom always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month.

Today Dilorom requests 600 USD for the term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing apricots so she can dry them, and sell more. With your help this will be possible. Dilorom expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase apricots to increase her range of goods for her business.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
S. Shahodat is 37 years old. She lives in Isfara town and is married with four adorable children. For a long time her husband couldn’t find a job, so he had to leave for Russia to earn money. For the last 6 months since her husband left, she has been the only breadwinner in her family.

Shahodat is a very hardworking and independent woman. For more than 6 years, she has sold dried apricots in the central local market. She is very experienced in this business. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself, with the help of her oldest son. Because she buys apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means.

All this allows Shahodat to be quite successful and it brings a stable income for her family. Today Shahodat requests 600 USD for the term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing apricots to dry, and be able to increase the range of dried apricots for selling. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing apricots to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.en:
T. Tukhta is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. For 5 years she has had a small business selling dried apricots. Dried fruits, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan, and they are good for health. There is a constant demand for this kind of food, and Tukhta's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for her family.

One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. With great sacrifice, she sends them to university so they can improve their quality of life. Today Tukhta requests 500 dollars for the term of 8 months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase apricots to dry to increase her business.

Tukhta expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Support this woman of much strength and courage.

loans.use: To purchase apricots to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.en:
A. Abdurakhmon is 48 years old and is married with three children. Abdurakhmon has been a farmer since 2003. He grows vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. When it is growing season, he works in the field from early morning till late evening. Five years ago, Abdurakhmon started growing vegetables on a plot that was 0.10 hectares (about 1/4 acre). Currently he is growing onions on 0.50 hectares (about 1 1/4 acres). Now, when the business is stable, Abdurakhmon believes that it shall be the main income for him. He foresees additional expenses as his dearest children are growing up, and accordingly their expenses are rising.

His beloved wife does whatever she can to help him, and together they have decided to increase the number of crops they plant so that they can generate a larger income. For this reason, Abdurakhmon requests 1000 Somoni (300 US dollars) for the term of 8 months. He is planning to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and combustive-lubricating materials for tools for growing his business. Abdurakhmon thanks everyone who trusts and supports him. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, combustive-lubricating materials.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
K. Saodat is 43 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of five children. Saodat is a farmer. She is a strong woman physically and spiritually. Each day she works diligently to make sure she takes good care of her crop. She has worked in agriculture for five years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land.

Together with her husband, Saodat is growing crops like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and carrots. They work from early morning until late evening. Each year they grow sufficient crops for the family to eat and to sell.

With her job, Saodat has been able to pay for the schooling of her 5 children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land. Saodat wants to cover the higher education expenses of her elder son as he has entered the university. With this purpose she’s asking for a loan 2000 Somoni (600 US dollars). She would like to use this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality and value of the yield and increase sales. She is planning to repay the loan in 8 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Saodat’s business. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Шодиева Нигина жительница города Яван. Возраст 35 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей растительного масла (хлопковое и льняное). Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Ее дело приносит доход , но кроме того она очень помогает населению. Так как этот продукт является основным продуктом питания  нашего населения. Поэтому ее оборотной суммы не хватает для того , чтобы обеспечить всех . По этой причине она решила получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Nigina S. lives in Yavan City. She is 35, married, and has two children. She sells vegetable oil (cotton oil and flax oil), and has been doing so for five years. Her business brings her income, but is also needed for the local population as this oil is one of the basic ingredients for the local diet. Her turnover totals are not sufficient in order for her to satisfy demand for her products, so she has decided to take out a loan to increase her turnover. She will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.ru: Саидджонова Хуснигуль хочет получить кредит для своего бизнеса . Она занимается торговлей овощами. Опыт работы в данной сфере 14 лет . Привозит товар на центральные рынки Явана , скупая их у  дехкан. Ей 48 лет , она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Ее бизнес –это основной источник дохода ее семьи. Поэтому она хочет развивать торговлю и расширять бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Husnigul S. would like to take out a loan for her business. She sells vegetables. For the last 14 years, she brings goods which she has purchased directly from the farmers to the central market in Yavan. She is 48 years old, married and has six children. Her business is the main source of income for her family, and therefore she wants to expand her business. She plans to repay her loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Одинаев Зафарджон проживает вместе со своей семьей в Яване. Работает частным предпринимателем . Занимается купле продажей крупно рогатого скота. Кроме того хочет купить еще одну корову и занять свою жену продажей молока. Это поможет получать дополнительные доходы для семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafarjon O. lives with his family in Yavan. He has a small business in which he trades in livestock. He would like to purchase an additional cow so that his wife can sell its milk. This will help them bring in additional income to support their family. He plans to repay the loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Хаитова Курбонгуль жительница города Яван. Живет очень далеко от центра , где практически нет транспорта и никаких сфер обслуживания. Она сама врач по образованию и на весь кишлак является единственным врачом. Кроме того имеет лицензию на продажу лекарств. Таким образом она помогает населению приобретать лекарства  и оказывать скорую медицинскую помощь. Сейчас она хочет получить кредит и открыть аптеку , это еще больше поможет населению. Кроме того , она сможет заработать и для своей семьи. У нее четверо детей , которые ходят в школу.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Qurbongul H. lives in Yavan City. She lives far from the center of the city where there is practically no transportation services and almost no services whatsoever. She was trained as a doctor and for her entire district is the only medical professional. In addition, she has a license to sell medication. This way, she can provide the much needed assistance to the population to purchase medication and to provide emergency medical services. She would like to take out a loan to open a pharmacy, as this would further help her district, and it would help her provide for her family. She has four children who are in school. She plans to repay the loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medications

loans.name: Riana

texts.id:
28-year old Riana is the mother of two children, Kanza and Kelia. She offers laundry services as her business activity. She has been doing this for a number of years, relying on her washing machine and her iron as her tools/aids. Usually the customers who use her services are those pressed for time because they are busy working or because they don’t have maids, such as boarding school children or college students. Her activity is managed out of a rented house and her earnings are dependent on the volume of customers. Typically her daily turnover is Rp.20.000-Rp.40.000 (approx. US$2-$4). Her husband Handi works as a merchant, and his income helps to meet the household's needs. Riana really hopes to be given a loan to carry forward her laundry business and also help her husband in his efforts. Riana plans to use the earnings from her business to pay school fees for their two children. At this time the older child is already in elementary school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Riana (28 tahun), adalah ibu dari 2 orang anak Kanza dan Keila. Kegiatan sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penyedia jasa cuci pakaian atau laundry. Usaha ini sudah dijalaninya selama beberapa tahun, dengan mengandalkan mesin cuci dan seterika sebagai alay bantunya. Biasanya pelanggan yang menggunkan ajasanya adalah mereka yang tidak memiliki waktu untuk mencuci karena terlalu sibuk bekerja atau tidak memiliki pembantu seperti anak kost atau mahasiswa. Usaha ini dijalaninya dirumah kontrakan dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu tergantung banyaknya pelanggan. Biasanya berkisar Rp.20.000 – Rp.40.000 perhari. Pekerjaan suaminya Handi sebagai pedagang cukup membantu juga dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumahnya. Riana sanagt mengahrapkan diberi pinjaman untuk menjalankan bisnis laundrynya dan juga membantu usaha suaminya. Penghasilan yang didapat rencananya dipakai untuk membayar biaya sekolah kedua anaknya. Saat ini anaknya yang sulung sudah duduk dibangku Sekolah Dasar.

loans.use: To purchase an additional washing machine and also to help her husband

loans.name: Bibisoroy

texts.ru: Хушаева Бибисорой жительница одного из дальних кишлаков города Яван. Возраст 33 года , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается домохозяйством. Но в осенне-зимний сезон имеет свое дело. Осенью  она консервирует салаты из помидор , томат и огурцы. После приготовления заготовок , начиная с сентября начинает их продавать. Бизнес длится восемь месяцев до появления свежих овощей. В этом году хочет увеличить объем производимой продукции , для чего и планирует получить кредит. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibisoroy H. lives in one of the remote villages of the town of Yavan. She is 33 years old, married and has four children. She is a housewife and does her own business during the winter/fall season. In the fall, she preserves vegetables such as tomatoes and cucumbers in cans. She starts selling the ready product starting in September. The business lasts for eight months until the season for fresh vegetables starts. Bibisoroy wants to increase her production volume this year and this is why she applied for a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans and vegetables

loans.name: Mansurhon

texts.ru: Кетманов Мансурхон житель города Яван.Работает учителем в средней школе. Учит детей  истории и географии. Параллельно занимается торговлей. Имеет место на рынке «Тиджорат» , где торгует канцелярскими товарами. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 16 лет. Дело дает неплохой доход. Но работа сезонная и только в сезон можно хорошо заработать. Поэтому он решил получить кредит  и использовать для ввоза товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.У Мансура большая и дружная семья. Он женат и имеет семерых детей. Дети еще школьники. Из них четыре девочки и три мальчика.
texts.en:
Mansurhon K. lives in the town of Yavan. He works as a teacher in the secondary school and teaches history and geography. He also does his own business and has a vendor space in the local market Tidjorat where he sells stationary and office supplies. He has been doing this business which brings him a decent income for the past sixteen years. But this work is seasonal and the profits are made during a specific time. This is why he decided to apply for a loan to bring in more merchandise. Mansurhon plans to pay off the loan within 12 months. He has a big and friendly family. He is married and has seven children who are still in school. They are four girls and three boys.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Junaydullo

texts.ru: Зиеев Джунайдулло житель Явана. Занимается бизнесом . Торгует  национальными мужскими халатами – чапаны , хиджабы  и тюбитейки. Занимается торговлей уже 3, 5 года.
