This does not allow her to earn a good profit from her business to use to support her family. To get herself out of this rut, she is requesting a loan for her business. The success of this plan will allow her to have financial independence.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital for her sale of hot peppers and oil

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Née en 1967 à Tokplitomé, Madame A. Houndjénouko vit aujourd’hui auprès de son mari dans le village de Tékponou II. Mère de cinq enfants, elle mène le commerce de béliers. 

Elle achète ces béliers et les revend de marché en marché. Selon elle, cette activité est très rentable mais à condition que les fonds soient disponibles. Ainsi, cette dame sollicite un crédit pour faire face valablement à cette activité et améliorer son revenu.

Ceci aura un impact positif sur la vie de tous les jours de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Tokplitomé, Mrs Houndjénouko A. currently lives with her husband in the villge of Tékponou II. The mother of five children, she manages a business of rams (buying and selling). She purchases rams and re-sells them at the saturday market. According to her, this activity is very profitable but only if funds are available. Thus, this woman is asking for a loan in order to continue to take part in this activity and increase her revenues. This would have a positive impact on the every day life of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling rams

loans.name: Agossouvi

texts.fr:
Né en 1953 à Tékponou, Monsieur A. Agossouvi réside aujourd’hui dans le même village avec toute sa famille. Père de dix enfants ; il est un brave commerçant. Il circule de marché en marché pour vendre des moutons qu’il a achetés. 

Mais ceci lui est possible grâce à l’argent des usuriers ; ce qui pèse énormément sur lui et après remboursement, il  ne tire aucun profit. Il sollicite un crédit qu’il compte rembourser en 14 mois.

La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille à travers l’amélioration de son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1953 in Tékponou, Mr. Agossouvi A. is living today in that same village with his whole family. The father of 10 children, he is a respected merchant. He goes from one market to the next to sell the sheep he has bought.

But he is only able to do this thanks to funds borrowed from loan sharks. This weighs heavily on him and after he reimburses the sum he has borrowed, he does not manage to make a profit. He is asking for a loan that he intends to reimburse over 18 months.

The realization of this plan will allow him to better support his family with his increased income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of sheep

loans.name: Mawutodji Ben

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Mawutodji Ben est marié et a en charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunité d’affaire, il investi son économie issue du commerce et agriculture dans la construction d’un local pour l’implantation d’un moulin  à maïs qui est quasi inexistant dans sa localité.

Devant ses moyens insuffisants, monsieur A. Mawutodji Ben sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre de réaliser ce projet. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et ses revenus afin de couvrir les besoins scolaires et sociaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawutodji Ben A. is married and has 5 children that all go to school. He is very talented in identifying business opportunities. He has decided to invest the money he has saved through his business and farming into the construction of a cornmill, a luxury that does not yet exist in his region. Because the money he has saved is insufficient to achieve his goal, Mawutodji is seeking to obtain a loan that will help him bring this project to fruition. This will provide him with additional income that will help him provide for his children so that they do well both in school and in their social life.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a cornmill

loans.name: Akouét&eacute

texts.fr:
Né à Lomé en 1974, Monsieur K. Akouété Yves vit actuellement à Toulassi Condji à Attitogon du côté de sa femme et ses quatre enfants. Instituteur de profession, il accompagne son travail avec le commerce.

En période d’abondance, il achète les céréales qu’il stocke pour une revente. En cette période de pénuries, Monsieur K. Yves voulant s’ouvrir sur d’autres marchés de céréales, sollicite un crédit pour s’approvisionner en maïs surtout.

Après la vente, il dégage un revenu qui lui permettra de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1974, Mr. Akouété Yves K. presently lives in Toulassi Condji in Attitogon with his wife and his four children. A teacher by profession, he has a commercial business on the side.

In periods of plenty, he buys cereals which he then stores for re-sale. As there are presently shortages, Mr. K. would like to be open to other grain markets, so he is requesting a loan, most especially to stock up on corn (maize).

After the sale, he will earn an income which will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storing and re-selling cereals

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
Née à Attitogon en 1978, Madame A. Delphine vit actuellement à Blama condji avec ses trois enfants et son mari paysan. Cultivatrice elle aussi, Delphine associe à ce travail, la production d’huile de palme. 

Reconnue pour la bonne qualité de son huile, elle n’est plus à la hauteur des demandes de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les noix de palme afin de produire de l’huile.

Après la vente, le bénéfice lui servira à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine A. was born in 1978 in Attitogon. She currently lives with her husband and three children in Blama. Her husband is a farmer. Delphine is in business of making palm oil. She is well known for the quality of her product and is having trouble keeping up with the demand. In order to be able to satisfy her clients she is seeking to obtain a loan in order to purchase palm tree seeds in order to make more oil. Increasing turnover will help her better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production of palm tree oil

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila runs a little vending facility where she sells a variety of clothing items for children and women. She rents a location in a mall in downtown Nikolaev. Ludmila has been in business for 9 years.

Ludmila is very friendly and cheery. Because of her cheerfulness and good service, her total number of customers is consistently growing. Reasonable prices, hard work, and tenacity have helped her enterprise reach sustainability and success.

Loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine are another reason why her business has been so successful. While working with our organization, Ludmila has been able to increase her sales volume. Ludmila has requested a loan in the amount of 3000 Grivnas to purchase a variety of clothing items that she will sell in her vending location. This loan will help her re-supply her inventory and encourage more customers to come and buy from her. Increased sales will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Joël  Yao

texts.fr:
Marié et ayant cinq personnes à charge, Monsieur A. Joël Yao  a pour activité principale la commercialisation des porcs.

 Possédant une parfaite expérience de plus de douze ans, l’exercice de cette fonction, il aimerait étendre ses zones d’approvisionnement pour pouvoir répondre aux demandes de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter avec temps. 

Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un appui financier pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif ceci atteint, il améliorera son revenu qui se répercutera sur son niveau de vie de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Joël Yao A. is married and is providing for five people. He is in business of raising pigs. He has been in this business for the past 12 years. He would like to increase turnover so as to better satisfy the demand for his goods. He is seeking to obtain a loan that will allow him to do so and as a result help him take better care of his family.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of pigs

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has been running her retail business for seven years. She started as a small vendor in Nikolaev. Her vending location is in the central street of her hometown which is very convenient for customers who shop downtown Nikolaev. Galina sells jewellery that each of her female customers can afford. Presently, she has about $10000 invested in inventory. Her income is about $1400 each month.

Galina would like to keep her income stable and increase her turnover capital which is why she is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to be repaid in two months. We believe consistent demand, outstanding credit history and entrepreneurial enthusiasm will guarantee loan repayment without any delinquencies.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou D. is married and has 4 children. She would like this loan to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her family by engaging in the rearing of goats and sheep. She intends to buy goats and sheep, which she will then re-sell, particularly around the time of holiday festivals. She will reimburse this loan in a single payment at the end of six months

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Bintou D. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille, en s’activant dans l’embouche caprine et ovine. Elle compte acheter des chèvres et des moutons qu’elle va revendre surtout à l’approche des fêtes. Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell goats and sheep

loans.name: Anasnda

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1975, Madame K. Anasnda vit actuellement à Kpémé avec trois personnes à  sa charge. Elle exerce le commerce de charbon de bois. C’est d’ailleurs cette activité qui lui procure de revenus. Mariée, madame K. Anasnda veut aujourd’hui aller acheter son charbon au grand nord du TOGO. 

Pour ce faire, elle nécessite un renforcement de moyen financier. Elle espère ce crédit pour satisfaire son rêve. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anasnda K. was born in 1975 in Lomé. She is married. Now she and her three dependents live in Kpémé. She is in business of selling wood charcoal. This business is her main and only source of income. Anasnda wants to buy charcoal in the north, in TOGO. For this purpose she would like to obtain a loan. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve her goal of improving her family's financial situation.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reselling charcoal.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a single mom with one grown son. She is in the business of selling sweets, candy, and cookies in the central city market in Melitopol. Every holiday gives Ludmila a great chance to get extra sales and keep her business stable.

Ludmila has been in this business for quite a while, almost 15 years total. She knows all the wholesale distributors and that helps her get high quality products at reasonable prices. Her good managerial skills help her be a successful salesperson. Ludmila has been a client of Nadiya Ukraine for a couple of years. She has never had a single late payment since she started using lending services.

Ludmila needs 5000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. Since she does not charge high prices, she has many loyal customers who trust her and keep coming to buy yummy goodies at her kiosk. The loan will give Ludmila's business a good economic boost and will help meet the high demand for her products this season. Moreover, the loan will give Ludmila a chance to buy a new vending location which she has been planning to do for quite a while.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending spot

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une veuve de 56 ans avec à sa charge 03 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter de l’arachide pour la transformer en pate et la revendre. ce prêt est remboursable au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .
texts.en:
Mariama Diarissso is a 56-year-old widow with three children to take care of. She would like to use this loan to strengthen her business, which consists of buying peanuts to turn into peanut butter for onward sale. This loan is to be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts to turn into peanut butter that can be sold at retail

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is a businessman from the small town of Khoost, Western Ukraine. He offers transportation services in his home town and its vicinity. Petro's business is the main source of income for his family of four. He started this business 4 years ago. Presently, he's making $600 in net profit each month.

Petro is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to install new type of running gear in his vehicle to reduce his running costs. He believes better quality equipment will help him have fewer repairs, glitches and less down-time. We believe Petro's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To install liquefied gas running gear in his vehicle

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Agée de 55 ans, Madame K. Ablavi est demeurante à Kpémé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. C’est une dame très dynamique qui exerce le commerce du charbon de bois depuis maintenant vingt ans.

C’est une activité qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement et qui est devenu pratiquement sa première source de revenu. Vu la variation des prix du charbon sur le marché, elle prévoit déjà une pénurie dans quelques mois surtout quand la saison des plus va battre son plein. 

Pour ce faire elle voudrait faire un stock pour revendre dans la période de pénurie ; ce qui l’amène à solliciter un crédit
texts.en:
Mrs. Ablavi K., 55, lives in Kpémé. She is married and the mother of two children. She is a very dynamic lady who has been selling charcoal for 20 years now.

This is a business in which she is very knowledgeable and which has become her primary source of income. In view of the variation in the price of charcoal on the market, she is already foreseeing a shortage of charcoal, especially when the height of the rainy season arrives.

She would like to put aside a stock to sell during the period of shortage. That is the reason why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: laying in stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two sons. Eight years ago she started a small business selling household items in the central marketplace in Khoost. She decided to try something different that would help her earn enough to meet the family's needs. Currently, she is making about $1000 in gross revenue.

Oksana is very client-friendly and cheerful. Her natural talent of making every customer feel welcome and her willingness to best serve customers' needs have ensured the success of her small business. Oksana would like to get a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of merchandise for her kiosk. Financial assistance will give Oksana's business a good economic boost and help her meet the needs and demands of her customers. Oksana is hoping that one day her hard work and determination will help her fulfill her dream of opening one more vending facility in Khoost.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Hary

texts.fr: Hary Diakhaté,51 ans, veuve avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l'huile de palme qu'elle va revendre au détail. Avec les revenus tirés de son commerce, elle entretien sa famille. <b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Hary Kiakhaté, aged 51 and a widow with three children to take care of, has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé village bank for five and a half years. She wants a loan in order to buy palm oil, which she will sell at retail. She supports her family with the income she makes from her business. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Sountou

texts.fr: Sountou B., 38 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son petit commerce. Elle pourra ainsi acheter des légumes qu’elle va revendre en détail sur sa table de commerce installée devant sa maison. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Sountou Balda, aged 38, is married with three children to take care of. She is requesting a loan to strengthen her small business. She will thus be able to purchase vegetables which she will sell at retail from her business stand set up outside her home. She will repay the loan after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables from a small stand

loans.name: Gérard

texts.fr:
Marié et ayant six personnes à charge, Monsieur A. Gérard est né à Agbanto le 29 novembre 1959. Il est spécialisé dans la production de la canne à sucre depuis plus de 08 ans.

Cependant, compte tenu de sa faible capacité de production imputable à ses ressources financières limitées, il ne parvient pas à satisfaire les besoins élémentaires des membres de sa famille. Pour assurer une meilleure condition de vie à son ménage, il se propose d’agrandir sa surface cultivable.

Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit devant lui permettre de dégager un bénéfice consistant de son activité.
texts.en:
Gérard A. was born on the 29th of November, 1959. He is married is providing for 6 people. He has been in business of growing sugar cane for the past 8 years. However, because he is limited in his financial resources his production capacity is very limited and prevents him from taking care of even basic needs that his large family has. In order to be able to provide a better lifestyle for his family he would like to increase the amount of land on which he grows his crops. He is seeking to obtain a loan that will permit him to do so.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing and selling sugar cane

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi P. is a businessman from Nikopol, Ukraine, where he rents a small facility to manufacture furniture for sale and offer furniture repair/upholstery services. Vitalyi is very hard-working. He has been working really hard for two years and presently he has about $4000 in inventory. 

Vitalyi is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase raw materials and fabric for his business. We believe that his hard work and common sense, in combination with financial assistance, will help Vitalyi achieve his goals and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and fabric for his furniture business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Agé de 56 ans, S. Kokou est un enseignant admis à la retraite domicilié à Aklakou. Sa maigre pension de retraite qui lui est versé irrégulièrement ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux besoins de se femmes et  des vingt personnes qu’il a à sa charge. 

Pour cela, il s’est acheté un moulin à grain qui constitue pour lui une source de revenus additionnels. Dans la perspective de tirer un maximum de profit de l’exploitation du moulin, il envisage de faire le stockage de gasoil en temps d’abondance pour en faire usage en période de soudure. 

C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit pour constituer le stock de gasoil.
texts.en:
At 56 years of age, Kokou S. is a retired teacher living in Aklakou. The small retirement pension which he receives irregularly does not allow him to meet the needs of his wives and his 20 dependents.

In response to this, he bought a grain mill, which serves to supplement his income. In order to generate the most possible profit from the mill, he would like to stock up on gas oil fuel [to operate the mill] during periods of surplus, so that he can use it in times of shortage.

He is requesting a loan to establish his stock of gasoil.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of gas oil fuel

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Né en 1966 à Aklakou, Monsieur K. Anani est marié et a huit personnes à charge. Depuis 15 ans, il s’est spécialisé dans le stockage d’huile de palme et du gari en temps d’abondance et de leur vente en période de soudure.

La commercialisation de ses aliments très consommés au sud du TOGO, lui permettait d’assurer à son ménage, le minimum vital.

Mais aujourd’hui, son bénéfice ne lui permet plus d’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants. Pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat aux fins de maximiser de bénéfice et sortir sa famille de l’extrême pauvreté, il sollicite un crédit.

Ceci lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu et de dégager un bénéfice consistant dans la mesure où ce fonds lui servira de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Anani K. is married with eight dependents. For 15 years, he has specialized in the storage of palm oil and gari (manioc flour) during times of surplus, and sales in times of shortage.

Selling these foods, which are widely consumed in southern Togo, has allowed him to provide the minimum necessary support to his household.

But today, his income does not allow him to provide the best living conditions for his children. To increase his purchasing power in order to maximize his profit and get his family out of extreme poverty, he is requesting a loan.

This will allow him to have a secure income and make a solid profit since this financing will be used as working capital.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stocks of flour and palm oil

loans.name: Agbalè F&eacu

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de cinq enfants à charge, Madame A. Agbalè Félicia, née en 1956 à Avévé est revendeuse de gâteau depuis 15 ans.

Bien que sa clientèle augmente au jour le jour, sa capacité de production demeure la même car elle ne dégage pas une marge bénéficiaire important devant lui permettre de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

Dans la perspective de sortir son ménage du seuil de pauvreté, elle sollicite un crédit afin de rentabiliser plus son activité.

Ce prêt qui servira aussi de fonds de roulement lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children for whom she is still responsible, Mrs. Agbalè Félicia A., born in 1956 in Avévé, has been selling cakes for 15 years.

Although her clientele is growing on a daily basis, her production capacity has stayed the same because her profit margin is not high enough to allow her to support her children.

With the aim of lifting her family away from the threshold of poverty, she is requesting a loan so as to make her business more profitable.

This loan will serve as business capital allowing her to make her income secure.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour and oil

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Née en 1929 à Aklakou, Madame D. Ayélé est revendeuse de gâteau depuis 30 ans. Elle est mariée et a deux personnes à charge qu’elle entretient avec le maigre bénéfice qu’elle tire de son activité.

Actuellement, sa clientèle a presque quadruplé mais sa capacité de production de gâteau reste constante en raison du faible fonds de commerce dont elle dispose. Pour sortir sa famille du seuil de pauvreté, elle décide d’augmenter sa capacité de production aux fins de maximiser de bénéfice en satisfaisant toute sa clientèle.

Pour y parvenir, elle sollicite un prêt devant lui servir également de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Born in 1929 in Aklakou, Mrs. Ayélé D. has been selling cakes for 30 years. She is married and has two dependents whom she supports with the meager profits she makes from her business.

Currently, her clientele has almost quadrupled, but her cake production has not changed due to her small operating budget. To improve her family's poverty-level status, she has decided to increase her production capacity in order to increase profits while meeting the needs of all of her clients.

To achieve this, she is requesting a loan that will also provide her with working capital.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour and oil

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucia M. M. has been a client of Emprender since 2002 and she has worked in this area for 18 years. Her husband is a bricklayer and he helps her pay her loan payments, and they have two children at home. In addition to selling food, she sells traditional products that she buys on the Peruvian border and then resells in the city of La Paz. To date she has made her payments responsibly and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La sra, Lucia M. M. es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002 y trabaja en ese rubro desde hace unos 18 años. Su esposo es albañil, quien le colabora en el pago del crédito, tiene dos hijos aún dependientes. Además de la venta de comida, se dedica a repartir productos tradicionales, que compra en la frontera con el Perú y comercializa en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. A la fecha paga sus cuotas con responsabilidad y puntualmente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teko

texts.fr:
Agée de 40 ans, Madame K. Teko est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Sa famille vit des maigres bénéfices de son activité de préparation et de vente de riz.

Face à l’augmentation des charges du ménage, à la paupérisation continuelle et aux difficiles conditions d’existence de celui ci, Teko décide d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat en sollicitant un crédit.

Ceci lui permettra de maximiser de bénéfice afin d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Teko K. is 40 years old and married with three children. Her family lives on the small profits from her business making and selling rice.

Because of the increase of her household expenses, the continual impoverishment and her difficult living conditions, Teko decided to increase her buying power by requesting a loan.

This will enable her to maximize her profits so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, dough, oil and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 1 unit, each, of rize, flour, sugar, 1 drum of cooking oil, 10 pounds of baking soda, 10 sacks of coal, 1 unit of salt, and 1 dozen packages of instant coffee.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
Madame H. Bernadette est née en 1950 à Agbanakin. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle pratique le commerce d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 25 ans.

Actuellement, son pouvoir d’achat très limité ne lui permet plus de faire face aux multiples besoins élémentaires de sa famille. C’est dans la perspective d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin de dégager un bénéfice conséquent pour répondre aux besoins sans cesse croissants de ses enfants qu’elle sollicite un prêt.

Ce crédit lui servira également de fonds de roulement indispensable à l’exercice de son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Madame Bernadette H. was born in 1950 in Agbanakin. The married mother of four children, she has traded in basic foodstuffs for more that 25 years.

As of now, her limited purchasing power no longer allows her to meet her family's many basic needs. She is requesting a loan with an eye to improving her purchasing power, in order to turn larger profits and meet the ever-growing needs of her children.

This loan will likewise serve as working capital vital to her commercial activity.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various foodstuffs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is an excellent client. She lives with two of her children, an elderly sister who has health problems, and three grandchildren who were left orphaned. She is the supporter of the home, a task she completes with great responsibility. This is her second loan with Emprender, and the first was promptly repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita es una excelente cliente, vive con dos D. sus hijos y una hermana anciana y con problemas D. salud, además D. sus tres nietos que quedaron huerfanos D. madre. Es el sostén del hogar, tarea que cumple con mucha responsabilidad. Este es su segúndo crédito en Emprender, ya que el primero fue cancelado puntualmente.

loans.use: Increased capital for her business and home construction.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans, Mme O. Denise est mariée et mère de quatre enfants .Ayant adopté la polygamie comme régime matrimonial, son mari se trouve incapable de s’occuper convenablement de sa famille nombreuse. O. se lança donc dans le commerce de bouillie de maïs et de jus de fruits ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis 15 ans et qui est très rentable. 
      
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de vélos et recrutement d’agents pour le commerce ambulant de jus en plus de stockage de céréales pour la préparation de bouillie. Cela lui permettra de joindre les deux bouts.
texts.en:
At the age of 41, Madame Denise O. is married and the mother of four children. Her husband, having adopted a polygamous approach to marriage, is unable to properly care for his large family. Therefore, Mrs. O. went into the business of preparing and selling porridge and fruit juice; this has been her occupation for fifteen years, and it is highly profitable. To meet the demands of her consistently growing clientele, she is requesting a loan to purchase bicycles and to hire sales representatives in order to mobilize her business. The remainder of the loan will go to increasing her stock of grain. This will allow her to make ends meet.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of grains for preparation of porridge and purchase bicycles

loans.name: Rosa

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 06 enfants, A. Rosa est née à Lomé en 1969. Avec 04 personnes à charges elle a excellé dans le commerce de chaussures. Très dynamique et dévoué elle lutte pour l’éducation de ses enfants. Dotée d’une bonne capacité de gestion, elle a entreprit le commerce de chaussures. Commerce qui lui a réussi jusqu’à ce jour.  
     
Cependant, vu la demande de plus en plus forte, A. manque de moyens pou accroître son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son chiffre et veiller à  l éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rosa A. was born in Lomé in 1969. She is married and the mother of six children. With four dependents, she excels in the shoe business. Highly dynamic and dedicated, she fights for her children's education. Equipped with a knack for management, she began trading in shoes, an occupation in which she has been successful to this day. Nevertheless, in the face of increasing demand, Mrs. A. lacks the means to grow her business. She is requesting a loan to increase her turnover and to look after her children's education.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of shoes

loans.name: Khadi

texts.fr: Mme M., mere de famille, vend des produits locaux transformes et non. Grace a cette activite, elle parvient a satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Maintenant Mme M. veut un pret pour renforcer son stock notamment en mangues, caba, huile de palme...
texts.en:
Mrs. M. is the mother of a family, and she sells local products, both transformed and untransformed. Thanks to this business, she manages to provide for her needs and those of her family. Mrs M. now seeks a loan to bolster her stock, in particular of mangoes, caba fruits, palm oil...

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her stock of mangoes, caba fruits and palm oil

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosario U. used to sell cheese and lamb meat in Tiahuanacu until she was in her twenties in order to help her mother support her five brothers and sisters. With the conviction of seeking something better she traveled to La Paz city 27 years ago with her husband, looking for a better future. Her husband began as a masonry apprentice, earning what was needed to proviD. food for his wife and daughter. Rosario helped selling cheese that she would bring from Tiahuanacu. In this way she was able to increase her income little by little. Today she has a wiD. variety of products that she sells, such as rice, sugar, lamb, and other items that she sells traveling to areas of our city, and in this way she contributes to maintaining her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Rosario U., vendía queso y carne D. cordero en Tiahuanacu hasta sus veinte años; para ayudar a su mamá a mantener a su cinco hermanos menores. Con la conviccion D. buscar algo mejor emprenD. su viaje a la ciudad D. La Paz hace 27 años con su pareja, buscando un mejor futuro, su esposo empezo como ayudante D. albañil, ganando lo necesario para dar D. comer a su esposa y a su hija, Doña Rosario ayudaba vendiendo queso que traía D. Tiahuanacu. Así logró mejorar sus ingresos poco a poco.Actualmente ella tiene una gama mas amplia D. productos que comercializa, tales como el arroz, azucar, cordero y otros que venD. viajando a pueblos D. nuestra Ciudad, D. esta forma colabora al la mantención del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mémouna

texts.fr:
Mme E. Mémouna est née à Lomé en 1950. Divorcée de son mari, elle s’est retrouvée avec 06 personnes à sa seule charge. N’ayant reçu aucune formation ni scolaire ni professionnelle, c’est la débrouille qui lui permet de vivre et de s’occuper de sa famille. L’activité de taxi moto étant très rentable dans la localité, Mme E. désire tenter sa chance dans ce domaine. 
      
Elle sollicite alors un crédit pour l’achat de taxi moto qu'elle va affreter à son frère pour transport. Elle espère ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Mémouna E. was born in Lomé in 1950. Divorced from her husband, she found herself with six persons to care for, by herself. Having never received any formal schooling or professional training, she manages nonetheless to survive and take care of her family. Mrs E. would like to try to work in the field of motorcycle taxis which are very profitable in her area. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle taxi which she will charter to her brother for transport. She is hoping in this manner to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Agée de 56 ans, A. Béatrice est une femme entreprenante qui se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Mariée, elle a 09 personnes à sa charge et fait le commerce de yaourt et de petits condiments depuis 30 ans déjà. Les maigres revenus qu’elle en tire ne lui permettent pas de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille nombreuse. 

Son mari vieillissant ne dispose plus de force nécessaires pour exercer son métier d’agriculteur. A. se retrouve donc seul face à des responsabilités énormes. 
      
Elle a besoin de soutien à travers un crédit pour promouvoir son activité   .
texts.en:
Béatrice A. is 56 years old and an enterprising woman who struggles for the success of her children. Married, she cares for nine people by selling yogurt and small condiments during the last 30 years. Her meager earnings do not allow her to take care of the needs of her large family. Her aging husband does not have the necessary strength to practice his job of farmer. A. therefore finds herself facing large responsibilities alone. She needs support by means of a loan to promote her activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Akueté

texts.fr:
Mr N. Akueté est née à Gunoukopé en 1954. Résidant à Kpémé, il est marié et père de 04 enfants. En plus de ses derniers il a 04 personnes à charges. Mr N. exerce le métier de couturier depuis 30 ans. LA concurrence et  l’abondance de friperie ont réduit considérablement sa clientèle. 
     
Aujourd’hui il arrive difficilement à s’occuper de sa famille. Aussi, décida t-il de diversifier son activité. 
      
Il aimerait avoir un crédit pour se lancer dans la production et la vente de pommade médicinale. Cela lui permettra  d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr N. Akueté was born in Gunoukopé in 1954. He lives in Kpémé, is married and the father of four children. He is also caring for four other persons. Mr N. has been a designer/tailor for the last 30 years, but competition and abundance of second hand clothes has considerably reduced his clientele. Currently, he is having difficulties caring for his family. Therefore, he is looking to diversify is job. He would like to have a loan in order to begin production and sales of natural medicines such as creams. This will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of natural medicines (creams)

loans.name: Colleko

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, Mme C. Colleko est une femme qui a su concilier  sa vie de femme au foyer avec celle de son activité principale qui est le commerce de charbon. Agée de 43 ans aujourd’hui elle a acquis une expérience nécessaire à la réussite de son commerce qu’elle exerce depuis 08 ans. 
     
Cependant, les revenues qu’elle en tire sont négligeables faces aux énormes responsabilités familiales qu’elle affronte. Cette situation étant aggravée par le manque de fond suffisant pour la constitution de stock de charbon.
     
Elle sollicite n crédit pour rehausser son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Married with four children, Mrs. Colleko C. is a woman who managed to combine her life as a housewife with her business of selling charcoal. She is 43 years old and has gained the experience necessary for success with her business, which she has been running for 8 years. However, the revenue she makes is negligible due to the enormous financial responsibilities that she handles for her family. This situation is aggravated by a lack of sufficient funds needed to purchase her charcoal supply. She is requesting this loan so she can increase her profit.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and selling of charcoal

loans.name: Viviana Marisol

texts.es:
Señora Viviana lives in the area called September 14th in Garita in Lima. She has been dedicated to selling products for the home for 14 years. She lives with her husband, who doesn't have a fixed source of income. They have 3 children who depend directly on Viviana. She also supports 2 grandchildren from her oldest daughter, who is a single mother. She works Monday-Saturday for more than 12 hours each day. The conditions in which she lives aren't very comfortable, but one can tell that there is a lot of love in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La sra. Viviana, vive en la zona de 14 de septiembre, Garita de Lima; se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar desde hace 14 años; vive con su marido, que no tiene una fuente de ingresos fija, ambos tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen directamente de ella, asimismo mantiene a 2 nietos de la hija mayor quien es madre soltera. Trabaja de lunes a sabado más de 12 horas diarias. Las condiciones en las que vive no son muy cómodas, pero se puede percibir que en ese hogar existe mucho amor.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Kossivi est né le 17/12/1984  à Atsansi –Djita dans la préfecture de vo. Marié et père d’un enfant, il est agriculteur. 
       
A l’aide de la vente des produits agricoles, il arrive tant bien que mal à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il en associe la vente des intrants agricoles et de produits phytosanitaires. 
        
Ainsi pour cette campagne agricole, il sollicite un  crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais pour revendre afin de tirer un minimum de profit.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossivi G. was born on December 17, 1984 in Atsansi-Djita in the Vo prefecture. He is a farmer and is married with one child. He meets his family’s needs as best as he can by selling agricultural products. He sells agricultural inputs and phytosanitary products. He is requesting a loan which will allow him to purchase fertilizer for reselling so he can make a profit.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and selling of fertilizer and phytosanitary products

loans.name: Mafouss

texts.fr: M. S. est un exploitant de cyber cafe et il vente aussi des CD et cassettes. Son Cyber fonctionne a temps plein ; Pour faire a la demande, qui est de plus en plus croissante a l'ere des NTIC, il demande un pret. Il pense ainsi augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et par ricochet son benefice.
texts.en:
Mr. S. is an Internet café manager and he also sells CDs and tapes. His café operates full time. He seeks a loan to meet demand, which is ever increasing in the era of NICT (New Information and Communication Technologies). In doing so, he thinks he will improve his revenues, and therefore his profits.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his Internet café

loans.name: Jessenia Melina

texts.es:
Melina belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank located in Jr. Elmer Faucet in the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and is the mother of one young son. Her husband does graphic design work. Melina decided to invest the first loan of S/. 300 she received from Manuela Ramos in a bookstore. The bookstore business also gives her the opportunity to have a photocopier and computers so that he can carry out graphic design projects, and she is very happy that it is going well for him. With this loan of S/ 2,500, which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy supplies to sell in her bookstore such as notebook, pencils, bond paper, poster board and others. Melina feels very happy and her eagerness is to continue growing and be a businesswoman. She is thankful for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos gives her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Melina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Elmer Faucet, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años es madre de 1 pequeño hijo, su esposo realiza trabajos de diseños gráficos. Melina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en una librería. El negocio de la librería también le da la oportunidad de tener una copiadora y computadoras para que así realice trabajos de diseños gráficos de tal forma que esta muy contenta por que le esta yendo bastante bien. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará útiles para implementar su librería como; (cuadernos, lapiceros, papel bond, cartulinas y otros). Melina se siente muy feliz, su anhelo es seguir creciendo y ser empresaria. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que le da Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and other items.

loans.name: Agomessi

texts.fr:
Madame A. Agomessi est née en 1962 à Atsansi – Djita . Elle est marié et mère de quatre enfants. Son mari cultivateur arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de la famille un grande partie des charges du ménage est assurée par elle. 

Ainsi le peu de profit qu’elle tire de son commerce de vente de mais est directement consommé par les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.

Pour un revenu plus élevé, elle sollicite un crédit pour redynamiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agomessi A. was born in 1962 in Atsansi-Djita. She is married and has four children. Her farmer husband struggles to meet the family’s needs, thus Mrs. A. handles a large portion of the family's expenses.

As a result, the little profit that she makes selling corn goes directly toward the family’s daily expenses.

In order to increase her revenue, she is requesting this loan so she can bolster her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and selling of corn

loans.name: Jhenny Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Jenny belongs to the communal Bank “El Arenal,” located in Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo # 507, district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and has a son and her husband is a driver. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (US $100), Jenny began a business selling clothes and cosmetics.

For the moment she keeps all of the clothing in her house and distributes it from house to house, although her dream is to have a place of her own.

With this loan of 1,500 soles (US $525), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase blouses, pants, Snake brand clothing, lotions, perfumes and others. Jenny is a woman who always likes to work and be independent, and for this reason she likes her business because she can converse with customers and make many friends. This makes her feel more accomplished and happy to belong to the Bank of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo # 507, Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y tiene un hijo y su esposo es chofer de carro, Jenny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 implemento su negocio en venta de ropa y cosméticos. Por el momento toda la mercadería lo tiene en su casa que después lo distribuye de casa en casa, aunque su anhelo es contar con un local propio. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ella invertirá comprando blusas, pantalones, Snake, cremas, perfumes y otros. Jenny, es una mujer a la que siempre le gusto trabajar y sentirse independiente por eso le gusta su negocio porque puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer muchos amigos, eso la hace sentirse mas realizada y esta feliz de pertenecer al Banco de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Todohoundé

texts.fr:
Née en 1972 Madame D. Todohoundé est une revendeuse de condiments très dévouée et dynamique. Elle a 3 personnes à charge aux besoins desquelles elle subvient avec son maigre revenu. 

    En vue d’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants, elle se propose d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat grâce à un crédit qu’elle sollicite. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter substantiellement son bénéfice pour répondre aux multiples besoins des membres de sa famille.

    Ce financement lui servira également de fond de roulement indispensable à la sécurisation de son revenu
texts.en:
Born in 1972, Mrs. Todohoundé D. is a dedicated and dynamic retailer of condiments. She has 3 people in her care, whose needs she meets with her meagre income.

With the goal of providing better living conditions to her children, she intends to increase her purchasing power thanks to this loan she is asking for. This will allow her to substantially increase her profit in order to respond to the multiple needs of the members of her family.

This loan will also serve as indispensible working capital to guarantee her future income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell condiments

loans.name: Verónica Raquel

texts.es:
Señora Verónica is an old client of our institution. She has her own house where she lives with her husband and two children. She makes a living by selling shoes. During the time that she has worked with Emprender, she has managed to increase her capital in a great way. She started with 300 bolivianos ($43.60), and now has more than $3,000 in capital. As a result of this, she has also improved her quality of life in a great way.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La sra. Verónica es cliente antigua de nuestra Institución, tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de calzados, durante el tiempo que trabaja con Emprender, la señora logro incrementar su capital en gran medida, debido a que comenzó con un capital de 300 Bs. y a la fecha tiene más de 3000 USD. de capital, a raíz de esto, tambien mejoró en gran medida su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Ms. Justina belongs to the Communal Bank “Teresa Ramos”, located in the Jr. Aguyatia # 559 in the district of Yarina Cocha in the Department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and her husband is a fisherman. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (US $100), Justina decided to invest in the sale of fish.

Nowadays she continues with her fish business and wakes up every day at 4 o’clock in the morning to purchase her fish in the port of Yarina Cocah to then take to sell in the market of Yarina Cocha.

With this loan of 1,200 soles (US $425), which will be paid off in five months, she will buy two tubs of fish, ice and a net so her husband can catch more fish. The strength and dedication that Justina gives everyday motivates her to be a successful woman who is a fighter. She is very grateful for the unconditional support given to her by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Justina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytía # 559, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, su esposo es pescador. Justina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de pescado. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de pescado, Justina se levanta todos los días a las 4. 00 am de la mañana para ir a comprar su tinada de pescado en el puerto de Yarina Cocha para luego llevarlo a vender en el mercado de Yarina Cocha. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara 2 tinas de pescado, hielo y una red para que su esposo pueda implementarse mas en la pesca. El esfuerzo y dedicación que Justina le pone cada día que pasa le motiva a ser de ella una mujer más luchadora y vencedora, es por ello que esta agradece por el apoyo incondicional que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of fish in bulk, ice, net.

loans.name: Katty Gissella

texts.es:
Mrs. Katty belongs to the communal bank “El Arenal” in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 26 years old and is the mother of one small son and her husband is an electrician. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (US $100), Kathy decided to invest in the purchase of beauty products.

Today she sells soft drinks, ice, candy and she also has two motokars (three-wheeled motorized form of transport) which gives work to drivers.

With this loan of 1,200 soles (US $ 425), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy two cases of soft drinks, 500 bags of ice, candies, and she will also maintain her 2 motokar. Katty is very content belonging to Manuela Ramos because it gives her the opportunity to continue improving her business; it is for this that she puts a lot of work into her business because she wants it to grow, and she won’t give up until she has also created a business for selling cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Katty pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años es madre de 1 pequeño hijo, su esposo es Técnico Electricista. Katty con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/.300 decidió invertir en la compra de productos de belleza. Hoy esta vendiendo gaseosa, hielo, golosinas y también cuenta con 2 motokar que da a trabajar a choferes. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 cajas de gaseosa, ½ millar de bolsa para hielo, golosinas, también dará mantenimiento a sus motokar. Katty esta muy contenta de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos porque gracias a ello le da la oportunidad de seguir incrementando su negocio; es por ello que le pone mucha algarabía a su negocio porque quiere seguir creciendo y no desmayara hasta formar su negocio de venta de celulares

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, ice, candies and maintenance of motokar.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier R. Martinez lives in a modest home with small rooms. He lives with his wife and young son. There is a specific space in their bedroom for a closet, the problem is that he does not have the resources needed to take on this project. As you can see in the photo, what he is using as a closet is an iron rod. He wants to take advantage of this space and put in a new closet.

Mr. R. works in a barber shop in the city and in his free time paints houses. He is going to use the income from both of his jobs to repay the loan. He is requesting $500 to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco Javier R. M. cuenta con una casa que es pequeña y los cuartos en ella también. El vive con su esposa y su hijo pequeño. Hay un cierto espacio para colocar un armario, la cuestión es que el no cuenta con el recurso necesario para llevar a cabo este proyecto. Como pueden notar en la foto, el tiene como closet un tubo de fierro. El quiere aprovechar ese espacio para colocar su nuevo armario

Sr. R. trabaja en una maquiladora de esta ciudad y en su tiempo libre también se dedica a pintar casas. El va a contar con los ingresos de sus dos empleos para poder pagar el préstamo. El solicita $500 dólares para llevar a cabo su proyecto.

loans.use: Construct a closet for his bedroom.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela is an enterprising woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a watchman at a construction company.

She started her business to help her husband with their family's expenses, mainly their children's education costs, since they hope that they will continue studying and have a university career.

She started selling shoes eleven years ago only by taking orders, but she has increased her portfolio of customers little by little and her business is going very well for her.

She needs a loan of $800, which she will repay in 2 months, to purchase shoes for the school year. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Angela es una mujer emprendedora, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja de velador en un compañía constructora

Ella inició el negocio para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, principalmente los escolares de sus hijos, ya que ellos desean que sigan estudiando y que tengan una carrera universitaria.

Comenzó con la venta de zapatos hace 11 años al principio lo hacia solo sobre pedidos, pero ahora poco a poco ha ido incrementando su cartera de clientes y le va muy bien.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 2 mes para comprar zapatos por la temporada escolar. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias, 46, has lived in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood for twenty years. His wife is a seamstress and helps out with the home expenses. They have three children, two boys and a girl, who attend elementary school.

Elias works as a pig butcher at home, and as a construction worker outside the home to supplement his family's income. He started his butchering business five years ago and it has flourished.

Elias is requesting a loan to build a cesspool in his home. His home currently has a letrine, but Elias would like to build a cesspool to improve the health and hygiene conditions for his family. He needs to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron rods.

Elias hopes to be healthy to support his children's education so that they become productive members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Elías tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación desde hace veinte años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como modista y aporta a los gastos del hogar, tienen tres hijos dos varones y una niña, ellos están estudiando la educación primaria. El negocio de Elías es el destace de cerdo en su casa, pero también trabaja como albañil para obtener otros ingresos, tiene cinco años de estar en este negocio de destace y le va bien por que la gente lo consume bastante. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras de su casa en la construcción de un sumidero, ya que lo que tiene es letrina pero quiere su baño y así tener mejores condiciones de salud para su familia, para esto necesita comprar bloques, cemento, hierro y arena. Espera siempre gozar de buena salud y así poder dar a sus hijos los estudios para que sean hombres preparados ante esta sociedad.

loans.use: Build a cesspool for his home

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia G. cooks and sells fries out of her home. Antonia does everything by hand, and she hopes to improve her working conditions. Five years ago, when she started her business, her sister helped her, since she only had a part-time job.
Now, Antonia is requesting a loan to buy a commercial kitchen that will allow her to cook more efficiently, and to serve more customers.
Antonia, 39, is a single mother of three children; two of them work to help their mother and to pay for college.
Antonia's wish is to support her family and offer them a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Antonia G. es comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de frituras, elabora papas fritas y las vende en su casa de habitación. Antonia realiza sus frituras de manera artesanal y sus planes son poder mejorar su forma de trabajo. Inició el préstamo hace 5 años, su hermana le ayudaba en la elaboración de las frituras ya que trabajaba solamente medio tiempo. El préstamo solicitado será para la compra de una cocina industrial que le permita facilidad y rapidez en sus ventas y así atender a más clientes. Antonia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales dos trabajan para apoyar a su madre y pagar sus estudios universitarios. Espera poder sacar adelante a su familia adelante y darles una mejor condición de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of commercial kitchen to improve sales

loans.name: Anibal Amilkar

texts.es:
Anibal is married and has two children, one aged three years and the other one month. He started his business selling roast chicken six years ago following his father’s death and prior to getting married to support his mother financially. Now, his wife also helps in running the business and it has grown gradually to include other types of food.

Anibal asks for a $1100 loan, repayable over four months, to purchase new tables and chairs for the convenience of his customers and to improve the décor of his business in this highly competitive line of activity. With your assistance, he will achieve his goal.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Anibal es casado y es padre de 2 hijos de 3 años y la otra de 1 mes, su esposa le ayuda a tender el negocio. El inició el negocio por la necesidad de un ingreso propio para sostener a su familia, lo incio desde nates de casarse, como no tenia trabajo y su padre fallecio entonces tuvo que iniciar su propio negocio para asi ayudarle a su madre. Hace 6 años empezo a vender pollo asado y poco a poco fue haciendo otro tipo de comida que los clientes le pedian.

El necesita un prestamo por US $1100 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mobiliario nuevo para la comodidad de sus clientes y mejorar un poco el negocio ya que hay mucha competencia. con tu apoyo el podra lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase of restaurant tables and chairs

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan Luis is married and has three children, aged 18, 12, and 4 years. He began his business selling soft drinks, French fries and groceries twelve years ago to supplement his income and to support his family after the birth of their second child. The business has grown steadily and its turnover has increased. Now, his wife assists him in running the business and his children manage the shop while he and his wife are away on holiday.

Juan asks for a loan of $300, repayable over three months, to buy new stock and to have a wider variety of items for sale in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Juan Luis es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 18 ,12 y 4 años, su esposa se dedica a atender el negocio y sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio cuando están de vacaciones. El inició el negocio porque no le alcanzaba con el sueldo que percibía de su trabajo para sostener a su familia, en ese entonces su hijo mayor estaba chico cuando nació el segundo niño y necesitaba dinero para la manutención de ambos. Comenzó hace 12 años con la venta de refrescos, frituras, y algunos abarrotes, pero poco a poco ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y lo ha sacado adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mejor surtida su tienda

loans.use: Purchase of retail stock

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda belongs to the “Esmeralda” (emerald) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She works selling clothing for women, man and children, shoes, fragrances, powders, earrings, lotions, etc. Her house is located on #112 Recreo Jr., Bda Shilcayo. She looks for clients who work in different public and private organizations.

Magda started this business because she likes it, since she was a little girl she learned how to do it, her parents were in retail and she helped them sell. That’s why it wasn’t hard for her to decide to do this activity when she saw the need to generate income to support her family. She is happy with what she has achieved thanks to the business.

The loan of $875 USD (S/.2500) which will be repaid in 6 months, will be invested in the purchase of beauty products by taking advantage of the sale opportunities, in addition, she will buy women’s clothing such as blouses, polo shirts, and items requested from her clients.

Magda is 56 years old, from Tarapoto, has four children all adults and independent. She is nice, service oriented, calm and very confident in what she does. In the future she would like to start another business selling regional liqueurs and party supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Magda, es socia del Banco Comunal “Esmeralda” vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos, perfumes, talcos, aretes, cremas, etc. Su casa esta ubicada en el Jr: Recreo Nº 112 – Bda Shilcayo, de allí ella sale en busca de sus clientes que son personas que trabajan en diferentes entidades públicas y privadas.

Se inicio en el negocio por que le gusta, desde muy niña aprendió el manejo, sus padres eran comerciantes y desde niña les ayudaba vendiendo, por eso no fue difícil decidir por esta actividad ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para sostener a su familia, esta contenta con lo que ha logrado gracias a este negocio.

El préstamo de S/. 2500.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, aprovechar las ofertas que se presentan para luego venderlas, además comprará ropas para damas como polos, blusas, y pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.

Ella tiene 56 años de edad, es natural de Tarapoto, tiene 4 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace, mas adelante piensa poner otro negocio de venta de licores regionales y confitería para atender cualquier evento.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and beauty products for sale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita belongs to the “Mujeres del 2000” (millennium women) community bank, she is from San Martin, province of Lamas and she works selling rice and yuca “juanes” (steam-cooked rice dough with or without a filling) at a bus stop and in the city market. She also sells clothing, particularly through client orders.

She started in the business because she likes to work and help in the education expenses of her children, she does well and has lots of clients that wait to purchase her delicious juanes.

With the loan of $775 USD (S/.2200) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase sacks of rice, oil, yuca, olives, eggs, chicken, leaves, etc. She will also purchase clothing to fill her client orders and sell in the towns near Lamas.

Margarita is 55, has three sons, one of them still with her, she feels happy because she has the support of her husband and son who help her prepare the juanes. In spite of her age, one of the goals she wants to achieve is have her own location where clients can enjoy her food.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Margarita, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000” natural del Departamento D. San Martín y Provincia D. Lamas, se dedica a al venta D. juanes D. arroz y yuca, venD. D. manera ambulatoria en un paradero y mercado D. la ciudad, también venD. ropas sobre todo trabaja con pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.

Se inicia en el negocio por que le gusta trabajar y apoyar en los gastos D. educación D. sus hijos, le va muy bien ya tiene muchos clientes quienes le esperan para comprar sus ricos juanes.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2 200.00 que pagara en 6 cuotas, comprará arroz en saco, aceite en galón, yuca, aceitunas, huevo, gallinas, hojas, etc., también comprará ropas para cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes y salir a vender en los pueblos cercanos a Lamas.

Tiene 55 años y 3 hijos varones, ahora solo uno esta a su cargo, se siente feliz por que tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y D. su hijo quienes lo ayudan en la preparación D. los juanes, a pesar D. la edad tiene una meta que quisiera concretar tener un local propio donD. sus clientes puedan disfrutar D. sus preparados.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Ines Calcaño is determined to make a better a world for herself and her family. She lives in a town in Samaná where she can see the beautiful beaches, and she sees as many tourists as she pleases in the Dominican Republic.

Like any Dominican, her favorite foods are rice, chicken, and beans. She has three young adult children aged 20, 25, and 33. When they were little, she worked hard to bring up those future fighters of life. Now is time to fight for her own financial ease.

With the help of her small business, she is able to accomplish those desires. She sells hair products to small beauty salons near by: shampoo, conditioner, hair color, and others. Tourists love getting traditional hair styles, and there are also other women living in the same town who come to those beauty salons. Products that are put on their hair are the very products that Ines sells with such love and joy. Today the business has been growing; with the help of her group "Trabajando para el futuro," in time it could be fulfilling. Stories like hers are an example of what is done thanks to you lenders. Ines and her story are typical of the "Trabajando Para el Futuro" Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 20 men and women who work hard to improve their lives with the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Ines's, and on behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more beauty supplies

loans.name: La Alianza Group

texts.en:
Luz S., a salesperson in a small town of San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic, dreams of improving her life each day that passes. Her biggest hope is to make a better future for her young kids. She is living with her children of ages 14, 7, 7, in a town where Manny Alexander, a Boston Red Sox player, lived.

Every day she sells clothes, green bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, and others Dominican traditional foods. She helps her children grow strong and healthy with the food she sells and the money she earns. With the money that is left from all her expanses, she saves some in order to earn enough to build a house made out of concrete blocks, a necessity because of the massive floods that come to this island.

She is currently in an group named "Alianza" that helps her and four other members improve their lives. With the money she receives as a loan she and the other members are able to develop their small business to accomplish their dreams.

Luz and her story represent the "La Alianza" Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 5 women who work hard to improve their lives through the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Luz's. On behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To invest in producing a higher quantity of fruits and vegetables for re-sale to her community members.

loans.name: Diamano Plateau 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le commerce est la principale activité des populations. Les femmes s'adonnent surtout au commerce à cause du manque d'industries dans le village. Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres, d’alléger le panier de la ménagère. Il s’agit d’achat et de revente de produits halieutiques (poissons fumés, poissons séchés), du jus de citron, de l'huile de palme venant de la région de Ziguinchor, des tissus, des pagnes, des articles de fête venant de la région de Kaolack et toute autre marchandise facile à vendre et ne se détériorant pas vite. Ce qui leur permettra de faire de bonnes  affaires durant comme les fêtes de Korité (l’Aïd el Fitr) et de Tabaski (Aïd el Kabir). 
Pour réussir ce projet, le groupement  sollicite un renouvellement de prêt de 1 000 000 F qui sera partagé entre 02 Groupements dont Diamono plateau 1 = 500 000 F et Diamono plateau 2 = 500 000 F de afin de pouvoir mener à bien ses activités.
texts.en:
Commerce is the main activity of people. The women devote themselves particularly to commerce because of the lack of industries in villages. The group is fixed on, among other objectives, improving the living conditions of its members and alleviating the burden of housewives. It involves buying and reselling products from ocean harvests (smoked fish, dried fish), lemon juice, palm oil from the Ziguinchor region, cloth, pagnes (popular African fabrics), holiday-related goods from the Kaolack region, and any other merchandise that is easy to sell and that doesn’t deteriorate rapidly. This will enable them to do a good business, such as during the holidays of Korité (Aïd el Fitr) and of Tabaski (Aïd el Kabir). For this project to succeed, the group is requesting a renewal of a loan of 1,000,000 francs that will be shared between two groups: Diamono Plateau 1 (500,000 francs) and Diamono Plateau 2 (500,000 francs) in order to be able to manage these businesses well.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell consumables

loans.name: La Vida Group

texts.en:
Clara and her story are typical of the "Trabajando Para el Futuro" Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 10 men and women who work hard to improve their lives through the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Clara's.

Clara V. has lived slowly, accomplishing two dreams: finishing a house and building a boutique. She sells clothes for her clients and is always searching for more customers.

Clara has five children aged 28, 27, 24, 21, and 18. She has lived her life fighting to get them where they are living at present. She has lived with her children in a small town in San Pedro de Macoris, also referred to as Macoris of the Sea, in the Dominican Republic.

"VIDA" is the group she is part of with seven other women and two men. They all are looking for loans in order to better their futures. They probably will be able to since each day there are people like you who want to help. On behalf of all of the group members, and our team here at "Esperanza", thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more used and new clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Diamono Plateau 2 Group

texts.fr: Le commerce est la principale activité des populations. Les femmes s'adonnent surtout au commerce à cause du manque d'industries dans le village. Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres, d’alléger le panier de la ménagère. Il s’agit d’achat et de revente de produits halieutiques, fruits, et huile de palme venant de la région de Ziguinchor, des tissus, des pagnes, des articles de fête venant de la région de Kaolack et toute autre marchandise facile à vendre et ne se détériorant pas vite. Ce qui leur permettra de faire de bonnes  affaires durant comme les fêtes de Korité (l’Aïd el Fitr) et de Tabaski (Aïd el Kabir).
texts.en:
Retail business is the primary occupation of the people from this village. Women particularly devote themselves to retail business due to the lack of industry in the village. The objectives of this group are to improve the living conditions of its members and to lighten the load of these housewives. Their retail business consists of the purchase and resale of fishing products, fruits, palm oil from the Ziguinchor region, fabric, traditional printed cloth, holiday celebration items from the Kaolack region and other merchandise that can be easily sold and that does not deteriorate quickly. This allows them to make lots of sales during holidays like Korité (l'Aïd el Fitr) and Tabaski (Aïd el Kabir).

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase and resale of retail products

loans.name: Jesuscristo Es La Puerto Group

texts.en:
Roselin P. dreams of expanding her small business and turning it into a store with a variety of different clothes. She lives today in San Pedro D. Macoris. Roselin P. is a woman with four children ages 11, 9, 7, and 5. She has two jobs each day she wakes up: one is to take care of her children and the other is to find a way to live comfortably with them in a small house of her own.

Rosalin belongs to an association in San Pedro D. Macoris called "Jesucristo". The fifteen members of this association are there for the same purpose: to make a better future for themselves and their loved ones. Roselin is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell, and thereby proviD. more benefits for the ones she loves.

Roselin and her story are typical of the "Jesucristo" Bank of Hope, 15 men and women who work hard to improve their lives with the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Roselin's--these fifteen members are able to manage with the help that you give our organization. Thank you!

loans.use: To invest in her business by purchasing more new and used clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Elmira

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the “Corazones Valientes II” (brave hearts II) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Shilcayo. Her house is located in Mz B Lt 5 Las Margaritas. She sells food in a tent of the Banda del Shilcayo market, where she attends clients daily, such as locals or visitors to the market and even other merchants from the market.

With the loan of $275 USD (S/.800) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy wood to build her own tent, she will also buy ingredients to prepare dishes such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, vegetables, grains, spices, etc.

At 43, Maria is an enthusiastic and energetic woman, she does well in the business, has a lot of clients thanks to the good service she provides, the type of food she prepares (only with a few spices, mostly fresh) and the variety of the dishes prepared daily. Her goal is to have her own and better location because she is currently renting.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Corazones Valientes II”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, su casa esta ubicado en el Jr: las margaritas Mz B Lt 5, se dedica a la venta de comida tipo menú en un kiosco del mercado de La Banda de Shilcayo, allí acuden diariamente sus comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o visitante que acuden al mercado y paraderos interprovinciales que se encuentran muy cerca de su kiosco.

Con el crédito de S/ 800.00 que pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará madera para construir su propio kiosco así como también comprará sus insumos para la preparación de los platos que a diario ofrece a sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, verduras, menestras, condimentos, etc.

Maria a sus 43 años, es una mujer entusiasta y alegre, le va muy bien en el negocio, no le falta clientes, ella refiere que es por el trato que da, el tipo de comida que ofrece (no muy condimentada, casi al natural) y la variedad de sus platos, que cada día prepara, su meta es tener su propio kiosco para implementarlo mejor, por que ahora esta vendiendo en un kiosco alquilado.

loans.use: Purchase construction material (wood) and purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
Marisabel, belongs to the “Sargento Lores” (sargeant Lores) community bank, she lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Morales. She sells new and used clothing for women, men and children, her business is located in her house at #230 Leticia Jr and is visited by many clients.

With this $425 USD (S/.1200) loan, to be repaid in four months, she will buy clothing for girls such as shirts, shorts, jeans of different brands, polo shirts and shirts for boys and men. The new merchandise will satisfy the needs of her demanding clients.

Marisabel is 42, from Morales and has two underage children, who motivate her to continue working everyday. She is nice and helpful to her clients; she is very confident and knows that with determination she can achieve her goals. In the future she would like to make renovations to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marisabel, es socia del Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores” vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, nuevas y también de segunda, su negocio es en su misma casa ubicada en el Jr: Leticia No 230, hasta donde llegan gran cantidad de clientes.
