Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para niñas como blusitas, shorts, pantalones Jean de diferentes marcas, polos, camisas para niños y caballeros, que le permitirán satisfacer los gustos muy exigentes de sus clientes.

Ella tiene 42 años de edad, natural de Morales y tiene 2 hijos, ambos menores de edad, quienes son el motor para seguir trabajando todos los días, se caracteriza por ser gentil, carismática y atenta con sus clientes, tiene mucha confianza en si misma, sabe que si se propone va conseguir sus metas, mas adelante piensa primero su casa para poner su propio refrigerio en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Monica Indira

texts.es:
Monica belongs to the “Esmeralda” (emerald) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She sells clothes, phone cards, phone card reloads and phone call services, all from her home located at #374 Sinchi Roca Jr. Her clients are from around the neighborhood or people that need her services.

With the loan of $350 USD (S/.1000) to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase merchandise such as: pants, polo shirts for women, man and children as well as phone cards, all with the purpose to satisfy her client needs.

Monica is 31 and lives with her mom, she works everyday to get ahead and achieve her goal of having a clothing store downtown.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica ala venta de ropas, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, recargas virtuales y servicio de locutorio en su misma casa Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 374, a donde diariamente acuden sus clientes que son los moradores de su barrio y personas que requieran de su servicio.

Con el reciente crédito de S/. 1000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería como: pantalones, polos para damas, caballeros y niños para que surta su negocio y así satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes, también comprará tarjetas telefónicas.

La señora Mónica tiene 31 años, vive con su mamá, trabaja todos los días para salir adelante y poder cumplir con su meta que es tener su propio local en el centro para que pueda vender sus prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and phone cards for sale.

loans.name: Nini

texts.es:
Nini belongs to the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (enterprising women) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She sells chicken meat. In addition, she sells hot dogs with french fries and fresh drinks. The business is located at #1486 Grau Jr. Everyday clients that want a quick snack attend it. She also delivers chicken meat to stores.

She started this business moved by the economic situation she was in, with the help of her husband, she now has guaranteed sales because she has many clients. She sells the snacks outside of her house.

With the loan of $425 USD (S/.1200) to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy ingredients to prepare the products she sells such as: sacks of potatoes, vegetables for salads, oil, mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, as well as plastic cups, cutlery and plates. She will also buy chickens to raise and then sell the meat to her clients.

Nini is a 26 year old enthusiastic woman, she lives with her husband and son. She is happy for the goals achieved, Nini dreams of owning a house and a chicken farm to provide a better future for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nini es socia del Banco Comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto se dedica a la venta de pollos eviscerados. Paralelamente vende salchipapas y refrescos naturales, su negocio se ubica en el Jr. Grau Nº 1486, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de comidas rápidas, y los pollos reparten en las en las bodegas.

Se inicio en este negocio motivada por la situación económica en que estaba viviendo, con la ayuda de su esposo, ahora tiene asegurada su venta diaria, porque tiene muchos clientes. Su negocio de venta de Salchipapas esta ubicada en el frontis de su casa.

Con el crédito de S/ 1200.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los productos que vende como: papas en sacos, verduras para las ensaladas, aceite en litros, cremas como, mayonesa, ketchup, mostaza, también platos, tenedores, vasos descartables y de losa, además comprara pollos bebes para que críe para luego venderlos eviscerados a sus clientes.

Nini es una mujer joven entusiasta de 26 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos y sueña con tener una casa propia y una granja de pollos parrilleros de esta manera poder brindar un buen futuro a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase chickens to raise and sell meat and purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma, in the food industry, is a member of the Communal Bank "Ramirez Brigade". She lives in the San Martin area, in the province and district of Lamas. She is in the business of grocery and soft drink sales. Her business is located in her own home, where her clients, the neighbors of her neighborhood, come daily to shop.

With this loan of US $450, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy basic necessities such as sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, canned food, packages of noodles, detergents, and hygienic paper among other things. She will also buy aluminum cabinets and display cases, so that she can give her business a better appearance as well as satisfy the needs of her clients.

She is 44 years old and has one daughter still dependent on her, who helps her in the home as well as waiting on the public in the business. Her future goal is to expand her house in order to give her business a better appearance and to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Noma, de profesión en Industrias Alimentarías, es socia del Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Lamas, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas gasificadas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. San Martín Nº 146 donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son los vecinos del su barrio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1300.00 que pagara en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, también compro armarios de aluminio y vitrinas, para así poder dar mayor presencia al negocio como también satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 44 años y 1 hija que todavía depende de ella quien le apoya en casa y en la atención al público en el negocio, su meta en el futuro es ampliar su casa para dar una mejor presencia y surtir su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase various grocery products

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Mrs. Paquita belongs to the "Esmeralda" bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the Tarapoto district. She sells groceries, soft drinks and candy. Her business is located in her own home, where the clients from her neighborhood come every day.

With this loan of US$700, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy basic necessities such as sacks of rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, packages of noodles, various brands and sizes of soft drinks, detergents, hygienic paper, and personal hygiene articles. She wants to supply her business in order to satisfy the needs of her clients.

She is 32 years old and has 2 dependent children who help her in the house and in the business. Her future goal is to enlarge her business and increase her inventory in order to maintain a loyal clientele who can find everything they are looking for in a single place.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Paquita pertenece al Banco “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas gasificadas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. Sinchi Roca No 468 donde acuden diariamente sus clientes de su barrio. Con este crédito de S/. 2000.00 que pagara en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, gaseosas de diferentes marcas y tamaños detergentes y papel higiénico, artículos de higiene personal, quiere surtir su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 32 años y 2 hijos que todavía dependen de ella quienes le apoyan en la casa y en el negocio, su meta en el futuro es ampliar su local y surtir mas el negocio para fidelizar a sus clientes cuando encuentran todo lo que buscan en un solo lugar.

loans.use: Purchase of various grocery products

loans.name: Kawral 2 Group

texts.fr: Le village de GOUY GUI a longtemps polarisé les activités socio économiques de la communauté rurale de DENDEY ; mais avec les multiples années de sécheresse et les conséquences de la désertification, le cercle de la pauvreté s’est beaucoup élargi et a basculé les populations dans une  précarité très prononcée. L'objectif de ce renouvellement du prêt est de participer à la création de nouvelles ressources financières au bénéfice des membres en développant des activités de petit commerce inter-villageois avec les produits locaux. La stratégie repose sur la capacité du groupement à acheter et stocker assez de matière première pour constituer un fond de roulement et satisfaire la demande au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires, des communautés rurales voisines. Il s’agira d’acheter  de la matière première au moment où le prix est très bas, de la stocker, puis organiser la redistribution pendant toute l’année. Les produits alimentaires seront privilégiés dans la commercialisation.
texts.en:
For many years, the village of Gouygui has been a socio-economic centre for the rural community of Dendy. However, due to multiple years of drought as well as the effects of desertification, the circle of poverty has greatly increased and has thrown this population into precarious conditions. With the renewal of this loan, the goal will be to create new financial resources for community members who develop small inter-village businesses selling local products. The strategy rests upon the ability of the group to purchase and stock enough raw materials to create a working capital and to satisfy the demand of the weekly markets in the neighbouring rural communities. They will have to purchase raw materials when the price is very low, stock the materials, then organise the redistribution of these materials throughout the year. Food products will be given priority in this business.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase and resale of food products

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Mrs. Sadith is a member of "The Heroes" Communal Bank. She lives in the department and province of San Martin, in the Tarapoto district. Her business is an Urban Transport Service, which is a motorcycle taxi. Her husband supports the business and drives the taxi. They started the business approximately 10 years ago, they are considered one of the pioneers of moto-taxi in the region.

Their motivation in starting this activity were economic, because they had to educate their children and lacked other work.

With this loan of US$450 , which they will repay in 6 months, they will invest in parts, and in the renovation of some of the moto-taxi, acting as responsible business persons for the peace and security of their clients.

She is 56 years old and has one dependent daughter, for whom she must continue working. One of her goals is to build a country house to rent out, and in this way to ensure her old age. She already has the land, she is only lacking the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sadith, es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, vive en el departamento y Provincia D. San Martín, Distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a prestar Servicio D. Transporte Urbano, para ello cuenta con un mototaxi, su esposo le apoya, es él quien conduce el motocar, se inició en el negocio hace diez años aproximadamente se considera una D. las pioneras del mototaxi en la Región. Los motivos que tuvo para iniciarse en esta actividad fueron por el factor económico en vista que tenía que hacer estudiar a sus hijos, y la escasez D. trabajo. Con este crédito D. S/. 1 300.00 que lo pagará en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. piezas, bajada D. motor y la renovación D. algunas partes D. la moto, para dar seguridad y tranquilidad a sus clientes como una negociante responsable. Tiene 56 años y una hija que depenD. D. ella, por quien tiene que seguir trabajando, una D. sus metas es hacer una quinta para alquilar y D. esa manera asegurar su vejez, ya tiene terreno suficiente solo le falta capital.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Simith

texts.es:
Mrs. Simith is a member of "Las Lameñas" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Lamas. She sells groceries and costume jewelry. Her business is located in the city of Tarapoto, where she is also living for now, in order to educate her grandchildren who live with her.

This loan of US$1,050, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to set up her business, purchasing packages of noodles of various types and brands, boxes of canned goods, sacks of rice and sugar, liter bottles of oil, eggs, boxes of milk, different brands and sizes of soft drinks, cleaning products, personal hygiene products, and detergents--the articles most requested by her clients.

She is 53 years old, and lives with her husband, daughter and 2 grandchildren. She is a very active woman who controls and manages her own business. By her charisma, she attracts clients, as well as serving them in a friendly manner. Her goal is to increase her business and to have a well-stocked variety shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Simith es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas “ vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y joyas su negocio esta ubicado en el jr. Jiménez Pimentel No en la ciudad de Tarapoto, lugar donde esta viviendo por ahora, por razones de educación de sus nietos que viven con ella. Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00, que será devuelto en 6 meses, servirá para implementar su negocio comprando fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas de litro, huevos en javas, Leche en cajas, bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas y tamaños, productos de Limpieza y aseo personal y detergentes debido a que estos artículos son muy requeridos por sus clientes . Tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo, una de sus hijas y 2 nietas, ella es una mujer muy activa, se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes además de atenderlos con amabilidad, su meta es crecer en su negocio, tener una bodega bazar bien surtida.

loans.use: Purchase of various grocery products.

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.es:
Mrs. Tarcila is a member of "Women of 2000" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Lamas. She sells meals, her business is located in her house. She says that she is already well-known for providing good service and for the excellent seasoning she uses in the preparation of her meals, which has served to win her clientele.

With this loan of US$350, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the products she needs such as rice, bags of sugar, noodles, oil, different varieties of cooking vegetables, boxes of milk, and the daily purchases of chicken, pork, and beef, greens, and condiments that she uses in the preparation of the dishes she offers to her clients. She also will purchase some kitchen utensils such as plates, spoons, glasses etc. in order to give the best service to her clients.

Mrs. Tacila is 55 years old with 3 children, two of which are still dependent. She is happy in her work, she enjoys being in contact with people, and above all she loves cooking. She is an independent woman, her goal is to have her own house where she can have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Tarcila, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2 000”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Lamas, se dedica a la venta de Comida, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa J. Sosimo Rivas S/n, comenta que ahora ya es muy conocida por brindar buena atención y tener buena sazón en el preparado de sus comidas que le ha servido para ganarse a su clientela. Con este crédito de S/.1000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses comprará los productos que necesita como: arroz, azúcar en saco, fideo, aceite, menestras de diferentes variedades, leche en caja, y las compras diarias que hace como carnes gallina, cerdo, res, variedad de verduras y condimentos que utiliza para la preparación de los platos a ofertar a sus clientes, también compro algunos utensilios de cocina como: platos cucharas, vasos, etc, para poder dar una buena atención a sus clientes. La señora Tarcila tiene 55 años, con 3 hijos, dos de ellos aun dependen de ella, esta contenta con lo que hace, le gusta estar en contacto con la gente y sobre todo le encanta cocinar, es una mujer independiente, su meta es tener una casa propia para poner restaurante.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale consumables

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa belongs to the Esmeralda ("Emeralds") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin. She operates a business, located in her house, selling aggregates like stone, sand, fill, etc. for building. She also sells food, providing daily meals to the missionaries at her church.

With this loan of S/.2,500 (2,500 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the supplies that she needs to make her daily meals: sugar, rice, cooking oil, pasta, etc. along with the ingredients that she has to buy every day such as chicken, beef, pork, fish, vegetables, platanos, eggs, coffee, oats and tea. She also has to buy tools and permits to be able to extract the aggregates she sells and deliver them to her customers on time.

Teresa, 39, lives with her husband and son. She relies on the support of her husband to sell the construction aggregates because it's a family business. She's an active woman and she works every day to help her family get ahead. Her goal is to see her son settled in a professional career. She also wants to buy a truck to make it easier to move the aggregates.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa se dedica a la venta de material agregado para la construcción como piedras, arena, ripio, etc. también vende comida, da pensión a los misioneros de la iglesia a la que pertenece.

Con este crédito de S/.2500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus comidas, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y demás insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, verduras, plátanos, huevos, café, avena, cajas de diferentes tipos de té. Además tiene que invertir en combustible mano de obra, pagos de permiso en la municipalidad para poder sacar los agregados y llegar con puntualidad a sus clientes.

La señora Teresa tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo sobre todo en la venta de los agregados, por que es un negocio familiar, ella es una mujer muy activa, trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a su familia, tiene como meta ver a su hijo realizado con una carrera y también desea comprar un volquete para que le sea mas fácil el traslado de los agregados.

loans.use: Buy materials and supplies for businesses.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa is a member of the Los Chancas community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She operates a business selling cold drinks at a school near her house. She also sells food from her house, operates a carpentry shop with her husband and grows and sells vegetables that she harvests on her small farm. She has amazing business experince because she's tried many kinds of businesses, first selling groceries, then spotting an opportunity to sell fruit and now the school food-selling business, all demonstrating her will to get ahead.

With this loan of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the ingredients she needs to make the products that she sells: cooking oil, sugar, rice, menestras (a local vegetable stew), condiments, chicken, etc. She will also invest in wood for making the furniture that her customers order.

Teresa, 65, lives with her husband and has grown children. From her youth, she's been noted for her enthusiasm, her work ethic and her perseverance. She dreams of improving her carpentry shop and setting up a space in her house for a restaurant (because she likes to cook). Above all, she wants to be around other people.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teresa, es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Chancas”, del distrito y provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín, se dedicaba a la venta de refrigeR. en un colegio que esta muy cerca a su casa, también vende comida en su casa así como también ella con su esposo tienen una carpintería, y cultiva y vende verduras que saca de su chacra. Su experiencia en el negocio es bastante rica por que ella ya probó en vaR. tipos de negocios, primero vendió abarrotes, luego vio que le iba muy bien con la frutas y ahora se dedica a la venta de comida en el colegio porque ella es una mujer luchadora.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos que necesita para la preparación de los productos que vende como: aceite, azúcar arroz, menestras, verduras, condimentos, pollo, etc. además invertirá en madera para la confección de muebles que piden sus clientes y poder llegar a ellos con mucha puntualidad.

Tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo por que sus hijos ya están mayores, desde muy joven se destacó por ser una mujer entusiasta, trabajadora responsable y perseverante, sueña con mejorar su carpintería, arreglar en su casa un ambiente para poner un restaurante porque le gusta cocinar y tiene buena sazón, sobre todo quiere estar en contacto con las personas.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies for food business.

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
Vedith is a member of the Sargento Lores ("Sargeant Lores") community bank. She lives in the "provincia" of San Martin and operates a business selling barbecued chicken. She owns the poultry that go on her menu. The business is located in her house and her customers include both locals and people from outside the neighborhood. She began with a tailoring business because she's a seamstress, but that business wasn't profitable and she decided to try something else. She saw that her house was in a good spot for a restaurant business so she set up the new business and it's gone very well.

With this loan of S/.2,000 (2,000 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy spoons, dishes, forks, knives, glasses, tables, ladles, etc. so that she can better arrange her business. She will also buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, etc. so that she has the supplies that she needs to provide her customers with the things that they want.

Vedith, 43, is a happy and enthusiastic woman who still has a strong desire to keep on growing. Things are going well because her charisma and attention attract customers. Her goal is to expand her restaurant because there are times when there's not enough space to serve everyone waiting. With the help of her children and the perseverance that she's demonstrated, she will surely succeed in meeting her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Vedith, es socia del Banco Comunal. “Sargento Lores”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales, se dedica a la venta de pollos a la brasa, tiene su polleria, también vende menú, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa en la Av. Perú No 120 - Morales a donde diariamente acuden sus comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o visitantes de otros lugares. Ella comenzó con el negocio de bazar por que ella es costurera pero no le fue muy bien, no era muy rentable, por eso decidió cambiar de negocio, vió que su casa esta ubicado en un buen lugar y además que tiene un local propio, emprendió este nuevo negocio y le esta yendo muy bien.

Con este crédito de S/ 2000.00 que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará cucharas, platos, tenedores, cuchillos, vasos, mesas cucharones, para implementar mejor su negocio, también comprará arroz, azúcar, gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores para la preparación del menú y tener los insumos necesarios para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Vedith, es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 43 años aun tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo, le va muy bien por el trato y carisma que tiene al atender a sus clientes, su meta es ampliar su local por que hay tiempos en que no hay lugar para mas personas que van a consumir, con el apoyo de sus hijos y la perseverancia que tiene esta segura que lo va lograr.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Viviana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Viviana is a member of the Los Proceres ("The Founding Fathers") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin where she operates a business buying and selling wholesale supplies of rice. Her business is located in a space at her house. Her customers are mainly small food shops and people who sell food items in the market. She decided to start the business so that she could be independent and help with family expenses. Rice sells for an especially good price now which, in turn, generates a good income that allows Viviana to contribute to family expenses, including her children's schooling which is especially important to her.

With this loan of S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of rice, at wholesale prices, to resell to shops and market vendors. She already has customers who come by her house daily looking for her product.

Viviana, 25, lives with her husband and their two young children. She operates this business because she likes it and because it generates income that helps her husband with the family's expenses. Her goal is to own a small rice farm. She would also like to sell other products such as coffee and maize.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, vive en el Departamento y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la compra y venta de y arroz en chala y pilado, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Próceres Nº 355, sus clientes son las bodegas sobre todo y personas que venden abarrotes en el mercado. Decide iniciar en el negocio para independizarse y ayudar en la economía familiar ya que en esta época la venta del arroz esta en un buen precio que le favorece generar sus ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos sobre todo en la educación de sus menores hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, que será pagado en 6 meses comprará arroz por sacos para ser vendidos en las bodegas y comerciantes del mercado al por mayor, ya tiene clientes quienes clientes visitan diariamente a su casa en busca de su producto.

Tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos aun pequeños, se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y le permite generar ingresos económicos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, tiene como meta tener su chacra para sembrar arroz, le gustaría también dedicarse a la venta de otros productos como café y maíz.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of rice for resale.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
Wilda is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Enterprising Women") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin. A teacher by profession, she is now retired from teaching but still works selling Omnilife natural medicines and university textbooks. She started the business to improve both her health and her finances. She has many retail customers, to whom she extends credit, because when she began she wasn't known and, given the competition, she had to find a way to build a customer base.

With this loan of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the Omnilife products, in bottles and packets, such as Omniplus, Optimus, Teatino, Cafecito, etc., that her customers demand.

Wilda, 60, lives with her husand and a daughter. She's a very responsible, charismatic woman who is completely committed to her goal of building a house and establishing an appropriate space there for her Omnilife business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Wilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, de Profesión profesora, ahora ya jubilada se dedica ala venta de productos Naturales Omnilife, y textos universitarios. Se inicio en el negocio por mejorar su salud y su economía, tiene muchos clientes por que vende al menudeo dándole facilidades de pago, por que cuando empezó no era conocida, y con la competencia que hay tenia que buscar una estrategia para captar a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1 000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos Omnilife en frascos y sobres de Omniplus, Optimus, Teatino, Cafecito, y demás productos que son muy requeridos por sus clientes.

La señora Wilda tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo y una hija que esta a su cargo, es una mujer muy responsable, carismática y sobre todo decidida su meta es construir su casa, arreglar un ambiente propicio para poner su propio negocio de omnilife, por que son productos buenos y que tienen buena salida.

loans.use: Buy products for health business.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira belongs to the Esmeralda ("Emerald") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin. She operates a food-selling business from a stand that she rents in the town of Tarapoto. Her customers are local workers who come to the town for various reasons each day. She started the business after a friend encouraged her to do so. She used to work as a street vendor, selling "anticuchos" (a kebab-like food made with meat and potatoes) and other regional dishes, something that was especially hard work because of all the things she had to haul back and forth every day. Because of the efforts that she's put in, the quality and variety of her food and the good service that she provides, the business is going very well and she has a good customer base who can be sure that she will treat them well.

With this loan of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the ingredients that she needs to make her food: sugar, sacks of rice, cooking oil, pasta, and the other things that she buys daily such as chicken, beef, pork, fish, vegetables, platanos and eggs. She will also buy supplies such as plates, cups, glasses, jars, etc. because she wants to provide good service and a nice presentation for her customers.

Yadira, 52, lives with her son. She works every day. Her goal is to set up a large restaurant because she loves to cook and she expects to meet her goal in the very near future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yadira pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Bda. de Shilcayo, su casa esta ubicada en el Jr: 1º de Abril No 324 en el mismo distrito, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que ella alquila a la municipalidad de Tarapoto, sus clientes son los trabajadores de este lugar y personas que diariamente acuden a la municipalidad por diversas razones. Se inicia en el negocio por la iniciativa de una amiga que le invitó a vender en este lugar, ella antes vendía anticuchos y comida regional en la calle, y tenia que estar trasladando sus cosas todos los días y era muy sacrificado, con las ganas que le pone, la calidad y variedad de sus comidas y su buena atención, le va muy bien, tiene buenos clientes a quienes atiende con un trato amable y carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito de S/.1500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos, y demás insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, verduras, plátanos, huevos, etc. También implementará en vajilla como platos de diversos tamaños (extendidos, soperas), tazas, vasos, jarritas, quiere dar una buena atención y presentación de sus platos a sus clientes.

La señora Yadira tiene 52 años, vive con su hijo, ella trabaja diariamente, su meta es poner un restaurante grande por que a ella le encanta cocinar, espera realizarlo muy rápido.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma is a member of the Esmeralda ("Emerald") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of San Martin where she operates a general store. The store is located in a space at her house. She started the business to help her husband with household expenses. With his help, she's managed to grow and maintain the business. She started selling on a simple table and she now has a wiD. range of products, a well-stocked inventory and a good customer base who come by from early in the morning to buy her products.

With this loan of S/.1,300 (1,300 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy products such as pasta of various types and brands; canned food; rice; sugar; cooking oil in liter bottles; eggs; canned milk; soft drinks of various types and sizes; toiletries; and detergents, all products demanded by her customers.

Yrma, 49, lives with her husband and 2 children who are the reason she struggles and perseveres at her business each day. She considers herself free to make decisions for and manage her business because she alone is responsible for it. Her charisma and good nature attract customers and she believes that having a well-stocked business also guarantees sales. Her goal is to first develop an appropriate setting for her business at her house and then grow it to be a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yrma es socia del Banco Comunal “Esmeralda “ vive en la región y provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Sinchi Roca No 370. Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad D. generar sus ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos D. la casa, con su esfuerzo, ha logrado que su negocio crezca, y se mantenga, comenzó vendiendo sobre una pequeña mesa, actualmente su negocio es muy variado y surtido, tiene buena cantidad D. clientes, quienes acuden desD. muy temprano a comprarle sus productos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, con dicho capital comprará productos como: fideos D. distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas D. litro, huevos en javas, Leche en cajas, bebidas gasificadas D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, productos D. aseo personal y detergentes debido a que estos artículos son muy requeridos por sus clientes .

Tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos, motivo D. su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio, por que sola maneja su negocio. Por su carisma y amabilidad en la atención atrae a sus clientes, cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas, su meta es arreglar en su casa un ambiente apropiado para su negocio, quiere llegar a tener un minimarket.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for retail store business.

loans.name: Petra Lilia

texts.es:
Petra is married to Jose Guadalupe Castañeda, who works as an employee in a company. They have five children, who are all married. This is why Petra started her business, because she felt lonely and used it as a distraction. Thanks to her daughter-in-law, who motivated her to start her work of selling shoes by catalog, she has had her business for four years and has had good income.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months to purchase merchandise. With your support, Petra will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Petra esta casada, su esposo se llama Jose Guadalupe Castañeda, trabaja como empleado en una empresa, tienen cinco hijos todos casados, es por eso que ella inicio su negocio porque se sentía sola y lo tomo como una distracción, gracias a su nuera que la animo para que iniciara el negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo, desde hace cuatro años y gracias a este actividad ha tenido buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Petra continuara con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Delia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Delia is married to Roberto Contreras, who is an employee in a company. They have three children. Their oldest daughter is thirteen, and she helps Delia with her business. She started her business to help her children get ahead and because her husband was unemployed. Because of economic need, she had to look for a source of income. This is why she started her small general store a year ago that she has grown little by little.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and supply her store. With your help, Delia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Delia es casada su esposo se llama Roberto Contreras es empleado en la empresa tienen tres hijos su hija la mas grande de 13 años le ayuda en el negocio. Ella inicio el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que su esposo estaba desempleado y ante las necesidades económicas tuvo que buscar alguna fuente de ingresos y es así como hace un año inicio con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que poco a poco ha hecho crecer.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y asi poder tener surtida su tienda. Con tu ayuda Delia saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is married and has two grown-up children, who are also married. Her husband is retired and helps Irene in running the business. She started her business selling food to supplement her husband’s pension, which was insufficient to support them financially. Her children also help by selling food made by Irene to their work colleagues in their work-places.

Irene asks for a loan of $800, repayable over six months, to buy additional ingredients for her catering business, which she plans to expand by delivering and selling her tamales (a Mexican dish made of minced and seasoned meat packed in cornmeal dough, wrapped in corn husks, and steamed - Translator) in local shops to increase her turnover.

With your help, Irene will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Irene es casada, su esposo es pensionado y le ayuda en el negocio, tiene dos hijos, casados, Ella inicio su negocio de venta de comida para asi tener un ingreso económico y ayudar con los gastos a su esposo, ya que con la pensión que recibe no le alcanza para solventar los gastos del hogar, sus hijos también le ayudan vendiendo su comida en sus lugares de trabajo,

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para su negocio ya que ella quiere empezar a entregas sus tamales en tienditas para asi poder tener mejores ingresos. Con tu ayuda Irene lograra su meta.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients

loans.name: Mirsa Karina

texts.es:
Misra is married and has three children. She began her business three years ago selling to friends and relatives, when her husband lost his job and they were left with no income. Although her husband has a job now, she nevertheless continues with the business, as it provides additional income and better quality of life for her family.

Misra asks for a loan of $250, repayable over three months, to buy additional stock of merchandise. Your help will enable her to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Mirsa esta casada tiene tres hijos, inicio su negocio desde hace tres años, vendiendo a sus familiares, ya que su esposo estaba desempleado, y no tenia otra entrada de dinero, actualmente su esposo tiene empleo, sin embargo ella sigue con esta actividad ya que le ha ayudado con los gastos de su casa, y le permite darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. con tu ayuda Mirsa seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmela belongs to the "Los Chankas" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Lamas. Her business is located in a place she rents in the central market of Lamas. She sells meals, especially breakfast. She started in the food business in the market thanks to her aunt's idea, who motivated her. The profits from her new business are growing. She is doing very well, she has good clients whom she attends in a pleasant manner. Her excellent flavorings and the variety of her dishes complement her warm manner.

With this loan of US$275, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the foodstuffs she needs for the daily preparation of her dishes, such as sugar, bags of rice, gallons of oil, packages of noodles, as well as the daily purchase of chicken, beef, pork and fish, greens, bananas, eggs, coffee, oatmeal, and boxes of different types of tea.

Mrs. Carmela is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children who help her during their free time. She works every day in order to help her children, who are in the upper grades, to get ahead. She is a very active woman whose goal is to see her children enter into careers, when she may think about a different type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmela pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Chankas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Lamas y distrito de Lamas, su negocio está ubicado en un puesto que ella alquila en el mercado central de Lamas, se dedica a la venta de comida sobre todo desayunos. Se inicia en el negocio de la venta de comida en el mercado gracias a la idea de su tía, quien le motivo, con las ganas que le pone a su nuevo negocio, esta creciendo, pues le va muy bien, tiene buenos clientes a quienes atiende con un trato amable y carisma que le caracteriza, a ello se suma la buena sazón y la variedad en los platos que ofrece. Con este crédito de S/.800.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y demás insumos que compra a diario como carnes de pollo, res, cerdo y pescado, verduras, plátanos, huevos, café, avena, cajas de diferentes tipos de té. La señora Carmela tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas quienes le apoyan en sus momentos libres, ella trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes están en estudios superiores, es una mujer muy activa tiene como meta ver a sus hijos realizados con una carrera para luego pensar en otro tipo de negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale foodstuffs

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio is a single mother and has 5 children. She used to live with her partner but since they separated she has looked after all her family's expenses.She started her business a year ago, as she needed to make money to support her family. It was then she decided to make food like tamales and pays in her home, and began to sell them. Little by little she gained clients through word of mouth, and now her business allows her to give her children all they need.

She needs a loan of US$300, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy an oven that will allow her to do her work more quickly. With your help Rocio will be able to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Rocio es madre soltera tiene cinco hijos, anteriormente vivía en unión libre pero se separo entonces ella se encarga de todos los gastos familiares. Inicio el negocio hace un año, ya que necesitaba tener dinero para mantener a su familia, fue entonces que deicidio hacer comida como tamales y pays en su casa y los empezó a vender, poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes que la fueron recomendando y ahora este negocio le permite darle lo necesario a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un horno que le permita hacer mas ágil su trabajo. Con tu ayuda Rocio hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.es:
Oscar is married and has two children of 5 years old and 11 months old. He started his business as a blacksmith when he became unemployed. At present he works in an assembly plant, but he keeps his other business going as an second job which gives him extra income to cover his household expenses.

He needs a loan of US$250, which he will repay in 3 months, to buy a metal polishing machine. With your help he will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer. es casado y tiene dos niños uno de cinco años y otro de once meses. Empezó con su negocio de herrería cuando se quedo desempleado, actualmente trabaja en una maquiladora, pero sigue teniéndolo este negocio como una actividad extra que le da otra entrada de dinero para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una pulidora. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase a metal polishing machine

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
Blanca is married and her husband is employed as an assembly plant worker, for which his salary is very small. She wanted to have extra income and started to sell food among her neighbours. She started her business approximately a year and a half ago, as their two children started primary school and they needed money to pay for the expense of school supplies, uniforms, etc. Her business has allowed them to give their children a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of US$250, which she will pay in six months, to buy a grill. With your help she will succeed in her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca es casada y su esposo es empleado en una maquiladora, por lo que sus ingresos son pocos, ella quería tener ingresos extras y empezó a ofrecer platillos entre sus vecinas, así inicio su negocio desde hace un año y medio aproximadamente ya que sus dos niños cursan la primaria y tienen gastos de útiles, uniformes, etc. y esto le ha permitido darles mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una parrilla, con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase a grill

loans.name: Virginia Francisca

texts.es:
Virginia, 51, lives in the Edgar Murguia neighborhood in Managua. Her husband works with her in their bakery, making deliveries. They have 4 children; the three oldest work in the bakery as well.
Virgina hopes that her children will continue working on business she started and that their quality of life will be better.
Twelve years ago, Virginia was working in a bakery, and thanks to the experience she gained, decided to start to her own bakery six years ago. At the beginning it was hard because she had little capital and only a small oven to bake, but through these years she has been able to make improvements to her small bakery.
These days the demand for Virginia's bread and pastries is growing and she requests a loan to purchase a larger quantity of ingredients, make more bread and pastries, and keep her customers satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Virginia tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Edgar Munguía de la Ciudad de Managua. Es casada, su esposo trabaja con ella en la panadería, él es quien se encarga de repartir el producto. Tiene 4 hijos, los tres hijos mayores también trabajan con ella en la panadería. Ella espera que todos sus hijos algún día puedan seguir el negocio que ella empezó y así puedan mejorar su nivel de vida. Virginia empezó hace 12 años trabajando en una panadería, debido a la experiencia que pudo adquirir en este negocio, hace 6 años decidió independizarse y poner ella misma su negocio de panadería, al inicio fue duro porque disponía de poco capital y solamente tenía un horno pequeño para hacer el pan, pero a través de los años ha ido mejorando la panadería. Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes es por eso que solicita del préstamo para poder adquirir materia prima para la elaboración del pan y así poder satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of bakery ingredients

loans.name: Karla Faustina

texts.es:
Karla found it necessary to work as a household domestic in order to support her three children, as her family couldn't manage on the money earned by her partner. For some time she observed that the majority of houses hire furniture washing services, and the idea of providing this service to earn extra income occurred to her. Her clients accepted her for this extra work and little by little, she has gained clients to whom she provides this service.

She needs a loan of US$550, which she will pay back in 6 months, in order to buy an industrial vacuum cleaner so that she can provide a better sevrice to her clients. With your help Karla will be able to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Karla se vio en la necesidad de trabajar como empleada domestica a particulares debido a que tenia que mantener a sus 3 hijos ya que no le alcanza con lo que gana su pareja desde hace algún tiempo observo que la mayoría de las casas a las que acude contratan el servicio de lavado de muebles, y se le ocurrió la idea de dar este servicio y ganarse un dinero extra si ella lo realizaba, sus clientes aceptaron darle el trabajo a ella y poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes a los cuales les proporciona este servicio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una aspiradora industrial y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Karla podrá lógralo

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum cleaner

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto has always worked in business, but for six years has managed to get a concession, granted by the city council, to run a motorcycle taxi service. Since then this has been his main source of income. Over time he has been making progress with the business and has been able to buy another motorcycle to also use to sell his handmade toys in town markets.

He needs a loan of US$400, which he will repay in 6 months, to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle and to be able to provide a good service.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Gilberto, siempre se había dedicado al comercio, pero hace 6 años logro conseguir una concesión que se otorgan en los municipios para poder laborar como moto taxis, desde entonces esa ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que con el tiempo ha ido progresando en el negocio y ya hasta pudo comprarse otra moto para utilizarla también en su venta de juguetes que hace en las ferias de los pueblos.

El necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para darle mantenimiento a su moto y poder brindar un buen servicio.

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Rita Beatriz

texts.es:
When she was very young, Rita learned to make hammocks, and now that it is necessary to help her husband with the expenses of raising their three children, she makes and sells the same. Her business provides them with a good income, as they sell them not only in their village, but also in other nearby towns.

She needs a loan of US$250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy thread to make the hammocks, and to bring them to sell at the town market.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy pequeña la señora Rita aprendió a elaborar hamacas, ahora con el tiempo ante la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de las mismas, negocio que le deja muy buenas ganancias, ya que no solo en su pueblo las vende, si no que las lleva a otras poblaciones cercanas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos para elaborar mas hamacas, y llevarlas a vender a la feria del pueblo.

loans.use: To purchase thread

loans.name: Cosset Aminta

texts.es:
Cosset, 26, lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, and is married. Her husband works and contributes to the house expenses.
Cosset opened a small corner store with her own savings five years ago. The loan she is requesting this time is to purchase a larger variety of products to offer to her current customers and to attract other customers.
A few years ago, Cosset lost her little son. Her business has helped her to overcome her grief over what happened; she invests much time and effort in her business.
She hopes one day to rebuild her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Cosset habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Cosset tiene una pulpería con cinco años en las ventas, ella inició con fondos propio. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de la pulpería para ofrecer a sus clientes variedades de productos así como la captación de otros clientes. Hace algunos años Cosset perdió a su pequeño hijo, su negocio la ha ayudado a sobreponerse y sobrellevar lo que pasó, ella le dedica mucho esfuerzo y tiempo a su negocio. Espera poder algún día reconstruir su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell in corner store

loans.name: Daysi Antonia

texts.es:
Daysi, 42, lives in the Laureles Sur area, is married and has an 18-year-old son. Her husband works as a driver and contributes to the household expenses.
Daysi works in a state agency as a security guard, and runs a small grocery store which she started ten years ago with her own savings.
She is requesting a loan to purchase grains to sell in the store.
Her plans are to diversify the products that she offers, and to eventually purchase a truck to start a moving and delivery business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Daysi habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como conductor y aporta a los gastos de la familia. Doña Daysi trabaja en una institución del estado desempeñándose como policía y tiene una pequeña inversión de una pulpería con diez años de experiencias en las ventas, inició con fondos propios. Con el dinero que esta solicitando es para la compra de granos básicos e invertirlos en la pulpería. Sus planes son diversificar el producto, así como invertir en la compra de una camioneta para ponerla a trabajar de acarreo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for corner store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica K. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through Diploma in Business Studies. Veronica sells corn, yams, groundnuts, and other items at Abura, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a driver. Veronica uses her income to pay her children's school fees and the family's utility bills.

Veronica will use the loan to purchase beans, groundnuts, corn, and yams for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: Purchase beans, groundnuts, corn, and yams for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam I. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Mariam sells groceries like tinned fish, milk, Milo, tinned tomatoes, etc. in Abura, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a steel bender.

Mariam uses her income to pay utility bills and her children's school fees. Mariam will use the loan to purchase more groceries such as milk, Milo, tinned fish, and other items. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mariam plans to pay their children's school fees and also to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: purchase more groceries like milk, Milo, tinned fish, and other items for re-sale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama M. is married and has 10 dependants. She has never attended school. Mariama sells beans, groundnuts, and other foodstuffs at Abura, which she has done since 1996. Her husband is a driver. Mariama uses her income to pay for utility bills and children's school fees.

Mariama will use the loan to purchase more powdered fish, beans, and groundnuts. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mariama plans to help her husband put up a family house and also help with the payment of school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more powdered fish, beans, and groundnuts for re-sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through the primary school level. Gladys sells onions, dried tilapia, and other food items in Abura, which she has done since 2000. Her husband repairs electronics.

Gladys uses her income to pay for school items like books, etc. for the children. Gladys will use the loan to increase her business capital. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to help build their own house.

loans.use: to increase her business capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca C. sells yams, eggs, groundnuts, beans and other food items at Abura. Francisca has received senior high education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver.

Francisca has been selling food items since 2000. She is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest into purchasing more of the items she sells.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es:
Alba Patricia is a young, 33-year-old married mother of 3 children ages 18, 15, and 10. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, in which she runs her own general store to serve her neighbors. Eight years ago, Alba was one of the few people who received water services in the neighborhood, which is why she used to sell water to the people who did not have it. However, after all of the inhabitants were provided with water services, she had to seek a new way to make money. She and her husband decided to sell assorted products from home using their own capital. Alba started out with only a little capital, which is why she needed loans to be invested in her business. This loan will be used to purchase products such as staple grains and pulses, cleaning products, and perishable goods to invest them in her general store because she currently has little merchandise, and would like to expand and diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alba Patricia es una joven de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 18, 15 y 10 años. Habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, en donde tiene una pulpería en la que atiende a sus vecinos. Hace 8 años Alba era una de las pocas personas que contaba con el servicio de agua en el barrio es por eso que se dedicaba a la venta de agua a las personas que no tenían, pero al instalarse el servicio a todos los pobladores, tuvo que buscar una nueva forma de negocio, y junto a su esposo y con capital propio decidieron comenzar las ventas de diversos productos en su casa de habitación. Alba al inicio contaba con poco capital para empezar, es por eso que ha necesitado de créditos para inversión de su negocio. El préstamo será usado para la compra de productos como granos básicos, de limpieza y perecederos para invertirlos en su pulpería, ya que actualmente cuenta con poca mercadería, y desea diversificar y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase assorted products for general store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
For eight years now, Yolanda has been selling cosmetics by catalogue. Her daughter is the one who encouraged her to get involved in this business activity because Yolanda used to sell and distribute calling cards to stores. Her friends and neighbors are her customers.

Likewise, Yolanda has a child advocacy office in which she provides consultancy for children’s rights and support with problems of this nature.

The loans that she has received have allowed her to both pay for cosmetics in advance and have a stockpile of products at home. Yolanda would also like to expand her capital and start new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 8 años, Yolanda vende cosméticos por catálogo. Su hija fue quien le animó a dedicarse a esta actividad, ya que Yolanda vendía y repartía tarjetas telefónicas a tiendas. Sus vecinos y amigos son sus clientes.

Asimismo, Yolanda tiene una defensoría de los derechos del niño, donde brinda apoyo y asesoría en problemas de esta índole.

Los préstamos que ella ha recibido le han servido para pagar los cosméticos por adelantado y tener un stock de productos en su casa. A Yolanda le gustaría hacerse de un capital de dinero más grande y comenzar nuevos proyectos.

loans.use: Pay for cosmetics in advance and have a stockpile of products at home

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
For 15 years now, Raquel has been selling cosmetics by catalogue to her friends and neighbors for a living. She and her husband have also been running a soda fountain for 18 years. The idea to establish this business came up when her husband became unemployed. Raquel used to sell food in front of her house.

She has used the loans that she has received to pay for the cosmetics in advance and have a large stockpile of products at home. Raquel would also like to have her own car so that she can get around and collect the money she is owed for her cosmetics sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 15 años, Raquel se dedica a vender cosméticos por catálogo a sus amistades y vecinos. También, junto con su esposo, ella tiene una fuente de soda desde hace 18 años. La idea de poner este negocio surgió a raíz de que su esposo se quedó sin trabajo. Raquel antes vendía comida en la puerta de su casa.

Los préstamos recibidos los ha utilizado para pagar los cosméticos por adelantado y para tener un stock amplio de productos en su casa. Raquel quisiera tener un auto propio para poder movilizarse y realizar sus cobros por los cosméticos que vende.

loans.use: Pay for cosmetics in advance and have a large stockpile of products at home

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth has been selling cosmetics for 10 years. She is a regional leader for a well-known cosmetics company. Her job is to recruit new people who want to sell those products. Ruth also has been selling clothing by order form to her friends for 2 years.

She has used her previous loans by investing them into the cosmetics business. She would also like to have her own booth in which she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruth vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 10 años. Ella es líder zonal de una conocida empresa de cosméticos. Su función es buscar nuevas personas que quieran vender estos productos. Ruth también vende ropa por pedidos a sus amistades desde hace 2 años.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para invertir en el negocio de los cosméticos. A Ruth le gustaría un puesto propio donde ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics business

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
Noelia has sold cosmetics by catalogue for 10 years. She teaches English, offering her products to her colleagues and acquaintances in the school where she teaches. For now, Noelia has had to leave her educational work to be dedicated to the care of her smaller daughter. Nevertheless, she continues teaching private English lessons in her residence.

The loans she has obtained have been invested in paying in advance for the cosmetics that she sells.

Noelia would like to work again in the school next year and build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Noelia vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 10 años. Ella es profesora de inglés, por lo que sus productos los ofrecía a sus colegas y conocidos en el colegio donde enseñaba. Por ahora, Noelia ha tenido que dejar su labor de docente para dedicarse al cuidado de su menor hija, sin embargo, ella sigue dictando clases de inglés a domicilio.

Los préstamos obtenidos los ha invertido en el pago por adelantado de los cosméticos que vende.

A Noelia le gustaría volver a trabajar en el colegio el próximo año y construir su propia casa.

loans.use: To pay in advance for the cosmetics that she sells.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter has art in his blood. Together with his brothers, he has worked for 8 years doing children’s shows. In addition, he sings and plays the organ in an orchestra. Likewise, he performs at parties. He always loves the work, having sometimes 4 events per week.

The loans that he has received have been used to repair his computer, which is essential to his work.

Walter would like to have contracts at the national level and in this way become better known.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Walter lleva el arte en la sangre. Junto con sus hermanos, trabaja desde hace 8 años haciendo shows infantiles. También canta y toca el órgano en una orquesta musical. Asimismo, es animador de fiestas. Siempre goza de trabajo, a la semana tiene hasta 4 eventos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para reparar su computadora que es herramienta de su trabajo.

A Walter le gustaría tener contratos a nivel nacional y así hacerse más conocido.

loans.use: To repair his computer, which is an essential tool for his work.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina has been dedicated for 20 years to the sale of cosmetics by catalog. She sold sweets, but then she began to work as a cleaning woman in a beauty products business. In this way, she was recruited as a new saleswomen of this type of products. Currently, Marina has given this job to her daughter. Nevertheless, she continues selling cosmetics to her acquaintances.

The loans that she has requested have been utilized to invest in a stock of cosmetics.

Marina would like to have a bazaar where she could exhibit the products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Ella antes vendía golosinas, pero luego comenzó a trabajar como asistenta en una empresa de belleza. De este modo, fue reclutando nuevas vendedoras de este tipo de productos. En la actualidad, Marina ha dejado este puesto de trabajo a su hija, sin embargo, ella continúa vendiendo cosméticos a sus conocidos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha utilizado para invertir en un stock de cosméticos.

Marina quisiera tener un bazar donde exhibir los productos que ofrece.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia has sold used tires along with her husband for 18 years. At the beginning, they had a store, but then they had to close it due to labor problems. Then, they decided to sell on the street beside a gas station. Thus they have made ends meet up to now.

Also, Claudia has a rental store for lighting and sound equipment with her brother.

The loans that she has received have been used to maintain the lighting equipment that they rent and for the location where they run the store.

Claudia would like to modernize their sound equipment.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia vende llantas usadas junto con su esposo desde hace 18 años. Al comienzo, ellos tenían una tienda, pero luego tuvieron que cerrarla por problemas laborales. Luego, decidieron vender de forma ambulatoria al costado de un grifo. Y así se han mantenido hasta el momento.

También, Claudia tiene con su hermano una tienda de alquiler de luces y equipo de sonido.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para el mantenimiento de las luces que alquila y para el local donde funciona esta tienda.

A Claudia le gustaría modernizar sus equipos de sonido.

loans.use: To maintain the lighting equipment that they rent and to keep up the location where they have the store.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
For five years, Nora has sold natural products. She was sick and was invited to try these products, which worked very well. In this way, she began to recommend them and now she goes looking for new customers and people who are interested in selling these products.

Nora worked as a cleaner in a hospital, but when she had her daughter, she decided to leave that job. Nevertheless, twice a week, she cleans houses.

The loans that she has received have been invested in the purchase of more natrual products and to improve her home's infrastructure. Nora would like to have a stall in the market from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora vende productos naturistas desde hace 5 años. Ella estuvo enferma, por lo que le invitaron a probar estos productos y le funcionaron muy bien. Fue así que empezó a recomendarlos y ahora sale a buscar nuevos clientes y personas que se interesen en vender este producto. Nora trabajaba haciendo limpieza en un hospital, pero luego tuvo su hija, por lo que decidió dejar esta actividad. Sin embargo, 2 veces a la semana ella trabaja haciendo limpieza en casas particulares. Los préstamos recibidos han sido invertidos en la compra de más productos naturistas y para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Nora quisiera tener un puesto en el mercado y vender sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase more natural products and improve her home.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
For seven years, Miriam has been dedicated to selling clothing by order. She also makes handicrafts that serve as raw material in the creation of earrings and necklaces. She works molding metal wires and then offering them for wholesale prices in stores that sell artesanal materials and costume jewelry.

She has used the loans that she has received to invest in clothing. Miriam would like to have a clothing stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 7 años. También hace artesanías que sirven de materia prima en la elaboración de aretes y collares. Ella trabaja moldeando los alambres de metal y luego los ofrece por mayor a las tiendas que venden materiales artesanales y de bisutería. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para invertir en la ropa que reparte por pedidos. A Miriam le gustaría tener un puesto de ropa en el mercado.

loans.use: To invest in clothing that she sells by order.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
For two years, Rosa has sold clothing and cosmetics by orders. Also, she sells natural products from the brand "Biolife" to her acquaintances and friends. Rosa is in charge of finding new people who want to test and distribute these products. At the same time, twice a week, Rosa takes care of an elderly person.

The loans that she has requested have been used to invest in more natural products and to have her own stock. Rosa would like to have a shop where she can sell a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vende ropa y cosméticos por pedidos desde hace 2 años. También, ella ofrece productos naturistas de la marca “Biolife” a sus conocidos y amigos. Rosa se encarga de buscar nuevas personas que quieran probar estos productos y distribuirlos. Asimismo, dos veces por semana, Rosa cuida a una anciana. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha utilizado para invertir en más productos naturistas y tener un stock propio. Rosa quisiera tener un bazar donde ofrecer productos variados.

loans.use: To invest in more natural products and have her own stock.

loans.name: Fraxila

texts.es:
For 23 years, Fraxila has sold vegetbales and tubers outside in her neighborhood's market. Every day, she rises at 3AM in order to buy produce at wholesale prices and get everything ready to begin selling from 8AM until 2PM. Previously, Fraxila was dedicated to sewing clothes in her home, however, she decided to leave that job because the selling in the market required a lot of time and effort.

The loans that she has received have been used to fix her home. Now, Fraxila would like to purchase a car and rent it out as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 23 años, Fraxila vende verduras y tubérculos afuera del mercado de su barrio. Ella todos los días se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para salir a comprar por mayor las verduras y dejar todo listo para empezar a vender desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Fraxila antes se dedicaba a coser ropa en su casa, pero decidió dejar esta actividad porque las ventas en el mercado le exige mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para arreglar su casa. A Fraxila le gustaría comprarse un auto y alquilarlo como taxi.

loans.use: To fix the infrastructure of her home.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila has owned a photography studio for the past five years. Previously, she worked independently photographing events for which she was hired. Nevertheless, she then had her son and decided to open her photography studio in her home.

Lila also offers photocopying services to the public and sells rolls of fim, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products. She also films events and parties on video.

She has invested the loans that she has received in her camera and the computer that she uses to edit photos. Lila would like to increase the stock of products that she sells in her studio. In addition, she would like to hire an assistant who could stay in the shop while she goes out to take pictures and video.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lila tiene un estudio de fotografía desde hace 5 años. Antes, ella trabajaba de forma independiente fotografiando en eventos a la que le llamaban. Sin embargo, luego tuvo su hijo, por lo que decidió abrir un estudio fotográfico en su casa. Lila también ofrece al público servicio de fotocopia y venta de rollos de fotografía, cosméticos y artículos de bazar. Eventualmente, ella trabaja filmando eventos y fiestas en video. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en su cámara filmadora y en la computadora que utiliza en la edición de sus fotos. A Lila le gustaría aumentar su stock de productos que ofrece en su estudio fotográfico. Además, quisiera contar con un personal de trabajo que pudiera quedarse en la tienda mientras ella sale a hacer sus fotografías o filmaciones.

loans.use: To increase her stock and hire an assistant.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
For a year, Miriam has painted pictures and decorative plates. She works in her house making these types of handicrafts from Trupan wood in order to sell them later with her husband and friends. She sells decorative plates, coat racks, and handpainted pictures.

Miriam ran a bookstore in her mother's house but she had to close it as it was far from her house and her children.

She has invested the loans she has received in the purchase of wood and painting materials. Miriam would like to have her own shop from which she could sell her decorative products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam pinta cuadros y plato decorativos desde hace 1 año. Ella trabaja en su casa haciendo esta clase de manualidades en madera Trupan, para luego venderlas por medio de su esposo y amigos. Ofrece platos decorativos, percheros y cuadros pintados a mano. Miriam tenía una librería en la casa de su mamá, pero tuvo que cerrarla debido a que le quedaba muy lejos de su casa y de sus hijos. Los préstamos que ha obtenido los ha invertido en la compra de la madera y los materiales de pintura. A Miriam le gustaría tener un local propio donde vender sus productos de decoración.

loans.use: Purchase wood and painting materials.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a 30-year-old man. He is married and has 4 children. He lives near the international airport of Kabul. He has a carpentry shop that he opened two years ago. Before that, he worked in an apprenticeship with someone else. Now he is brilliant at his business. He would love to expand his business.

So he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete his stock and buy new machines for his shop to attract more customers for his business because he is new in his business. He is sure that he can do it.

Abdul is very happy with this loan process specially for those who want to start a new business or people who have less money. He hopes to continue his partnership with both AFSG and Kiva. He would like to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy new machines

loans.name: Zulmai

texts.en:
Zulmai is 29 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has a small shop of plasticware and glasses. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. During this time he has always worked hard to help his family but he has been unable to enlarge his shop, until he heard about the small loan process. Now he is happy. He wants to further his business, and therefore, he wants to take out a loan.

Zulmai has requested an individual loan to buy more glasses and plates for his shop and enlarge his shop so that, day by day, he can make his business large enough to become strong and help his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

He would like to be one of the great business dealers in the future. He hopes to open another shop in the next 3 or 4 years. He is happy and he would like to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more glasses and plates

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Àçèìóðîäîâ Ðóñòàì ðîäèëñÿ 24 ñåíòÿáðÿ 1963 ãîäà, æåíàò. Îí òîðãîâåö îáóâè óæå ìíîãî ëåò è â åãî àññîðòèìåíòå ìîæíî íàéòè âñå ðàçíîâèäíîñòè îáóâè, íà÷èíàÿ îò ñàìûõ ñîâðåìåííûõ äëÿ äåëîâûõ âñòðå÷ è çàêàí÷èâàÿ äëÿ ñàìûõ ìàëåíüêèõ äæåíòëüìåíîâ.  À òîðãóåò îí íà ðûíêå «Õàéð» ãîðîäà Âàõäàò è ïîìîãàåò åìó â ýòîì æåíà. Àçèìóðîäîâ çàêóïàåò òîâàð â îïòîâîì ðûíêå «Êîðâîí».  Ó Ðóñòàìà â ðûíêå åñòü ëàâêà è ó íåãî åñòü ìå÷òà, êàê ó ëþáîãî íà÷èíàþùåãî ïðåäïðèíèìàòåëÿ, îí õî÷åò êóïèòü ñåáå ìàãàçèí. Â ñâÿçè ñ ýòèì è ñ öåëüþ ðàñøèðåíèÿ íàèìåíîâàíèå òîâàðîâ åìó áû õîòåëîñü ïîëó÷èòü çàéì â ñóììå 4000 ñîìîíè ñðîêîì 5 ìåñÿöåâ.
texts.en:
