Rustam A. was born on the 24th of September, 1963. He is married. He has been in the business of selling shoes for many years now. He has a large variety of shoes for sale ranging from most modern shoes for business meeting to children's shoes. He works on the Hair market located in the city of Vahdat. His wife helps him with the business. Rustam purchases goods wholesale on the Kovon market. Currently he sells his goods at a sales point on the market, but he dream of purchasing an actual store. In order to be able to achieve his dream he plans to increase the amount of shoes he has in stock. For this purpose he would like to obtain a 12 months loan of $1175

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of shoes in stock

loans.name: Emaam

texts.en:
Emaam J., a resident of Ningarhar Province, is 21 and the married father of two children, aged five and three years. Emaam and his family have been living in their own small village house for about three years, since the death of his father for whom he had worked in a retail capacity in Jalalabad.

Since arriving in the village at his uncle’s behest, Emaan has been farming successfully, growing wheat, corn, eggplant, tomatoes and okra, but he would now like to buy seeds and insecticides in order to expand his produce range and market.  For these reasons he is requesting a loan of $1075 for a period of 23 months.

Emaam J. hopes to achieve his target and make his dreams come true. He desires to bring about positive changes in his life and that of his family, as well as in the lives of other poor people. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha L. is a 40-year-old widow living in Vatamim Commune, Pursat Province. For income, she rears poultry and sells fish in her village market. She has been selling since 2005, earning approximateL. $5 per day. She lives with five children and also cares for her mother and brother. As she is responsible for covering the entire famiL.'s expenses, she works hard every day.

Her fish sales business is growing, as are her customers' demands. Sokha has a chance to increase her income by selling more but she lack the capital to increase sales. She has therefore decided to request a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She is the mother of four daughters.  Her elder daughter is in 10th standard.  The next eldest daughter is in 8th standard.  The younger to them is in 5th standard.  Her last daughter is in kindergarten.  Her husband runs a grocery shop and has 8 years of experience.  Razia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her daughters.  She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store.  She and her husband wish to give their daughters a better future and good education.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Razia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  Musarat baji wants a loan to buy edible items (chips, nimko) to resell.  Shahida baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business.  Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy wooden baskets to resell.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema baji is the wife of Z. A. and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a school in her neighborhood. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Her husband has a wood business. He is a woodcutter by profession. He buys wood from a local market and cuts it into pieces and sells them at the market and in his community. Z. A. is the only breadwinner for the family. Heleema baji is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Suraiya baji and Kosar baji each want a loan to buy mason's tools. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy crockery to re-sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy candies to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to cut and re-sell

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi baji is the wife of M. and the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 16 years. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, having 6 years' experience. Her younger son and daughter are in kindergarten. Allah Rakhi baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy wood to make furniture and help her husband expand his business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy bicycles for her bicycles shop. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy a cart for her husband to use selling soft drinks. Bushran baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband's furniture business

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji is the wife of A. A. and the mother of nine children: five sons and four daughters. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan and has been living there for the last 45 years. She owns a two-room brick house. Her elder son sells vegetables. Her husband sells wheat and has been in this profession for the last 6 years.

Fatima baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work, taking care of her family. Fatima baji has a big family and their financial status is shakey. Therefore, Fatima baji is applying for a loan to buy more wheat and vegetables to expand their businesses.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Sajida baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Zareena baji wants a loan to buy more fruit to re-sell. Rozina baji wants a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy more cloth to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is the wife of M. and a mother of one son.  His name is Faisal and he is 10 years old.  He is in 5th standard.  Salma baji lives with her family in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years.  Her husband is a wheat seller and has been in this profession for the last 7 years.  Salma baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She is applying for a loan to buy more wheat to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy more video games for her video game shop.  Hajra baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes for her cigarette shop.  Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.  Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle).

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wheat to resell

loans.name: Fatha Mohammad

texts.en:
Fatha M. is married. He lives in a household of 7. He is an uneducated man but he has a small business selling fuel that he started 7 years ago. It is still going, but in the past 2 years his business has not been going as well as before because now there are a lot of fuel pump stations in Kabul. Fatha M. would like to open a small fuel pump station in Kabul, therefore he needs some money.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 18 months to open a small pump station and buy more fuel to make his business like other business dealers' in Kabul. He is sure that he can do it with this loan.

He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan that helps people who want to further their businesses. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a small pump station

loans.name: Mohammad Dawood

texts.en:
Mohammad Dawood is married. He lives with his own, nuclear family. He has a car parts shop that he has been involved in for more than 5 years in Kabul. Before this he was in Iran where he had a small shop. When he came back 5 years ago, he continued his business in Kabul, but he wants to enlarge his shop and still he can't do it in Kabul. Therefore he needs a loan.

He wants to take out an individual loan to import more car parts for his shop and continue his business with more success in Kabul. He wants to become strong in his business.

He is happy with all members of his family. He has a plan to have anther shop in the next few years in Kabul to help his family better. He wants to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To import more spare parts for cars

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.ru:
Джаборов Абдулхамид родился 2 февраля 1956 года. Он женат, у него 3 детей. Начал свой бизнес с продажи риса и занимается этим 5 лет. В его ассортимент входят различные виды рисов как «Дев-зира», «Ёва», «Кенджа», сечка. Иногда в его ассортименте можно увидеть бобовые культуры как фасоль и гарох. Ему в торговле помогает сын. Его места торговли центральный рынок города Вахдат а закупает товар в рынке «Шохмансур». В сезон сбора урожая Абдулхамид ездит на рисовые поля чтоб договорится о покупке риса у самих дехкан. В связи с этим он хочет получит займ в сумме 4100 сомони на год. 
На будущее Абдулхамид хочет построить себе магазин и расширить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Abdulhamid Djaborov was born on the 2nd of September, 1956. He is married and has 3 children. He has his business of selling rice 5 years ago. He has a large variety of different types of rice for sale. Sometimes he sells beans and peas as well. His son helps him with the business. He purchases goods on the Shohmansur market and sells it on the Vahdat market. When rice is in season, Abdulahmid travels to the rice fields to be able to purchase rice directly. He would like to obtain a 1 year loan of $1200 to stock up on goods boost his business.

In the future he plans to build himself a store and increase the variety of goods he has for sale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and peas

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара родилась 1960 году. Она разведена и у нее 2 детей, они живут в городе Вахдат. На данный момент она занимается продажей продуктов питания и народного потребления. Гулсаре помогает племянник. А бизнес она начала с продаж продуктов питания еще 5 лет назад. Гулсара занимается этой деятельностью в центральном рынке города Вахдат. Большую часть своих товаров она а закупает в торговом центре «Садбарг». С целью расширения ассортимента (конфеты, печенье, рулеты, зубная паста…) и оборота своего бизнеса она хочет получить займ в сумме 1600 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев а в будущем хочет открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Gulsara was born in 1960. She is divorced and has 2 children. They live in the city of Vahdat. Currently, she sells foodstuffs and household goods. Gulsara’s nephew helps her. She started selling food 5 years ago. Gulsara works in the Vahdat central market. She purchases most of her goods from the Sadbarg shopping center. In order to expand her inventory (to include candy, cookies, sweet rolls, tooth-paste, etc.) and keep the money in her business, she wants to take out a loan for 1600 somoni for 12 months. In the future, she wants to open her own shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing different types of sweets

loans.name: Dok

texts.en:
Mrs. Dok C. T. lives in B'er Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Prum Saroeun, sells fish in the local market. His business is going well, and Mr. Prum Saroeun wants to expand his business. So his wife, Mrs. Dok C. T., is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her husband's business so he can fulfill the customers' needs.

Mrs. C. T. is 38 years old and has 4 children; 1 is employed in a garment factory, and 2 others are attending school. The remaining child is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Dok C. T. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business. She has fully paid back the loan.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell to meet the customers' needs

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Mrs. Huot S. is a basket maker in Bompong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Prak Poch, is a farmer and pig breeder in the local village (pictured on the left). Mrs. Huot S. and her husband are building a house, but they do not have enough money now to buy timber to make the walls. So Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Huot S. is 38 years old and the mother of two children who attend school. This is the third time that she has requested a loan because of a financial crisis in the household. Previously, Mrs. S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy timber to make the walls of her new home

loans.name: Guljamol

texts.ru:
Гулджамол родилась 21 марта  1969 года. После развода с мужем осталась с двумя  детьми. Чтобы прокормить семью она решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Так, как она раньше работала в Райпотребсоюзе, имела опыт продавца. Она арендовала торговую точку в Центральном рынке города Вахдат для продажи парфюмерий. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя Гулджамол на вырученные деньги с бизнеса пускала в оборот увеличивая ассортимент товаров. В ее ассортименте добавились детские игрушки, постельное белье, женские косынки и приборы бытового обслуживания. 
Свои товары она закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Для расширения ассортимента, покупка разновидностей постельного белья и бытовых приборов хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 11 месяцев.
texts.en:
Guljamol was born on March 21st, 1969. After divorcing her husband, she was left with two children. She decided to become an entrepreneur to support her family. Since she had already worked in the regional Consumer's Association, she had experience in sales. She rented a booth in the central market in the town of Vahdat to sell perfume. Gaining experience as an entrepreneur, Guljamol used the money she earned to expand her line of products. The assortment of items she sold came to include toys, bed linen, scarves, and household items. She buys her merchandise at the whole-sale market Korvon in Dushanbe. She wants to take out a loan for 4100 somoni in order to expand her line of linen and household items. The loan will be repaid in full within 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household items

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: B. Dilorom is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. She lives in Shahrituz town and owns a small vending store in the local market. Dilorom has been selling children’s clothing for about seven years. Her store is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted children’s clothing at affordable prices. Her business has seen a 300% profit increase since she started her small venture. Her turnover capital has doubled in that time as well. Dilorom has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and make it successful. Dilorom has received and repaid 8 loans from IMON without any delinquencies. Today she is requesting a loan of 1200 Somoni (375 USD) for the term of 12 months to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profits as a result. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Increase working capital to develop her business.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat baji is the wife of M. and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 40 years. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Her elder son has a grocery shop and the young one makes embroidered dresses. Her elder daughter is in 8th standard and the younger is in 5th standard. Her husband runs a grocery shop. Musarat baji successfully completed repaying two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband and her son's grocery stores.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy crockery to re-sell. Bashiran baji wants a loan to repair her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy wooden baskets to re-sell. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shops

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros T. is basket maker and farmer in Bampong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Um Pa, is a fisherman who has a small income to support his family. They have two children who are employed in a garment factory. (The picture shows Mrs. Ros T. and her husband.)

On their plantation, Mrs. T. faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. So she is requesting a loan to buy a second ox to plow the rice field so she can cultivate rice. Previously, Mrs. Ros T. had a loan to buy rice seeds and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy one more ox to help her old one plow the rice field

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a wife of Mr. S. and a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Her elder son is in kindergarten. Her husband is a wheat seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Naseem baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She used that loan for her husband’s wheat business. Now she is applying for a loan again for her husband’s wheat business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy eatable thing (chips) to resell. Irshad baji and Manzooran baji each want a loan to buy fruits to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wheat to resell

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: This is the third cycle of loans for Mrs. YANG S. to improve her living conditions. She is a villager in Soben (Dream) village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Previously, Mrs. YANG S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business, and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. YANG S. wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan again to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Mrs. YANG S. is a 45-year-old widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.ru:
Нурединов Абдусамат, 1968 года рождения, он женат и у них 3 детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал в 1998 году, с продажи тканей. Он торгует на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. У них семейный бизнес и партнером  по бизнесу является его жена, которая очень хорошо разбирается в тканях. У них много клиентов, как обычные покупатели, так и швейные цеха. В его ассортименте имеются такие ткани как велюр, шифон, шелк и т.д.
Свой товар Абдусамат закупает в оптовых рынках. В сезон свадебных мероприятий увеличивается спрос на разновидность материалов. В такие моменты клиенту необходимы дополнительные средства для увеличения ассортимента и количество продаваемого товара. Для этого он хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони и погасить его в течении года.
texts.en:
Abdusamat N. was born in 1968. He is married and has 3 children. He began his business in 1998 selling fabrics. He trades in the Khair market in Vahdat. This is a family business, and his business partner is his wife who knows fabrics very well. They have many clients, both from the general public and from sewing shops. Their inventory includes fabrics such as velour, chiffon, silk, etc.


Abdusamat buys his goods in wholesale markets. During the wedding season, the demand for a large variety of material increases. At that time, they need funds to increase both the variety and the quantity of goods available to their customers. Therefore, he wants to take out a loan for 4100 somoni and pay it off in a year.


Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years.  She has no children.  Her husband is a driver by profession with 8 years of experience.  Seema baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  She made an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) business from that loan.  Now she is applying for a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Najma baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  Salma baji wants a loan to buy materials (cooking oil, lentils, rice) for her food business.  Parveen baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell.  Niamat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Salimdjon

texts.ru:
Нуридинов Салимджон родился 24 июня 1971 года рождения. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Салимджон является одним из преуспевающим бизнесменом в своем городе. Он торгует тканями разного вида. Благодаря жене, которая хорошо разбирается в особенностях ткани и которая помогает по бизнесу, у него самые модные ткани для невесток местного населения. А это очень важно в сезон свадеб. В его ассортименте товара можно найти очень красивые ворсовые ткани со стразами и легкие шифоны с необычными узорами. Местом его деятельности рынок «Хайр» города Вахдат, а закупает Салимджон товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон».
Салимджон в этом бизнесе 10 лет, и сейчас он хочет получить займ 4100 сомони сроком 10 месяцев и увеличить оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Salimdjon N. was born on June 24, 1971. He is married and has four children. Salimdjon is one of the most successful businessmen in his town. He sells different types of fabrics. Thanks to his wife who knows about fabric qualities and helps with the business, he has the most trendy fabrics for brides who reside in the area and this is very important during the wedding season. A lot of beautiful pile fabrics with rhinestones and light chiffons with unique patterns could be found in his collection. Salimdjon does business on the Hire market and buys fabrics wholesale on the Kovron market.

He has been in this business for the past ten years and now wants to get a loan for 4100 somoni (USD$1,200) for a 10 months term to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy variety of fabrics

loans.name: Khit

texts.en:
Mrs. Khit C. lives in Takol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells a kind of Khmer cake (kanlan), which she makes from sticky rice and beans. Mrs. C.'s customers find her cakes very delicious.

Her husband, Mr. Penh Pin, is a construction worker who builds houses, and is also a farmer. They have four children, two of whom are attending school, and two are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Khit C.'s family lives in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. C. is requesting a loan to add to her savings so they can build a new house for thier family.

loans.use: Add to savings to purchase materials to build a new house for the family

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
C. Aziz is a widower. He is a businessman of 27 who deals in a variety of merchandise: mirrors, needles, thread, soap, shampoo, toothbrushes and other small items. He sells his merchandise on both a retail and a wholesale basis. His business is located in the local market.

His sister who is pictured in the photo helps Aziz with the business. Aziz is looking after two dependant children: a girl aged 7 and a boy of 5. He has been able to meet the needs of the children using the income from his business but unfortunately this leaves him with almost no savings available as capital for investment.

Aziz is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) to expand his business. When this is achieved, he believes he will be able to save money to buy a plot of land where he can construct a house. This loan will be repaid in 3 months. Aziz thanks all for their support and promises to manage the loan without any violations.

loans.use: Purchasing goods in order to enlarge his inventory

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann I. is the middleman selling dry fish in Phsar Leur Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because her business is doing well, Mrs. Vann I. wants to expand it. So she is asking for a loan to buy more dry fish in increase her inventory.

Previously, Mrs. I. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business and she has fully repaid the loan. She is a 52-year-old widow with 3 children. One child is employed in a garment factory, and the others assist their mother in her business.

loans.use: Buy more dry fish to increase inventory

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Mrs. Tat L. is a pig and poultry breeder in Trea Tbong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 56-year-old widow without any children. She is a hard-working woman who supports herself.

Because her business is going well, Mrs. L. wants to expand it. So she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding so she can earn more and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Buy more piglets for breeding to earn more and improve living conditions

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru: Олимов Джамшед родился в 1975 году. Он женат и имеет 4 иждивенцев. В городе Вахдате есть бильярдные клубы, куда часто приходят молодежь и любители бильярда. Джамшед тоже любил бильярд и начал работать смотрителем в одном из бильярдных клубов города. Работая в клубе ему понравился этот вид бизнеса и он решил открыть собственный бизнес. Часть своего дома переоборудовал под бильярдный клуб и теперь у него свои постоянные клиенты. В будущем он хочет купить еще несколько бильярдных и теннисных столов. Но до этого Джамшед хочет с помощью программы КИВА получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони и отремонтировать свой клуб.
texts.en:
Djamshed O. was born in 1975, he is married and has four dependent children. In his town of Vahdat there are many pool clubs which are often visited by young people and pool lovers. Djamshed also loves pool and started working as a watch guard in one of the local pool clubs. By working in this club he has realized that he likes this type of business and decided to start his own. He has remodeled part of his house for a pool club and he now has regular clients. In the future he wants to buy more pool and ping pong tables. But at this time Djamshed wants to get a loan of USD$1,200 (4100 somoni) with the help of Kiva to do repairs in his club.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair pool club inside the house

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Mr. Cheam L. lives in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He owns a small store in the local market where he sells different kinds of clothes. His wife, Mrs. Duong Sophat, helps out in the clothing store as a saleswoman.

In addition to the clothing business, he breeds cows. The breeding business is going well. So Mr. L. is requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy more calves for breeding. PreviousL., Mr. L. obtained a loan from AMK to buy cows for breeding and he has fulL. repaid it.

Mr. Cheam L. is 37 and the father of 4 children. Three of the children attend school and look after the cows when they have free time. The youngest child is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Add to his savings to buy more calves for breeding

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. He is living in a rented house. His elderly mother and father live with him in the same house. His oldest son is studying at the university, and the others are studying in school. He has a small sewing shop, and he applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric. He wants to renovate the shop in order to improve his life and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled.  Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Luwayo Women's Group

texts.en:
Mary N. is the chairperson of Luwayo women's group. She is married with 7 children, with no one else to cater for; her children are enough on her shoulders since her husband has resorted to drinking alcohol and is no support for his children. Fortunately, 4 of them are out of school managing their own businesses.

Mary has a retail shop in Luwayo trading center away from Lugazi town. Usually she does her shopping at the wholesale shops in Lugazi and so far her shop is prospering. With her previous loans, she has been able to pay her children's school fees using her savings and the support from her farm. Mary was a farmer long before she opened the shop but opted for the shop because it brings in quick money compared to farm products, and above all, she was able to get access to loans using her business. She has a dream of including the sale of cold drinks in her shop after getting electricity just from a pole at her neighbor's residence, but she still lacks the capital necessary for accomplishing the task. She now wants to restock her shop, buying sugar, washing soap, Vaseline, and bathing soap for more profits using the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to restock her shop

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina Y. is a young man who runs a billiards business in his house, charging players a fee to play. He lives with his mother who sells groceries from the house, which is a draw for the customers who come to play billiards. Sina's business is going well and typically earns him around $5 per day. Sina lives in Prey Nhy Commune, Pursat Province.

As his mother's business is growing and has seen an increasing numbers of customers, Sina would like to request a loan to purchase more groceries for his mother's business. Sina's mother is pictured because Sina was not available at the time the picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his mother's grocery business

loans.name: Nukra

texts.en:
Nukra C. is 34 years old. She is married and has three children to whom she wishes to give the best. Nukra is a market vendor. She is very dynamic and cares deeply for her family. She sells different kinds of hair accessories for girls and women in her store. The husband of Nukra who is pictured in the photo is also engaged in this business. 

Nukra tries to give her family as much money as possible so as to be able to cover the expenses of schooling for her children as she is dreaming that all of them might be well educated. Today Nukra wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 1700 Somoni (500 USD) for a term of 3 months. Having received loans from IMON several times already and having shown herself to be an responsible client, Nukra promises to manage this loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Expanding her business and increasing working capital to purchase new goods for sale

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey N. sells coal door-to-door in Khnach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because this business is going well, Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to buy a cart to transport her coal.

Mrs. N. is a 50-year-old widow with a child who is in high school. Previously, she obtained a loan to buy coal to resell in the village, and she has fully repaid the loan.

loans.use: Buy a cart to transport the coal when selling door-to-door

loans.name: Khursandi

texts.ru:
Ортуков Хурсанди, 1974 года рождения, женат, у него 3 детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал с продажи оргтехники и в этом бизнесе у него 8 лет опыта. Хурсанди торгует на Центральном рынке города Вахдат. Развивая бизнес, он увеличил свой ассортимент и теперь у него в продаже имеются разновидность аудио и видеоаппаратуры. Свои товары Хурсанди привозит с Оптового рынка «Корвон». Его товары имеют спрос у населения. Так, как аудио и видеоаппаратура требует демонстрационного показа для клиентов, в этом ему помогает его отец.
К Хурсанди часто поступают специальные заказы на его товар и он хочет с помощью полученного займа в сумме 4100 сомони увеличеть свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Khursandi O., born in 1974, is married and has three children. He started his career as an entrepreneur by selling business appliances. Now he has 8 years of experience in that field. Khursandi sells his products at the central market in the town of Vahdat. He grew his business and expanded his line of products. Now he also sells audio and video equipment. He buys his products whole-sale from the Korvon market. His products are in high demand. His father helps him in displaying and showing the client how the electronics work. Khursandi often receives special orders for his products, and he wants to take out a loan for 4100 somoni to be able to increase his working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various electronics

loans.name: Ziada's Tumekinai Group

texts.en:
Ziada is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been a fish and spice seller since 2005. By working each day from 6am to 6pm she can generate a monthly profit of about $90.

Ziada seeks a loan to increase her stock of fish and spices. She will share this loan with her sub-group member, Semeni, who sells soap and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more fish and spices.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya D. is 52 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 5 now independent children. Robiya owns a successful clothing and shoe sales business located at the Barakat market in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She has been selling in the market for about 15 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Robiya tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around US$ 200.

Robiya has requested a loan of 1000 Somoni (US$ 300) with a term of 4 months to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time of the year for many market vendors as college students, schoolboys and schoolgirls are now preparing for the 1st of September so her clothing is now in great demand. By purchasing additional inventory, Robiya will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverence, hard work, and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Mrs. Pal S. owns a small grocery store in the local market in Tropaing Pour Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Phy Chhanna, breeds pigs, and he also helps his wife when he has free time. (Mr. Chhanna is on the right in the photo.)

Mr Chhanna's pig breeding business is going well, and he wants to expand his business. Therefore, Mrs. Pal S. decided to request a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. S. is 53 years old, and has three children; one is employed in a garment factory, and the others attend school.

loans.use: Buy piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Hadisa

texts.ru: Рахимова Хадиса, 1970 года рождения, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Она работает в ОАО «Точиктелеком» 5 лет. Мечтала о том чтобы ее дети учились в хороших ВУЗ - ах и получили хорошие образование. В современном мире где ежедневно происходят изменения не обойтись без компьютера. Чтобы ее дети изучали эту технику она решила купить компьютер. Хадиса полученную зарплату полностью тратит на питание. С остаткам зарплаты ей прошлось бы год копить на эту технику. Чтоб выйти из ситуации она решила получить потребительский займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hadisa R. was born in 1970, is married and has four children. She works in a firm called Tochiktelecom for the past five years. Her dream is that her children will be able to go study in good universities and get an education. In today's ever changing world it's hard to get by without a computer. To give her children the opportunity to learn it, she decided to buy a computer. Hadisa spends her entire salary on food. With what is left over from her earnings she would have to save a whole year to buy a computer. To help herself out of this situation she decided to apply for a personal loan for the amount of USD$600 (2000 somoni) for a 6 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima M. is a very hard working, enthusiastic woman who has been raising her four children on her own. Because the small pension she received was not sufficient to cover the family's basic expenses, she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. Little by little, she gained more clients and increased her sales. Her wish to provide for her children and offer them a good education is what motivates her each day to improve and grow her business.

Fotima needs a loan in the amount of 1500 Somoni (450 USD), to be repaid in 4 months, to purchase merchandise for the new season and continue growing her business. She hopes you will choose to play an important role in her business' growth and in the life of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to expand her stock for the new season

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhim S. lives in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a garment factory worker who earns a small income to support her family.

She also is a vegetable farmer when she has free time from her work. Her plantation soil is infertile, so Mrs. Chhim S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to increase production. Mrs. S. is a 36-year-old widow without any children.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her fields

loans.name: Habiba's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Habiba is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 13, 12, 9, and 4. She became a charcoal and coconuts seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Habiba now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zuhura, who has a business dealing with firewood and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts for her  business

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Malohat M. has operated a clothing store in the central market of Shahrituz town. Determined, hard working and enterprising, Malohat has successfully grown her business to provide a stable and consistent income. Currently, she earns over US$ 180 per month in profit.

Malohat is divorced and her business is a valuable source of income for her and her two adorable children. This has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day.

Malohat wants to continue investing in her business. She is a long-term client at IMON and has successfully used the support of micro-loans to expand her business and generate additional income. Currently, Malohat is seeking a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) with a term of 12 months to increase her inventory. With additional profits, Malohat plans to continue developing her business and become a more successful entrepreneur. Malohat promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she did all the previous ones and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mr. Chhon Y. is a pig breeder in Thnorl Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. As a retired soldier, he receives a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Net Yoeun, is a Khmer noodle seller. Mr. Chhon Y. is 56 years old and has four children. One child sells Khmer noodles with his mother, and the other children attend school.

Although this family has multiple businesses, they still do not have enough money to build a new house. Thus, Mr. Y. is requesting a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for his family. Previously, Mr. Y. obtained a loan to start his pig breeding business. He has fully repaid the loan.

loans.use: Add to savings to build a new house for the family

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Нуриддин, 1957 года рождения, женат и у него семья из 6 детей. Он по профессии фармацевт, начал свою деятельность как продавец в одной из местных аптек города. Наращивая свой опыт в этом бизнесе Нуриддин решил открыть собственный аптечный киоск и вот уже 20 лет является владельцем аптечного киоска в центральном рынке города Вахдат. У него в продаже все наиболее используемые медикаменты, лечебные травы, косметические средства, принадлежности по уходу за ребенком и т.д. Свой товар Нуриддин закупает в фирме «Дусти и Эликсир» 
С помощью программы КИВА хочет получить займ на сумму 4000 сомони для увеличения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Nuriddin, who was born in 1957, is married and has 6 children. He is, by profession, a pharmacist. He began by working in sales at one of the local drugstores in the city. As he got experience, he decided to open his own pharmacy kiosk. Now, Nuriddin has owned his own pharmacy in Vahdat’s central market for 20 years. He sells all of the common medicines, medicinal herbs, cosmetics, baby care items, etc. Nuriddin buys his goods from the company Dusti i Elixir. Through Kiva, he wants to take out a loan for 4000 somoni to increase the variety of his goods.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing medicines

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat T. is 36 years old. She is divorced and raising her two children alone. She lives in Shahrituz and sells kids' clothing in the central local market. She always offers only the best quality, trendy merchandise. Her inventory is always in high demand among women customers.

Muhabbat is very enterprising and confident. She has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about US$ 500. Her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day and Muhabbat is doing all the best in order to ensure her children with a good education.

Today she is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) with a term of 12 months to purchase new, more expensive clothing before the autumn season. We believe Muhabbat’s willingness to offer her customers greater value and a wider choice of merchandise, combined with her excellent service, will secure the successful growth of her business and guarantee good profits from sales. She hopes one day to have enough savings to fulfill her desire to open her own larger clothing store in the city of Shahrituz. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working!

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for kids to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 33 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 16,18, 9, and 2. She has been a shoe seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 90 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Nachum

texts.en:
Nachum is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 8, 4 and 2. She also takes care of 2 other people aged 60 and 50 years old. She has sold charcoal and perfumes since 2007. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $82 from her sales.

Nachum now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and perfumes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 22, 20 and 18 years old. She has been a firewood and coconut seller since 1988. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mwanaidi now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 9, 6, and 2. She also takes care of 1 other person, aged 19. She has owned and run a small general store since 2000. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Hadia now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a widow with 5 children aged 19, 17, 12, 10, and 3 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Zainab's Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Zainab is 24 years old. She is married with a two-year-old child. She has been selling khanga and vitenge (traditional clothing) since 2005, working from 8am to 6pm each day.

Zainab requests a loan in order to buy more khanga and vitenge to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her sub-group member, Fatma, who sells potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and vitenge for her clothing business.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Собирова Дильбар 1949 года рождения. Она является вдовой и у нее 8 детей. Несмотря на свой возраст – 58 лет Дильбар занимается производством и продажей национальной одежды. Начала свой бизнес с торговли национальных платьев. Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья и продает их на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. В ее производственном ассортименте также имеются чапаны (национальное пальто). Сырье, некоторые комплектующие ее продукта, и некоторые готовые изделия в качестве ассортимента Дильбар покупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Партнерам по бизнесу является ее сын. 
Хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев для увеличения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Dilbar S. was born in 1949. She is a widow with 8 children. Despite her age, 58 years, Dilbar makes and sells traditional Tajik clothing. Her business began with sale of traditional dresses. She sews the dresses at home and sells them at the Khayr market in the city of Vahdat. The clothing she makes also includes the chapan (traditional coat). She buys raw materials, product accessories, and a few prepared products for her assortment of goods at the Korvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. Her son is her business partner.

She would like to take out a 10 month, 3500 somoni ($1025) loan to increase her operating capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials: cotton and fabric

loans.name: Kenjabi

texts.ru:
Кенджаби, 1979 года рождения, она разведена и у нее 3 детей. У нее собственный бизнес, которую начала 5 лет назад. Кенджаби начала свой бизнес с проката видеокассет и услуг перезаписывания. Сейчас она торгует видеокассетами, VCD и DVD дисками в торговом магазине города Вахдат. У нее в продаже диски самых востребованных фильмов и песен. Частые клиенты Кенджаби довольны ассортиментом ее товаров. За свою деятельность она создала одно рабочее место.  Ей помагает по работе ее родственник который получает бонусы от продажи дисков. Свой товар она привозит с торгового центра «Садбарг». Кроме продажи дисков Кенджаби предоставляет услуги ксерокопирования.
 С помощью программы КИВА хочет получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для увеличения своего товарооборота.
texts.en:
Kenjabi, born in 1979, is divorced and has 3 children. She has her own business, which she began 5 years ago. She started it with sales of video cassettes and re-recording services. Now she sells video cassettes, video CDs, and DVDs in a store in Vahdat. Her products include the films and songs most in demand. Kenjabi's regular customers are happy with the range of goods she carries. She has one employee in addition to herself. A relative helps her and receives a bonus for disk sales. She brings the goods in from the Sadvarg Shopping Center. Beside disk sales, Kenjabi also provides xeroxing services.

With the help of KIVA, Kenjabi would like to receive a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) in order to increase her sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of music and video disks

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan baji lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and shoes. Her husband's name is A. M. and he runs a grocery shop. Hamidan baji is the mother of eight children: three boys and five daughters. Her eldest son is a storekeeper in Dubai. The next elder is a salesman and sells eatable things (nimko, chips). The others are enrolled in a school in her neighborhood.

Hamidan baji is a housewife and prefers to do domestic work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). She bought groceries for re-sale with that loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop. Hamidan baji has a dream to build her own house and give her children a better future.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Tano's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Tano is 35 years old, married with five children aged between two and 10. She has been a fish seller since 2005. She works 14-hour days and earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Tano hopes for a loan to buy more fish and other items for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, whose businesses include running a kiosk and selling fish, charcoal and coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more fish and other items for her business.

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru:
Джалолов Насруло родился 20 сентября 1955 года, женат и у них 5 детей. Он является мастером по ремонту радио-телеаппаратуры. Свою трудовую деятельность начал в 1980 году в качестве ученика. Постепенно набирая опыт в этой деятельности, Насруло стал самостоятельно принимать заказы и ремонтировать радиоприемники.  Теперь его знают во всей округе как мастера своего дела. Любой клиент, который приходит к нему с просьбой о починке аппаратуры, уходит с улыбкой на лице. Для оказания своих услуг Насруло ездит в город Душанбе, где в фирме ООО «Голубой экран» закупает запчасти и комплектующие к аудио и видеоаппаратуре. 
Насруло мечтает расширить свой бизнес, построить собственный цех и воспитывать учеников. Узнав о программе Кива решил участвовать в ней и получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для воплощения в реальность своей мечты.
texts.en:
Nasrullo J. was born on September 20, 1955, is married, and has 5 children. He is a specialist in radio and television equipment repair. He began working in 1980 as an apprentice. As he gradually amassed experience in this area, Nasrullo began to independently accept contracts and to repair radio receiver sets. Today he is known across the district as a master of his trade. Any client who comes to him with equipment to be fixed leaves with a smile on his face. To provide his services Nasrullo travels to the city Dushanbe to buy spare parts and accessories for audio and video equipment from the company Goluboy Ekran, LLC.

Nasrullo dreams of expending his buisness, building a private shop and mentoring apprentices. When he found out about Kiva he decided to take part and take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) to bring his dreams into reality.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan.  She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters.  One daughter and one son are in kindergarten.  Her husband has a dairy business and has been in this profession for the last 15 years.  

Suraiya baji is a housewife and takes care of her cattle.  Suraiya baji is a very emotional lady and has built a very emotional relationship with her cattle.  She gets up early in the morning and gives food to the cattle and takes them away for walks.  Her husband gets milk from the cattle (goat, buffalo) and sells it to the milkman. 

Suraiya baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  She bought a buffalo with her first loan.  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Faidha's Hatuna Matata Group

texts.en:
Faidha is 22 years and married with 1 child, aged 3 years. She has been a juice and snacks seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6AM to 9PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Faidha now hopes for a loan to buy more juice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Tatma, who owns nursery school.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 40 years old, divorced, with a 12-year-old child. She has sold khanga (clothes) and coconuts since 2005. She works from 7am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $90.

Salama is seeking a loan to buy more khanga and coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Sukhrob

texts.ru:
Хафизов Сухроб, 1983 года рождения, женат и у них один ребенок. После оканчания медицинского института работал как продавец в нескольких аптеках города. Наращивая свой опыт в этом бизнесе, Сухроб решил заняться собственным бизнесом и открыть собственный аптечный киоск. Он арендовал помещение в тарговом центре «Илхом» и вот уже 3 года является владельцем аптечного бизнеса в городе Вахдат. У него в продаже все наиболее используемые медикаменты, лечебные травы, косметические средства, зубные пасты, принадлежности по уходу за ребенком и т.д. Товар Сухроб закупает в фирме «Рахмат - 2004» города Душанбе.
С помощью программы КИВА хочет получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для покупки медикаментов и холодильника для хранения лекарственных препаратов.
texts.en:
Sukhrob K. was born in 1983 and is married with one child. Upon graduation from medical school, he worked as a pharmacist in several pharmacies of his city. Having gained experience, Sukhrob decided to start his own business and opened his own pharmacy. He rented space at Ilhom mall and for the past three years has owned and operated a pharmacy business in Vakhdat town. Sukhrob sells all major medications, herbs, personal and baby care products, toothpastes, etc. He buys the product from the Rahmat-2004 company in Dushanbe. With Kiva's help Sukhrob would like to obtain a loan of 4100 somoni (1200 USD) in order to purchase more medications and a refrigerator for storing them.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase medications and a refrigerator

loans.name: Sokry's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokry H. is a leader of a small loan group. She is 36 years old and a beef seller in her local market. Sokry has been selling since 2005, earning approximately $5 per day. She purchases beef from a butcher and resells it at the market. Her husband works for a non-governmental organization and his income helps to support loan repayments. The couple have three young children, all of whom are in school.

Due to growing customer demand, she wants to expand her business to increase her family's income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to expand her beef-selling business by purchasing more beef to sell. Her group members include: (i) Mrs. Sophy S.: Mrs. Sophy requests a loan to purchase hairdressing materials to use for her hairdressing business. The remainder will be used to purchase more beef for her beef-roasting business.

(ii) Mrs. Prem K.: Mrs. Prem requests a loan to purchase ingredients for roasted cake and porridge, to help boost her sales.

loans.use: To purchase beef to sell

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Умеджон, 1978 года рождения, женат и у него 2 детей. Он начал свой бизнес 2 года назад с продажи видеокассет и услуг перезаписывания. Сейчас он торгует видеокассетами, VCD и DVD дисками в магазине «Детский мир» города Вахдат. У него в продаже диски с записями самых востребованных исполнителей национальных песен, а также художественные и мультипликационные фильмы. Частые клиенты Умеджона довольны ассортиментом его товаров. Свой товар он привозит с торгового центра «Садбарг». С каждым днем возрастает спрос на аудио и видеопродукцию. Умеджон часто ездит за товаром и в дальнейшем хочет нанять работника, арендовать большое помещение, чтоб расширить свой бизнес.
 С помощью программы КИВА хочет получить займ на сумму 4100 сомони для увеличения своего товарооборота.
texts.en:
Umedjon was born in 1978 and is married with 2 children. He started his business two years ago by selling and recording videotapes, and today he sells videotapes, VCDs and DVDs at Kids’ World shopping center in Vakhdat. Sukhrob sells records of the most popular national performers as well as feature films and cartoons, and his customers are satisfied with the assortment offered. He brings goods from Sadbarg shopping center. The demand on audio and video records is growing. Umedjon often travels to purchase goods and in the future he would like to hire an employee, rent larger space and expand his business. With Kiva’s help Sukhrob would like to obtain a loan of 4100 somoni (1200 USD) in order to increase his cash-flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase VCDs and DVDs

loans.name: Bahtior

texts.ru:
Бахтиёру 20 лет, он холост и помогает своим родителям личным вкладом в семейно-бытовые расходы. У Бахтиёра есть свой бизнес. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал с продажи муки. Данный момент он торгует на Центральном рынке города Вахдат посудами: тарелки, чайники, сервисные наборы. Его партнерам по бизнесу является брат, который помогает и иногда заменяет его на месте деятельности. Продаваемые им товары являются необходимыми в повседневной жизни. У него много клиентов и он часто ездит за товаром в оптовый рынок «Корвон».       
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа сервисных наборов хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Bahtior is 20 years old and single. He helps his parents to provide for the family by running a business. He started off by selling flour but now he sells kitchenware, dinnerware and serveware, such as plates, kettles, etc., at Vakhdat’s central market. The goods that Bahtior sells are necessary in daily life. Bahtior’s business partner is his brother, who helps him and substitutes him in his shop. Bahtior has many customers and he often travels to Korvon wholesale market to purchase goods. Bahtior would like to obtain a loan of 4100 somoni (1200 USD) for buying more serveware and increasing cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy serveware

loans.name: Mashallah

texts.en: Mashallah D. is 50 years old and sells different supplies in a small village of the Satli region. He started his business in 2000. He is married and has 2 sons. Mashallah also works as a teacher in a local school, but his salary is too small to cover even basic family needs. His store is the main financial source for his family. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase more supplies for his store. For this purpose he applied for 1000 USD.

loans.use: To expand his business and purchase more supplies for his store

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Узбекова Малика проживает в городе  Яван . Занимается торговлей . Продает одежду и парфюмерию.Арендует отдел в магазине. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже семь лет. Живет  со своими двумя дочками. Она разведена и поэтому сама является кормильцем семьи. Для развития бизнеса планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Использует кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет привлечь дополнительный доход , который необходим для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Malika U. lives in the city of Yavan. She is in the sales business. She sells clothing and toiletries from the section she rents in a store. She has been in this type of business for seven years. Malika lives with her two daughters. She is divorced, so she is the sole provider for the family. To further develop her business, she plans to take out a 12-month loan. She will use the loan to increase sales turnover. This will help bring in additional income, a necessity for her family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Hazat Allah

texts.en:
Hazat Allah is married. He lives with 11 members of his family, including his 3 married sons. He works in agriculture. He has been involved in this business for more than 20 years. During the war in Kabul, he was in Peshauer, Pakistan. All his crops that he had worked hard on were destroyed by rockets. When he came back 3 years ago, he went back to working on his land. Even now, he can't prepare all his land for cultivation because of some economic problems.

Now he wants to take an individual loan from AFSG in Kabul to have money to prepare his land for cultivation and complete his stock for agriculture. He intends to work hard and take good benefit in the future to help his family.

He is happy with this process of small loans in Kabul that help people, especially those who lost everything. It is a good help for any worker in Afghanistan. He would like to thank all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To ready his land for cultivation and complete his stock

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is a 36-year-old man who has been tending a food store in a small village in the Saatli region since 1997. He is married and has 2 daughters. He has applied for 1200 USD to purchase more goods and expand his grocery business.

loans.use: Going to purchase more goods and expand his grocery business

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед 1976 года рождения, женат, у него 3 детей. Занимается продажей тканей на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат. Предпринимательскую деятельность начал в 1998 году с продажи тканей на местном рынке «Гулистон». Потом к бизнесу присоединился его отец и теперь это семейный бизнес. В 2005 году на вырученную сумму построил небольшой магазин. Товары для продажи привозит с рынков «Корвон» и «Саховат» города Душанбе. 
Ассортимент продаваемых им товаров пополнился разновидностями халатов. В разгар сезона продажи тканей и материалов хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров: материалы и ткани.
texts.en:
Jamshed was born in 1976. He is married and has three children. He sells fabrics at the “Khair” market in Vakhdat city. He went into business in 1998 selling fabrics at the local market “Guliston.” His father joined the business and now it is a family business. In 2005, he built a small store where he sells products that he buys from the “Korvon” and “Sakhovat” markets in Dushanbe city. He wants to increase his range of products with different robes and fabrics. During the height of the season for the sale of textiles and fabrics, he wishes to participate in Kiva’s program and to take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni to purchase seasonal products: fabrics and textiles.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: Bahrinisso

texts.ru: Шарипова Бахриниссо проживает в городе Яван. Работает на рынке. Имеет свой магазин , где торгует детской одеждой. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Заниялась делом после смерти мужа. Сейчас она живет  одна со своими тремя детьми. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент и привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahrinisso S. lives in the city of Yavan. She works in the market, where she sells children's clothing in her own shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, starting after the death of her husband. Now she lives alone with her three children. She wants to increase sales turnover by taking out a loan. This will help her increase her inventory and attract new customers. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer A. is 39 years old and a shepherd. He has been running his business since 2000 in his home region, Imishli. He is married and has 2 daughters. His main activity is sheep breeding for meat production, and concurrently he is a butcher. Mutton is very popular all around Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday cuisine. As his business is very popular, he needs to expand and thus applied for a loan of 1200 USD. With this loan he will purchase 20 sheep for an estimated cost of 60 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зиеев Зафар житель города Яван. Женат и имеет троих детей. 12 лет занимается торговлей ковров , одеял и других принадлежностей постельного белья.Зафар является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме жены и детей с ним живут его родители и братья с сестрами. Поэтому ему приходится очень много работать для того , чтобы обеспечить семью. По этой причине он решил получить кредит и использовать для приобретения автомобиля  и использовать его для перевозки товара. . Это поможет ему развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafar Z. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has three children. For the past 12 years he has been selling rugs, blankets, and other pieces of bed linen. Zafar is the sole provider for his family. In addition to his wife and children, his parents, brothers, and sisters also live with him. This means he must work a lot to support the family. Because of this he decided to take out a loan and use it to purchase a vehicle to use for transporting goods. This will help him develop the business. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Umarhuja

texts.ru: Зиеев Умархуджа проживает в городе Яван.Возраст 31 год, женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Торгует коврами. Хочет получить кредит и добавить в оборотную сумму. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот. Товар он привозит из города Душанбе. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Umarhuja Z. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He works in sales. He has a stall in the central market, where he sells rugs. He wants to take out a loan to add to his circulating capital. This will help increase sales turnover. His goods are brought in from the city Dushanbe. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rugs

loans.name: Aybeniz

texts.en: Aybeniz Q. is 50 years old and has run her store in her home town, Imishli, since 1997. She is married and has 2 children. This shop is her only source of income. She applied for 1200 USD to expand her business. This is Aybeniz’s second loan from AqroInvest (Kiva’s Field Partner). She used the first loan to purchase goods, and she repaid it successfully.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат родилась в 1965 году. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Она вот уже 11 лет работает в  ОАО "Точиктелеком" города Вахдат диспетчером. Работая с утра до вечера Сабохат зарабатывает маленькую сумму, которую тратит на питание семьи. Ее муж работает по найму и тоже зарабатывает небольшую сумму. Она хочет сделать в доме небольшой ремонт, покрасить стены, починить крышу, подготовится к предстоящей зиме. Узнав о том, что можно получить займ для ремонта дома и постепенно погашать его в течении 10 месяцев Сабохат решила участвовать в программе Кива. Она хочет получить сумму 1500 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabohat was born in 1965. She is married and has three children. For 11 years, she has worked as an operator for the “Tojiktelecom” company in Vakhdat city. She works from morning to night for a small salary which she uses to feed her family. Her husband takes on odd-jobs also bringing home a small salary. She would like to do small repairs on her home, to paint the walls and fix the roof in preparation for the upcoming winter. Knowing that she could get a loan to repair her home and gradually pay it back over 10 months, Sabohat decided to participate in Kiva's loan program. She would like to take a loan of 1500 somoni for a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Зиеев Шухрат проживает в городе Яван. Торгует на рынке «Мехргон» одеялами , полотенцами и другими видами постельного белья. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже восемь лет. Товар закупает в городе Душанбе. Имеет свою машину , которую использует в бизнесе. Сейчас необходимо расширить торговую точку , путем аренды. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для оплаты аренды. Это поможет  ему развивать свой бизнес . Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shuhrat Z. lives in the city of Yavan. He sells blankets, towels, and various types of bed sheets. This has been his line of business for eight years. He buys the goods in the city of Dushanbe. He has his own car, which he uses in the buisness. Now he needs to expand his market stall by renting. To do this he decided to take out a loan to pay the rent. This will help him to further develop the business. He will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent payment

loans.name: Saday

texts.en:
Saday N. is 63-year-old man who has been breeding calves in Imishli region since 1980. He is married and has 1 son. He used to work as a doctor, but now he is retired and his main activity is calf breeding. He breeds calves for meat production.

Saday N. has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 USD to purchase 3 calves at an estimated cost of 300 USD each. With the rest of the loan money,he will purchase fodder to speed up the process of the calves growing. This is Saday's second loan. He spent his first loan from AqroInvest purchasing his first calf and he successfully completed that loan.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Кулматов Муродали житель города Яван. Возраст 37 лет из них 18 лет занимается животноводством. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Семья не очень большая , но прокормить ее ему тяжело. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит и использовать деньги для покупки бычка. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murodali K. is a resident of the city of Yavan. 37 years old, 18 of those years he has practiced animal husbandry. This business is his family's only source of income. He is married and has two children. The family is fairly small, but it is still hard for him to support them. Now he has decided to take out a loan and use the money to buy bull calves. He will repay the loan over 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Калтаев Файзали проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 32 года. Женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже 10 лет занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков для откормки  , а затем перепродает на рынке по более выгодной цене. В данное время наступает сезон свадеб и его бизнес становится прибыльным. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит сроком на восемь месяцев. И использовать деньги хочет для покупки бычка. Файзали , кроме детей и жены живет с родителями , семья орчень большая  и он один обеспечивает свою семью.
texts.en:
Faizali K. lives in Yavan. He is 32 years old, is married and has 2 children. He also lives with his parents. The family is large and he is the sole provider.

Faizali has been in the livestock business for 10 years. He purchases calves to fatten and then resells them at the market for a profit. The wedding season is starting now and his business becomes profitable. For this reason he would like to take out an 8 month loan and to use the loan to purchase a calf.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Hosamoh

texts.ru:
Хосамох 1971 года рождения. Она разведена и у нее 1 сын, который учится в 8 классе. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 1998 году с продажи небольшого количества кондитерских изделий в небольшом арендуемом магазине. Сейчас Хосамох торгует конфетами, кондитерскими изделиями и сухофруктами в большом ассортименте на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте разновидность конфет производства России и Турции, пряники, сушенные абрикосы, изюм, грецкие орехи, миндаль, фисташки и т.д. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда. В дальнейшем хочет выкупить магазин.
Услышав о программе Кива решила участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для расширения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Hosamoh was born in 1971. She is divorced and has a son who is in the eighth grade. She started her business in 1998 by selling a small quantity of confectionary products in a small store that she rented. Now Hosamoh trades in a large assortment of candies, confectionary products, and dried fruits at the “Sakhobat” market in Dushanbe city. Her stock includes different candies from Russia and Turkey, gingerbread, dried apricots, raisins, walnuts, almonds, and pistachios, etc.. She buys goods from wholesalers such as “Safar-Center” in Dushanbe city as well as wholesale dealers from Khujand city. In the future, she wishes to buy a store. Having heard about Kiva’s lending programs, she decided to participate and take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni to expand her assortment of products.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried fruits

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte M. is 38 years old. She is married with five children. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She is a merchant who has been selling used shoes and plastic utensils such as plates, buckets, bowls, etc. for the past six years.

Charlotte is requesting a loan to augment her working capital so as to buy more stock of used shoes and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Charlotte is a member of a community group called St. Pauls Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes and plasticware

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 30 years old. She is a wife and mother of 4 children who are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for 6 years. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is also processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to low working capital to buy a machine for processing. Philomena wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine to improve production. She believes the loan would allow her to raise enough income to finance her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children. Through this business, she supports her three kids in school. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot peppers and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch and supper.
