Abena wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to cook the food she sells

loans.name: Salaina

texts.en: Salaina is a 25-year-old trader who is hardworking and enterprising. She is single and loves trading. She has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in her neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to rent a storeroom. Salaina is a member of the group called St. Paul's Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize, plantains, groundnuts, gari, and beans

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama M. is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to three kids. She sells porridge and lingerie in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and eaten with sugar, milk, and bread.

With a large customer base, she wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her lingerie sales. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school. She is a member of a group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk and lingerie

loans.name: Du Anka

texts.en:
Du Anka is married and living in the town Derventa, near the town Gračanica. She has one child. Her husband works as a builder at the field and he can earn about 700 KM monthly. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 600 KM.

In her current business, she works in a shoe factory and she earns about 350 KM monthly. She plans to use this loan to buy thread for making decorations on shoes. She brings some shoes home after work and she gets additional money for decorating them. She needs this loan because her current income cannot support her and her family. Her future goal is to earn more money for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy thread for shoe decoration.

loans.name: Milijana

texts.en:
Milijana is a young, unmarried woman. She lives in the town of Derventa. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 600 KM ($475). She works in a boutique, and she typically earns approximately 350 KM per month.

With the loan proceeds, she plans to buy new clothes and to sell such clothes from home. In fact, she has experience in the sales industry, so she thinks that she can earn more money by operating this other business after work. She states that she needs this loan because her current income is insufficient to support her and her family members.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja is a young woman from the town of Derventa. She is not married, and she works as an accountant with an accounting firm, where her monthly salary is approximately 500 KM.

She is now seeking this loan in the amount of 600 KM ($475) to buy materials for her work. Specifically, Sanja often brings work home with her, so she needs a new printer and some paper supplies. As such, she feels that the loan would enable her to work more productively from home and to thereby do a better job for her firm.

loans.use: To purchase a new printer and paper.

loans.name: Nevenka

texts.en:
Nevenka is a divorced woman who lives in the town of Derventa. She works in a shoe factory, and her monthly salary is 350 KM. This is the first loan she has sought via WWI, and she is seeking a loan in the amount of 600 KM ($475).

With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy materials so that she can decorate shoes. More specifically, after work at the shoe factory, she brings some shoes home in order to decorate such shoes; subsequently, and once she has decorated the shoes, she brings them back to the factory, where she receives additional compensation for her work on the shoes.

loans.use: To buy more materials (e.g., thread) in order to decorate shoes.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa was born in 1979 and she lives with her husband and one child in the town Banovići. She works as a saleswoman in a shop in the town. She earns 300 KM monthly. Her husband works as a musician and does beekeeping. He can earn about 800 KM monthly.

This is her second loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 600 KM. Edisa will use it to buy more bees because she wants to expand the business. She knows that she can earn more money for her family by selling honey because honey has a good price at the market.

loans.use: To buy bees.

loans.name: Suada

texts.en:
Suada is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Banovići. She is a widow, but she receives pension money from her husband in the amount of 500 KM per month. Moreover, she owns and operates a small shop in town where she sells various goods .

She is seeking this loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM ($475) to buy additional supplies for her shop in order to expand her inventory for the benefit of her customers. She notes that she needs greater income to support her and her son.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Slavica

texts.en:
Slavica is a woman from Lakta i. She is married, and her husband has a full-time job with a salary of 600 KM per month. Meanwhile, Slavica makes cookies at home, where she has all the machines and equipment she needs to engage in such work. In particular, she bakes cookies at home, packs them, and then distributes them to the shops in town.

This is her third loan through WWI, and she is hereby seeking a loan in the amount of 600 KM ($475). With the loan proceeds, Slavica will buy materials to bake her cookies and to package the finished product. Interestingly, she wants to expand her business by distributing her cookies to more shops in town and possibly to shops in other towns nearby.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials for her cookie business

loans.name: Zumra

texts.en:
Zumra is from the town of Kalesija. She lives with her husband, who is a pensioner. More specifically, he receives a pension in the amount of 340 KM per month. Moreover, he and Zumra work in the poultry industry.

They already have some chickens, but they are requesting a loan to buy more chickens. In turn, they plan on fattening the chickens they purchase and then selling them after some time. They state that they would like to proceed in this manner because they are often at home and need both a job to fill their free time and more money to cover their expenses during the winter months.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is from a small place called Snagovo, near the town of Zvornik. She is a 43-year-old woman and she is a widow. She does agriculture, crop husbandry, and cattle breeding. She receives a pension in the amount of 400 KM and she has help from her son who works.

Mina needs this loan in the amount of 1000 KM because she wants to buy a few goats and sheep. Her wish is to improve the monthly income for her family by selling sheep and goats after fattening them and to help her daughter with school.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura was born in 1963, and she lives in the village of Snagovo, near the town Zvornik. She is a widow, and she works in agriculture and cattle breeding to make a living. This is not Nura’s first loan, and she is asking for 1000 KM to buy wheat and oat seeds for spring sowing. She also wants to purchase compost so that she may clean and prepare her land over the winter.

loans.use: To buy compost and seeds to prepare and plant her fields.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort N. is 32 years. She is married with three kids. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She has been trading in used clothes and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, etc. for the past five years.

She requests the loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock of used clothes and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Comfort is a member of a community group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of used clothes and plastics.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos decided to start his own home business in order to be able to raise his young children out of financial necessity and because his wife walked out on him and his three children—a two-month-old, a three-year-old, and a four-year-old. In view of the need to cover the food expenses and take care of his three children, he started the business two years ago. He was familiar with carpentry, so he dedicated himself 100% to this trade in order t help move his children forward and little by little make his business grow.

He needs a loan of $300 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a table saw, thus allowing him to fill his customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos decidió emprender un negocio en su casa para poder atender a sus menores hijos, por necesidad económica y por que su esposa lo abandono junto con sus 3 pequeños de 2 meses, 3 y 4 años. Ante la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de alimentación y darles el cuidado a sus tres hijos, comenzó hace 2 años, el sabia el oficio de carpintero y se dedico al 100% a esto para poder sacar adelante a sus pequeños y poco a poco ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una cortadora y así poder cumplir con sus clientes con los pedidos de trabajo en carpintería.

loans.use: Purchase table saw

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino started his own business out of financial necessity because he was not able to find a job at his age, and his wife became seriously ill, so he needed to be able to feed his children. He started selling seafood 6 years ago, when he found himself in need to start his own business due to lack of income.

He needs a loan of $500 USD, which he will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a refrigerator so that the food that he prepares will stay fresh and keep from spoiling.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Saturnino inició el negocio por necesidad económica; ya que por su edad no encontraba trabajo y su esposa se enfermo de gravedad y tenia que darle de comer a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 6 años con la venta de mariscos cuando se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio por falta de dinero.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un refrigerador y que los alimentos que prepara se mantengan en buen estado y no se le echen a perder

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 39-year-old businessman. He is married with 4 kids and is very dedicated to his work. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc in the local market of Obuasi. Stephen supports his family with proceeds from his business. He wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc to expand his business. Stephen hopes to save more toward his kids' education. He belongs to the community group called "Nyame na aye Trust Group." The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To buy more rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc

loans.name: Hyacinthe J Marie

texts.fr: Nous habitons l’écovillage d’Elinkine qui est un port de pêche situé en basse Casamance. Notre écovillage a la particularité de voir débarquer tous les jours des tonnes de poissons, qui sont le fruit de travail de la pêche artisanale qui se pratique dans la zone. C’est ainsi que nous voyons des gens venir d’ailleurs pour faire une activité de revente de poissons frais sous nos yeux. Pour raison de manque de moyens financiers, nous ne pouvons pas pratiquer ces activités très lucratives et créatrices d’emploi pour des jeunes qui pourraient en profiter au lieu de s’embarquer dans des pirogues vers des destinations qui leurs sont inconnues. Ainsi donc, nous sommes venus solliciter un prêt auprès de kiva, afin de faire face à la situation que les jeunes d’Elinkine sont entrain d’endurer, pour acheter et revendre des poissons frais dans les grandes villes du Sénégal et des pays voisins comme le Mali et la Guinée Conakry. Le financement servira à acheter le poisson, le conserver et le transporter vers les lieux de vente.
texts.en:
We live in the ecovillage of Elinkine, a fishing harbor located in lower Casamance. Our ecovillage has the distinctiveness of allowing us to witness the daily delivery of tons of fish, the result of the hard work done by the artisanal fishermen who work in the area. Because of this particularity, we watch as strangers from other regions come and sell the fresh fish right in front of us. Due to the lack of financial means, we are unable to take advantage of this lucrative business. We are also unable to create jobs for our youth who could be taking advantage of this opportunity. Instead, they sail out in wooden pirogue boats to destinations unfamiliar to them. We are requesting a loan from Kiva in order to deal with this situation that the youth of Elinkine are facing, to purchase and resell fresh fish in the large cities of Senegal and neighboring countries like Mali and Guinea Conakry. This loan will allow us to purchase, conserve and transport fish to the sale outlets.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase and resale of fresh fish in large cities

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is a 38-year-old woman. She is married with six kids. Currently two of them have completed high school. To support her family, Mary bakes and sells bread to the working community and at bus stops in Obuasi, a busy mining town in Ghana. She wants to use this loan to buy more flour, margarine, sugar, vegetable oil, etc. to avoid price hikes. She believes the loan will enable her to save more for the kids' education.

Mary is a member of the trust group called "Adekyensroma Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, sugar, vegetable oil etc. to use to bake bread

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids. Currently, one of the kids is in school and the others have completed school.

Augustina enjoys selling and has much experience in customer care. She has been selling yams for six years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams from the farmers. This saves her from having to use middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at a higher price.

She wants to use the loan to buy yams in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her in school. Augustina is a member of a community group called 'God's Love Trust Group'. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es:
Doña Luisa is 50 years old. She is married and lives in the Máximo Jerez colony. Her husband works in a private enterprise as the sales advisor. They have 3 children of school age which they need to support in their studies so that they become professionals and thus are able to improve their standard of living. For 18 years, in the neighborhood where they live, Luisa has sold foods at night (a fritanga or “grill” style restaurant). This merchant activity began by selling chicken by pound on foot, then in a small truck. Subsequently she located the business in her house to carry out sales, and it was there where she decided to put the fritanga in order to generate more income for the maintenance of her family.

The loan will be used to purchase beef, porki and chicken for investment in her business, and thus to give her more to offer her clients to give them better service.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Luisa tiene 50 años de edad, habita en la colonia Máximo Jerez, es casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada como asesor de ventas, tienen 3 hijos de edad quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, y a los cuales necesitan apoyar en sus estudios para que éstos lleguen a ser profesionales y así poder mejorar su nivel de vida. Desde hace 18 años en el barrio donde habitan Luisa tiene una venta de comidas por las noches (fritanga). La actividad de comerciante la empezó vendiendo pollo por libra de manera ambulante, esto lo hacia en una camioneta, posteriormente se ubicó en su casa de habitación para realizar las ventas, y fue ahí donde decidió poner la fritanga para así generar más ingresos para la manutención de su familia.

El préstamo será usado para la compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo para inversión de su negocio, y así darle atender la oferta de sus clientes y darles un mejor servicio

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken for her restaurant.

loans.name: Berlyn Beatriz

texts.es:
Berlyn is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics on foot and also in her home. She is married. Her husband drives a taxi. The car is belongs to them both. They both work very hard to support their son of 14 years. For 6 years Berlyn has been dedicated to the sale of cosmetics to her neighbors in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of the city of Managua. She started this business with her own capital and the help of her husband, but had to request loans from AFODENIC because her initial investment was very small and she needed more inventory. Like the previous loans, this loan will be used to invest in her business, buying perfumes of the AVON brand to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Berlyn se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y también lo hace en su casa de habitación, es casada, su esposo es taxi, el vehículo es propiedad de la pareja. Ambos se esfuerzan mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo de 14 años. Desde hace 6 años Berlyn se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a sus vecinos del Barrio Villa Reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, empezó este negocio con capital propio y ayuda de su esposo, tuvo que requerir de créditos a AFODENIC, ya que su inversión inicial era muy poco y ella necesitaba tener más inventario, al igual que los anteriores este crédito será usado en inversión para su negocio, comprará perfumes de la marca AVON para ofertarlos a sus clientes

loans.use: To buy AVON perfums to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Martha Fabiola

texts.es:
Martha Fabiola is 31 years of age and lives in the Anexo Villa Libertad neighborhood of Managua. She is a single mother of twin 8-year-old girls. Martha Fabiola works for a private company in Managua, but she also sells perfume and clothing during her free time for a living in order to have enough income to support her girls because she is their only source of income and this is more difficult for her. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fragrances for men and women because she currently does not have these products which her customers are requesting. As a mother, her dream is to be able to offer her daughters a better quality of life, and in order to do this, she must work arduously at both jobs everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Fabiola tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Libertad de la ciudad de Managua, es soltera y madre de dos niñas gemelas de 8 años de edad. Martha Fabiola trabaja para una empresa privada de Managua, pero también en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de perfumes y ropa, para así poder tener más ingresos para poder mantener a sus niñas, ya que ella es la única fuente de ingresos y es más difícil para ella. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de perfumes de hombre y mujer, ya que actualmente no cuenta con estos productos y están siendo demandados por sus clientes. Como madre que es, su sueño es poder darles a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida, y para eso trabaja fuertemente todos los días, en sus dos ocupaciones.

loans.use: Purchase men’s and women’s fragrances

loans.name: San Bartolome De Tambo Real Group

texts.es:
The communal bank was formed on December 20, 2002, in the Tambo Real community located in the Zurite district of the province of Anta.  It has been in operation for five years and currently 24 members belong to the bank - 19 women and five men.  The economic activities of the community in which the members participate are cattle raising, processing milk into yogurt and cheese, small animal sales and [the sale of] agricultural products.  The communal bank is named after the community’s patron saint whose anniversary is August 24th, the date when the bank will celebrate it’s fifth anniversary.  The history of the bank is linked to the origin of the community.  Mutual support known as “Ayni” (“today for you, tomorrow for me”), solidarity and respect are the community’s inherent values, whose practice is part of its ancestral customs.  A product of these values is the communal bank that has a history of good credit.  Currently it’s in its fourth cycle.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El banco comunal fue creado el 20 D. diciembre del 2002, en la comunidad D. Tambo Real, del distrito D. 					
 Zurite D. la provincia D. Anta.					
Tiene  5 años D. funcionamiento, actualmente son 24 socias					
pertenecen al banco comunal esta conformado por 19 mujeres y 5 varones					
Las actividades economicas D. la comunidad a las que se dedican las socias son:					
La crianza D. vacunos y la transformacion D. la leche en Yogurt y Queso, el comercio 					
animales menores y productos agricolas.					
El banco comunal, lleva el nombre del patrono D. la comunidad, cuyo aniversario					
es el dia 24 D. agosto. Fecha en el cual el banco comunal festejara su 5º aniversario					
La historia del banco comunal se enmarca en los principios D. la comunidad, el					
apoyo mutuo, conocido como "Ayni" hoy dia por ti mañana por mi, la solidaridad y el 					
respeto, valores inherentes a la comunidad, cuya practica es ancestral. Producto D.					
estos valores es un banco comunal, con una historia D. credito calificada como					
buena. Actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo

loans.use: Activities that include agriculture, livestock raising, production of yogurt and cheese, and trade

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 62082

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. José M. lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is a 56-year-old married father of a 10-year-old son. His wife is a homemaker. Mr. M. works in the operational field of the National Police with 28 years of experience. The country’s financial situation does not allow its inhabitants to construct their homes at one time, which is why they need to take out small loans so that they can improve their homes little by little. With this loan that he is requesting, he plans to construct a wall in the backyard of his house in order to provide more safety for his family because his neighborhood is very dangerous, and his wife and son are on their own all day long.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. José habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don José trabaja en la Policía Nacional desempeñándose en el área operativa y tiene 28 años de experiencia. La situación económica del país no le permite a los habitantes poder construir sus viviendas de manera total, es por eso que ellos solicitan pequeños créditos para ir haciendo poco a poco mejoras a sus hogares. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda para lograr más seguridad para su familia, ya que el barrio donde él habita es bastante peligroso, y su esposa e hijo quedan solos todo el día.

loans.use: Build a protective wall in his backyard

loans.name: Leoncio De Maria

texts.es:
Mr. Leoncio is 46 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of Lomas Memorial Sandino, and he and his wife live with their two sons ( 9 and 10 years old).

Don Leoncio sells movies, cards and stickers and has twenty years of experience in sales. He began his business (with his own money) by selling cards at first. Like many Nicaraguans, Leoncio needed funding to improve his housing, because the money he earns is not sufficient.

This loan will be used to purchase building materials for the tiled floor of his house. He wishes to fix it to give it a more dignified appearance for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Leoncio tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino Es casado y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 10 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Leoncio vende películas, tarjetas y calcomanías y tiene veinte años de experiencia en las ventas, inició sólo con las ventas de tarjetas y esto lo hizo con dinero propio. Al igual que muchos nicaragüenses Leoncio necesita de financiamientos para mejora de vivienda, ya que el dinero que él gana es muy poco. El dinero será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción para embaldosar el piso de su vivienda, y así de acuerdo a sus necesidades darle una vivienda más digna a su familia.

loans.use: To fix / replace the tiled floor of his home. (Embaldosar el piso de la sala de su vivienda)

loans.name: Sandra Elena

texts.es:
Ms. Sandra lives in the neighborhood Hialeah and is 39 years old. She is unmarried and has two sons (ages 11 & 12). Their father helps financially with feeding the children, and Ms. Sandra works as a concierge since 5 years ago.

This loan she is requesting is to purchase a toilet and construction materials to make a bathroom so she and her children can be comfortable in their home.

Her plans are to be able to continue making improvements to their home for her children's sake and also to help them with educational costs.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Sandra habita en el barrio Hialeah y tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad, el papá le ayuda con la alimentación de sus hijos. Doña Sandra trabaja desempeñándose como conserje y tiene cinco años laborando. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de un inodoro y comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un servicio higiénico y así poder estar cómoda con sus hijos. Sus planes son poder seguir haciendo mejoras para en la vivienda para sus hijos y también ayudarles en su preparación educativa.

loans.use: For construction of a bathroom in her home. (Construcción de un servicio higiénico en su vivienda)

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina works in her shop daily selling consumer products. Her store's name is "The Faith Shop" and she has run it for more than 4 years. It is located in the Chixolis Village, in the municipality of Santiago Sacatepquez. The store originally belonged to her mother-in-law, but she couldn't sustain it, so Ms. Gabina was encouraged to take over the business.

She would like to invest this loan in the purchase of large quantities of sugar, noodles and soap. She has also been selling homemade tortillas, for about a year, and needs to purchase maize to replenish her supply and so she can increase her sales.

Gabina's goals are to: expand her store, offer more products, and dreams of having a larger place of her own where she can make her tortillas (as she now makes them in her home). She believes these goals will be achieved in a short time, which will in turn help support her two sons who are currently attending school.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Gabina ha trabajo en su tienda de productos de consumo diario llamada “Tienda La Fe” por mas de cuatro años, esta ubicada en la Aldea Chixolis del municipio de Santiago Sacatepquez. La tienda era de su suegra, pero Ella no contaba con las condiciones para mantener el negocio, fue entonces cuando doña Gabina se animo a quedarse ella con la tienda. Ahora Ella esta solicitando un préstamo, porque quiere invertir en comprar azúcar, jabón y fideos, en mayor cantidad, ella también tiene un negocio de elaboración de tortillas, este negocio lo inicio hace mas de un año. También va comprar maíz en mayor cantidad para aumentar así sus mentas. Las metas de Gabina son: Ampliar su tienda, tener mas productos, y sueña con tener un local mas grande y propio para la venta de tortilla, ya que ahora las hace en su casa. Ella ve sus metas logradas en poco tiempo, y así sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, las cuales están estudiando en la actualidad.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell in her store, and to buy maize for her tortilla business. (Para comprar mas productos para vender en su tienda, y comprar mas maiz para su tortilleria)

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Don Gilberto is a photographer, but he also runs a small shop out of his home where he sells candy, soft drinks and enchiladas near a school in Managua. He's always looking for alternatives to supplement his income so he can support his family. He is married and his wife helps with the administration of the store. They have 3 children (15, 12 and 3 years of age), for whom Gilberto works hard in order to leave them equipped with a good future.

He has been working now for 20 years and began by selling candy. As time went on he became involved and grew his business with the other activities.

The loan Gilberto is requesting will be used to build a wall in his house and thus ensure the welfare of both his family and his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Don Gilberto se dedica al oficio de fotógrafo, pero también tiene una pulpería en su vivienda, y vende golosinas, refrescos y enchiladas en un colegio de Managua; todo esto en busca de alternativas que le pudieran brindar los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Es casado y su esposa le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería. Tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años de edad, para los cuales Gilberto trabaja arduamente para en un futuro dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos. Tiene 20 años de haber empezado a ser comerciante y empezó vendiendo golosinas y con el paso del tiempo ha ido creciendo en estas tres actividades. El préstamo que Gilberto está solicitando es para construir un muro en su vivienda y así asegurar el bienestar tanto de su familia como de su negocio.

loans.use: For construction of a wall in his home .  (Construcción de un muro en su vivienda)

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Soraida is 36 years old, and is married. She and her husband have 3 children (a girl of 6, and two boys, 16 & 17), whom they support.. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

Her husband's business is to peddle wood from a large cart, and they now have 10 years experience with his business, but they began by selling fruit alone. They expect to diversify their product offering in the future to meet the demands of the market.

She plans on using this loan to purchase building materials in order to add a room to their house. They hope to give each child their own room so they can be more comfortable and have more independence.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Soraida tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante en un carretón de leña. Tiene 3 hijos, una niña de 6 años y dos varones de 16 y 17 años, quienes a sus padres en las actividades que realizan. Tiene 10 años de tener su negocio y empezó vendiendo frutas solamente, espera en un futuro poder diversificar los productos que ofrece para obtener nuevos segmentos de mercado. El uso del crédito será para la compra de materiales de construcción y hacer un anexo a una habitación, ya que sus planes son poder dar a cada hijo una habitación para que estos puedan estar más cómodos y tener más independencia

loans.use: To purchase construction materials so she can add a room onto her house. (Hacer un anexo a una habitación de su vivienda)

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jose T. is a taxi driver who is 42 years old. He lives in the Tres Ochenta neighborhood of Managua. He is married and his wife is also in business and she sells clothing and cosmetics. They have four children (ages 17, 13, 9 and 4). Jose has been a taxi driver for 10 years now and he began this work when jobs were hard to come by during a rough period in his country. He hopes in the near future to change his taxi for a newer one.

This loan will be used to build a porch onto his home in order to add more security for his family, since his neighborhood has recently become more dangerous and he spends the greater part of each day away from home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

José T. un taxista de 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Tres Ochenta de Managua, es casado, su esposa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Tienen 4 hijos de 17, 13, 9 y 4 años de edad. Desde hace 10 años José T. ejerce la profesión de Taxista, y empezó este negocio debido a la falta de empleo que existía en aquellos tiempos en el país, sus planes son poder cambiar en un futuro corto su unidad de taxi por una más nueva. El préstamo lo usará para construir un porche en su vivienda y así darle más seguridad a su familia, ya que el barrio se ha vuelto peligroso y él pasa la mayor parte del día fuera de su hogar.

loans.use: To add a porch onto his home for added security. (Construcción del porche para su vivienda)

loans.name: Kotognogontala (Mutual Compromise) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont toutes  mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de  43 ans, 5 enfants et  vivant en générale dans les foyers polygames  avec les beaux parents, les frères,  les coépouses et les enfants au  quartier Ouayerma II de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région économique de la république du Mali 
Elles exercent généralement le commerce de condiments, de produits  alimentaires,d’habits et d’articles divers.
Afin se satisfaire le demande de la clientèle de plu en plus croissantes elles décidèrent ensemble  de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso qui accepta de leurs octroyer 4 prêts de groupe, tous remboursés sans difficulté. 
Elles comptent achèter, 50kg de tissus en coupons pour confectionner des draps, 10 paniers de condiments, 100 alvéoles d’oeufs, et 100 complets pour habits  enfants, sur place à Sikasso et selon les opportinutés à Bamako capitale de république du Mali) et en République du  Burkina faso.
Les produits sont vendus au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso sur de étales sous des hangars,à la maison ou de façon ambulante(en gros et en détail) la plupart au comptant. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA qui servira à payer les intêrets du prêt, subvenir aux beoins de la famille, et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Kotognogontala are all married. Their average age is 43 years. They have five children on average and generally live in polygamous households with their parents-in-law, siblings, co-spouses, and children in the Ouayerma II district in the city of Sikasso (the third most economic region in the Republic of Mali). They generally have businesses that specialize in condiments, general food products, outfits and various other items. In order to satisfy the demand of the clientele, which is constantly growing, they decided together to work with the microfinance institution called Soro Yiriwaso, which has allowed them to already take out four group loans, all paid back successfully. They plan to purchase 50 kilograms of fabrics, which they will use to make curtains, 10 baskets of condiments, 100 egg crates, and 100 full outfits in Sikasso and possibly in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and the Republic of Burkina Faso. Their products are sold at the market in the city of Sikasso, spread out under sheds, in their households, or in the street. They sell both wholesale and retail and mostly in cash. They hope to earn a 2,500 FCFA monthly profit, which will go towards the interest on the loan, help with the needs of their families, and the rest will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condiments, eggs, fabrics and children’s outfits

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica B. is unmarried and owns a small grocery store. Angélica lives with her partner who helps her with her business. They have four children, all of whom are adults. Three are marries and one daughter is still single and studying at the university.

She runs her business in her home and also makes fast food such as empanadas, milanesas, omelets and sandwiches to increase her income. Selling fast food gives her some good extra income.

She starts working very early in the day, around 4am, so that she can go to the market to buy all that she needs for her business.

One of her hopes is to expand her business soon in terms of equipment and furnishings so that she can have her own store and offer her customers a more comfortable and pleasant atmosphere.

Angélica is taking out this loan to purchase various grocery store products such as yerba (an herb to make a hot caffeinated beverage), drinks and also food products such as meat, cheese, chicken, oil, flour and others.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Angélica B., es soltera, y es dueña de una pequeña despensa. Angélica vive en pareja, este la ayuda en el negocio, tienen cuatro hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, tres están casados y una hija aun sigue soltera y estudiando en la universidad.

El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio y se dedica también a la fabricación de comidas rápidas como empanadas, milanesas, tortillas y sándwich para así tener mayor ingreso. La venta de las comidas rápidas le genera un buen ingreso extra.

A muy tempranas horas del día inicia sus actividades, aproximadamente a las 04:00 de la mañana, con el fin de ir al mercado a comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para su propio futuro salón comercial y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes. La señora Angélica retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, bebidas y también insumos para comidas como carnes, quesos, pollo, aceites, harinas y otros

loans.use: Purchase various grocery store products such as Yerba, sugar, flour, dairy products, drinks and others.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela belongs to the Enterprising Women Community Bank and lives in San Martín, Peru. She makes a living selling and distributing beauty products and also takes products in bad shape and repackages them, all of which she does out of her home. She has contacts around the city and the surrounding towns with people to sell these products. She started this job because of the need to generate her own income to provide for her two daughters since she is a single mother. For this work she needs to have capital, mainly to invest in the gasoline for the delivery of her products, money she later recuperates when the products are sold. She is requesting the $275 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, for this purpose. She will also invest in labor for delivering the beauty products, as well as buying product wholesale. Thanks to her transparency, responsibility and punctuality the company continues to have confidence in her.

Carmela is 54 years old and has two daughters her help her with her work. Her goal is for her youngest daughter to finish her professional degree and to have her own delivery force of two vans and two motorcycles.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmela pertenece al Banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (ESIKA) y a través de su Servis al Reparto de estos productos y recojo de los Productos en mal estado, funciona en su propia casa situada en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Nº 1270, cuenta con personal contratado para el reparto de las cajas alrededor de la ciudad y pueblos aledaños donde se encuentran las promotoras que venden dicho producto. Ella empezó en este trabajo ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijas ya que es madre soltera, para este trabajo necesita contar con un capital sobre todo para la gasolina de las motos por que primero invierte y luego recupera, y es para esto que ella usa el préstamo. El préstamo de S/.800.00 que lo cancelará en 6 meses, invertirá en mano de obra del negocio de reparto de productos de belleza, así como también en productos para luego venderlos, gracias a su transparencia, responsabilidad y puntualidad la empresa sigue confiando en ella. Tiene 54 años y 2 hijas mujeres que también le apoyan en esta actividad, su meta es que su hija menor termine su carrera profesional y tener su propia movilidad 2 combis y 2 moto taxis.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies and finance distribution / Compra de productos de belleza.  Pago a trabajadores (distribuidores),.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is a member of the Brigada Ramirez Community Bank and lives in San Martín Peru. She makes a living selling fruits (bananas, yuca, lemons, coconut, avocados, oranges and mandarins) and bread accompaniments (peanut butter, ground coffee). She sells her products at a post in the central city market. With the $350 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase bananas, avocados, oranges, mandarins, yuca, lemons, peanuts to make peanut butter, and coffee to grind and sell. She says that despite there isn't much affluence at her market, she has her clientele and she always sells her products. She attributes this to her wide product selection, which she also sells out of her home.

Cecilia is 38 years old, lives with her husband and has four children, all of whom are still dependent on her and support her in their free time. Her goal is to provide them a better future, which motivates her to work hard every day. Her dream is to run a grocery store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora CECILIA es socia del B.C “BRIGADA RAMIREZ”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas, se dedica a la venta de frutas, y productos de pan llevar como plátanos, yuca, limones, cocona, paltas, naranjas, mandarinas, también mantequilla de maní, café molido, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad donde tiene su puesto de venta. Con el préstamo ,de S/.1000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará frutas como: plátanos seda en racimos, paltas, naranjas en sacos, mandarinas, yuca, limones en sacos, maní para la preparación de mantequilla, café para moler y luego venderlo, ella dice que a pesar de que el mercado donde vende no tiene mucha afluencia, tiene su clientela y siempre vende, afirma que se debe a que tiene productos muy variados, también vende en su casa estos mismos productos. La señora Cecilia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, todos aun dependen de ella, quienes le apoyan en sus momentos libres. El deseo de brindarles un futuro mejor le da la fortaleza para salir a trabajar todos los días , sueña con poner un negocio de abarrotes en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase fruits at wholesale and buy bread accompaniments / Compra de frutas al por mayor.  Otros productos de pan llevar.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi is a member of the Lord of Miracles Communal Bank and lives in San Martín, Peru. She makes a living selling groceries, vegetables, passementerie, snacks and soft drinks. Her business is located in her home, and her clients are community members who visit her daily to buy products. She decided to start her business with the goal of managing her own income and raise her standard of living by helping with household expenses and her children's education. With the $525 loan, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase primary-need products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, condensed milk, oil, noodles, detergents, toilet paper and soft drinks, as well as purchase school supplies like notebooks, pens, erasers. She will also buy personal-care products such as nail polish, nail clippers and medicine, among other items. She wants to keep her business well stocked so she can meet her customers' demands.

Deysi is 30 years old and has three children whom she depends on for support in her home and in her business. Her goal is to grow her business, and she also wants to set up an Internet cafe on the side of her store because her home is big and she has enough space for it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Deysi es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros II”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, pasamanería, golosinas y bebidas gasificadas, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Los Rosales No114, sus clientes son los moradores de su barrio, quienes acuden diariamente a comprar. Decidió iniciarse en el negocio con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico así contribuir con los gastos de la casa sobre todo de sus hijos quienes están estudiando. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que será devuelto en 4 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en sacos, conservas, leche en cajas, aceite, fideos en paquetes, detergentes, papel higiénico, bebidas gasificadas, además comprará mentol cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores y artículos de pasamanería como esmaltes, corta uñas, medicinas, linternas, entre otros, quiere tener bien surtido su negocio para así llegar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 30 años y 3 hijos que todavía dependen de ella quienes le apoyan en la casa y en el negocio, su meta en el futuro es ampliar su negocio, también quiere poner un Internet al costado de su tienda en vista que su casa es grande y tiene un ambiente apropiado para ello.

loans.use: Purchase various grocery items / Compra de diversos artículos (abarrotes).

loans.name: Dilmelith

texts.es:
Dilmelith is a member of the Las Lemeñas Community Bank and lives in Lamas, Peru. She makes a living selling groceries at a post in the Lamas central market, generating daily income. The earnings help her and her husband support their two children's education, the motivation for starting her work. She also likes being in constant contact with friends and customers. With the $425, which she plans to repay with six months, she will purchase various grocery items such as: different brands of soap, toilet paper, canned fish, liters of oil, rice, sugar, bleach, detergents, and different brands and sizes of milk to satisfy her customers' demands.

Dilmelith is 37 years old and has two school-age children. She and her husband share responsibilities with the business. She has always been known as being a hard-working and responsible woman. Her goal for the future is to grow her business and sell and distribute products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Dilmelith es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, vive en la provincia y distrito de Lamas, departamento de San Martín se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su puesto de venta que ella tiene en el mercado central de la ciudad de Lamas, generar sus ingresos diaR. y las ganas de ayudar económicamente a su esposo para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos, le motivó a iniciarse en el negocio, además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes. Con el crédito de S/.1200.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como: cajas de jabón por cada marca (marsella, bolívar, jumbo, etc.) papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, arroz, azúcar, lejía, detergentes, leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, para ofertar a sus clientes. Tiene 37 años, tiene 02 hijos quienes están estudiando, junto con su esposo comparten la atención en el negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas, desea en el futuro ampliar su negocio, vender al por mayor, llegar a tener su distribuidora de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase various grocery items / Compra de diversos artículos (abarrotes).

loans.name: Eleunida

texts.es:
Eleunida is a member of the Lord of the Miracles Community Bank and lives in San Martín, Peru. She has a firewood business and depending on the season she also sells aguaje, a local fruit. She has been running her business for over a year out of her home. She considers keeping her customers satisfied to be of upmost importance and has work hard to do so ever since she started her business. With the $350 loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase more firewood to keep in storage and thus be able to satisfy the demands of her customers who live in her neighborhood and community.

Eleunida is 38 years old, married and has a daughter who helps her with the customer service side of her business and household chores. She feels very proud of what she has achieved because it is the fruit of much effort and constant dedication. Her dream is to have store where she sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Eleunida es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros II” , vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, tiene un negocio de venta de leña y de acuerdo a la temporada también vende aguaje, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa ubicado en el Jr: ayacucho No 285 - morales, ya lleva en este negocio mas de 1 año, considera que mantener al cliente satisfecho es lo primordial, para que se venga manteniendo durante tanto tiempo en este tipo de negocio. Con éste crédito de S/. 1000.00, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará mas leña para que tenga en almacén y poder satisfacer así las necesidades de sus clientes que viven en su barrio y la comunidad. Eleunida tiene 38 años, esta casada y tiene 1 hija mujer quien le apoya en la atención al publico en el negocio y las tareas domesticas de la casa, se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado ya que es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación constante, desea tener un local para que venda comida.

loans.use: Purchase firewood at wholesale / Compra de leña al por mayor.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has a 13-year-old daughter. She has an elementary school education and is a native of Santa Rosa in the Colloa province of Peru. A year ago she became a member of the Julia Jiménez Community Bank and received her first loan to buy more products for her general store, to which she has dedicated herself for 15 years. With this current $425 loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase more snacks, sugar, rice, noodles and fruit, and she plans to repay it within four months. Emilia has been working since she was 12 years old and she has always known how to confront problems and keep moving forward. She feels good about her business and the loans she receives. Her dream is enlarge her business and start selling school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Emilia es conviviente, madre de una hija de 13 años y ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es natural del Centro Poblado de Mazocruz, Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao. Integra hace un año el Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez, al obtener su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, incrementó su negocio comprando más productos para su tienda de abarrotes y venta de frutas, dedicándose a este negocio hace 15 años. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más golosinas, azúcar, arroz, fideos, frutas, crédito que pagará en cuatro cuotas. Doña Emilia indica con ese ánimo de seguridad que desde los 12 años de edad empezó a trabajar y siempre ha sabido enfrentar los problemas y salir adelante, ella se siente bien con el negocio que hace y con los créditos que recibe. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio incrementando con la venta de útiles escolares.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and other grocery products / Compra de golosinas y otros productos (abarrotes).

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana was born in the region of Chullunquiani - Mazocruz, Puno, Peru, and is 51 years of age. She has studied through the third grade and is married and the mother of 8 children.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Julia Jimenez - Mazocruz, and is in the business of buying and selling cattle, alpacas, and sheep at the fair in Huacullani on Tuesdays every week. She occasionally also sells beef and alpaca in the Mazocruz fair.

With this loan of S /. New 2000.00 Suns ($700.00 USD), which she plans to repay in 4 months, she wishes to purchase two bulls which she'll fatten up.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna, and be near her children who live in that city, where she can continue to work selling more cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Feliciana nació en la Parcialidad de Chullunquiani – Mazocruz, Puno, Tiene 51 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de primaria, es casada, madre de 8 hijos, vive en la Parcialidad de Chullunquiani. Socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, alpacas, ovinos en la feria de Huacullani los días martes de cada semana y vende de vez en cuando vende carne de alpaca en la feria de Mazocruz. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el que pagará en 4 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 02 toretes para engorde. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y estar cerca a sus hijos que viven en esa ciudad, a su vez seguir trabajando con su negocio y vender más cabezas de ganado vacuno.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls. (Compra de 2 toros)

loans.name: Fortunata Dominga

texts.es:
Fortunata Dominga is 26 years old and completed some schooling when she was younger. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in Tacna, Mazcruz.

She is a member of the communal bank Julia J. in Mazocruz, and with her first loan she was able to purchase meat which she sold at a profit. With some capital saved, they also began a blacksmith business which she and her husband now run together.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, they will buy supplies for their blacksmith business and continue to increase their income. Fortunata's dream is to have her own stable where she can raise animals, and earn enough money to provide a good education for her children.

Fortunata Dominga tiene 26 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaría, es conveniente, madre de tres hijos que aún dependen de ella, vive en la Av. Tacna s/n – Mazocruz. Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao – Puno, con su primer crédito compró 02 cabezas de de alpaca, desde el año 2,003 al 2,007 hacía negocio de venta de carne de alpaca, llama, el cual entregaba a los intermediarios de Tacna todos los miércoles y viernes, semanalmente vendía de 10 a 15 degollados, poco a poco aumentó su capital, ahora cuenta con un taller de metal mecánica confecciona puertas, ventanas metálicas conjuntamente con su esposo. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 08 planchas galvanizadas y 11 varillas de fierro para confección de puertas y ventanas. Su mayor sueño es tener su establo de ganado vacuno para engorde y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR HER BLACKSMITH BUSINESS, INCREASE  HER INCOME AND EARN ENOUGH TO PROVIDE A GOOD EDUCATION FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 24 years old and completed her primary school. She lives with her husband and 3 children in the center of Ccotos. She has been a member of the communal bank of Juchuy Nino in Capachica for 6 years. With her first loan she was able to purchase fish which she sold at a profit. With the second loan she was able to purchase a small boat.

She and her husband work together fishing, and Francisca sells the fish on Wednesdays in the market of Coata and on Sundays in the plaza of Capachica. Two years ago she also began to make handicrafts which she can also sell.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will invest in the fishing business including the maintenance of the boat, as well purchase supplies for the handicrafts she makes and sells.

Her dream is to have her own handicraft shop in the center of Ccotos, because tourism is growing in this area. She would be able to send her children to school in Puno, so that they are able to get a better education than she did.

Francisca tiene 24 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada madre de tres hijos, ella vive en el Centro Poblado de Ccotos sector Nº 4. Es socia del Banco Comunal Juchuy Niño – Capachica, hace siete años, con su primer préstamo compró malla de pescar 04 redes, con el siguiente crédito pudo comprar un bote haciendo realidad su meta, ahora ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en la pesca y ella vende pescado los miércoles en el mercado de Coata y los domingos en la plaza de Capachica, así fue aumentando su capital, hace dos años se dedica a la artesanía de tejido de chompas, chalinas y otros. Con este crédito de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, invertirá S/. 750.00 Nuevos Soles en malla de pescar, S/. 120.00 en el pintado del bote y para su artesanía comprará 08 conos de lana de alpaca y lana sintética para la combinación de colores. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia de artesanía, en el mismo Centro Poblado de Ccotos porque el turismo a aumentado en esa zona, así podrá educar a sus hijos en la ciudad de Puno para que sea mejor que ella. Doña Francisca confía en el Banco Comunal porque gracias a los préstamos pudo salir adelante y le da mucha suerte, manifestó muy alegre.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN THEIR FISHING BUSINESS, AS WELL AS PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR THE HANDICRAFTS SHE MAKES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 45 years old and completed some schooling when she was a young girl. A native of the community of Casana, Mazocruz, Francisca is married and has 7 children.

Francisca is a member of the communal bank of Julia Jimenez. For 17 years she has worked buying and selling the skins and the meat of sheep and alpaca. With the loan, she will be able to invest in her business and continue to grow her income.

Her goal is to be able to buy a small truck which will enable her to transport the meat to the markets more easily. And she would also like her children to be able to continue with their studies.

Francisca cumplió 45 años de edad, estudió segundo de primaria. Es casada y tiene siete hijos, ella nació y vive en la comunidad de Casana – Mazocruz . Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, hace 17 años se dedica a la compra y venta de cueros de alpaca, ovino, también vende carne de alpaca, a la semana entrega generalmente 10 degollados de ovino, alpaca a los intermediarios de Tacna hay veces cuando tiene pedido entrega de 25 a 30 degollados a la semana. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará 03 cabezas de alpaca y 04 cabezas de ovino, así seguirá creciendo su capital. Su meta es comprar una camioneta el que facilitará trasladar la carne a los mercados y que sus hijos estudien y salgan adelante.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for her business, grow her income and continue to take care of her family.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is 38 years old and was able to complete some schooling. She has 2 childen and lives with her husband in the community of Huarancamaya, Mazacruz, where she was born. She has been a member of the communal bank of Julia Jimenez in Mazocruz for 8 years. Before that, she used to sell sandals in the city of Cuzco. Three years ago she changed her work and began to sell vegetables.

With the loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will be able to purchase carrots, onions, tomatoes and other produce to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to afford a house. For now, she would like to continue to grow her business and her income so that her children can go to school without any problems.

Gregoria tiene 38 años de edad estudió primaria completa, conviviente, madre de dos hijos, nació en la comunidad de Huaracamaya – Mazocruz y vive en dicha comunidad. Es socia hace 08 años del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, anteriormente vendía zapatillas en la ciudad de Cuzco, hace tres años cambió de negocio actualmente vende verduras, los sábados en Mazocruz y los domingos en Ilave semanalmente. Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 sacos de zanahoria, 01 saco de cebolla ,02 cajas de tomate, 04 cabezas de de zapallo y otros. Su visión es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien sin problemas y seguir con su negocio incrementando más mercadería.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL IN THE MARKETS.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 86 years old and was never able to go to school. She has 7 children and is a native of the community of Calasaya in the district of Juli. She lives in the center of Mazocruz. A member of the communal bank of Julia Jimenez in Mazocruz, with her first loan Juana was able to buy alpaca meat to sell. She's been working for about 7 years now with the communal bank.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she would like to buy more meat for the business. She works together with her husband, who takes care of preparing the meat to sell. They have been working together for 20 years. She hopes that her children will continue with this business.

Juana tiene 86 años de edad sin estudios, casada, madre de siete hijos, ella es natural de la Comunidad de Calasaya, Distrito de Juli, vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz Nº 185 – Centro Poblado de Mazocruz. Integrante del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, con su primer préstamo compró 02 cabezas de alpaca para su posterior venta en carne, viene trabajando aproximadamente siete años con el Banco Comunal. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 08 cabezas de alpaca cada uno cuesta a S/. 120.00 Nuevos Soles, así va incrementando su capital, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo quien se encarga de carnear de los animales, entrega todos los miércoles y viernes de cada semana a los intermediarios de la Ciudad de Tacna, semanalmente entrega un promedio de 20 a 30 degollados, viene trabajando hace 20 años con este negocio. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sigan trabajando con el negocio que ella les enseñó (venta de carne).

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MEAT FOR THEIR BUTCHER SHOP BUSINESS, GROW THEIR INCOME AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THEMSELVES.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia was born in in a place called Ayupaica in Mazocruz. She is 41 years old and has 3 children who still depend on her. Julia is a member and funder of the Julia Jiménez communal bank. She has always been good at business, starting at 16 years old when she began selling food. During her school years, she sold school supplies. Today her daughter helps her out by selling CDs and by helping to run her small hotel on holidays.

With the loan of 1,500.00 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase 20 packs of CDs and with 200.00 soles she will purchase vegetables, potatoes and meat for her restaurant.

Julia's dream is to set up a business for internet and office supplies on the first floor of her house and to start a restaurant on the second floor. She would also like to continue her work at the bank. In the coming city elections she is thinking of running as a candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva volunteer.

Julia nació en la parcialidad de Ayupalca – Mazocruz, tiene 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos que aún dependen de ella, vive en el Jr. Ejercito s/n.

Socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez, ella manifiesta que siempre le gustó hacer negocio, a los 16 años empezó a vender comida, en época escolar vende útiles escolares, actualmente su hija le apoya con la venta de CDS; ella atienda en su pensión, los días de feria – Mazocruz.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 20 conos de CDS y un promedio de S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles comprará verduras, papa, carne para su restaurante. Su mayor sueño es poner en su casa que está ubicada frente al mercado un Internet, librería en el primer piso y en el segundo piso instalar su restaurante y seguir trabajando con el Banco Comunal, en la próximas elecciones municipales piensa participar como candidata..

loans.use: To purchase CDs, vegetables, potatoes and meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Los Suertudos Uno Group

texts.es:
The “Suertudos Uno” Group is maD. up of people that are already working in their second cycle under the leadership of their president, Señorita Marlene. Right now they are a total of 13 people, each one with the knowledge that the communal guarantee is indivisible for the members. In the cycle that they completed, there were no late payments. They are in the process of interviewing three new members to whom they have explained the manner in which the group works along with the rules that apply to everyone.

Yasmani is a motor-taxi driver; Carlos is an employee; Mercedes sells AVON products; Vicente is also a motor-taxi driver; Lusia is in sales; Rossy sells at an empanada stand; Karina sells cosmetics; Claudia sells bread; Nataly sells enrollados (dish maD. with cured meat); Mariela has a beauty salon; Guadalupe sells pizza; Rosa is a secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo los Suertudos Uno son personas que ya están trabajando en su segundo siclo bajo la presidencia D. la señorita Marlene, en este momento cuentan con un total D. 13 personas cada una con el conocimiento en que es la garantía comunal es indivisible para sus compañeros. El ciclo que terminaron no tuvieron atrasos en su pagos, están con calificación con 3 socias nuevas a las cuales ya se les dio a conocer como trabaja el grupo las normas reglas para todos. Yasmani es mototaxista, Carlos es empleado, Mercedes es promotora D. AVON, Vicente también es mototaxista, Luisa es comerciante, Rossy venD. en un snack empanadas, Karina venD. cosméticos, Claudia venD. pan, Nataly venD. enrollados, Mariela tiene su peluquería, Guadalupe venD. pizza y Rosa es secretaria

loans.use: Operating capital for various businesses

loans.name: Lourdes Beatriz

texts.es:
Lourdes is 21 years old, studied until the second year of secondary school, is married without children, and lives on Ave. Tacna.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez - Mazocruz. A year ago she began with initial loans in the amount of 300 Soles, with which she bought a dozen shoes. When she was fifteen she began in business selling gelatin and food.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy one dozen slippers that cost 300 Soles, one dozen shoes that are 500 Soles, and with the rest she will buy jeans.

Her desire is to put a store of shoes and slippers in the city of Ilave and to sell in bulk and at retail prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Lourdes tiene 21 años de edad, estudió segundo de secundaria , es casada , sin hijos, vive en la Av. Tacna s/n.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, hace un año empezó con los préstamos iniciando con el monto de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compró una docena de zapatillas, desde los 15 años empezó hacer negocio vendiendo gelatina, comida.

Con este préstamo de S/1,500.00 que pagará en 04 cuotas comprará 01 docena de zapatillas que cuesta S/ 300.00, 01 docena de zapatos que está S/.500.00 y con el resto pantalones Jeans.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de zapatos, zapatillas en la ciudad de Ilave y vender al por mayor y menor.

loans.use: Buy shoes and jeans.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives on Ave. José Antonio Chambilla in the Neighborhood Alianza Mazocruz. She is 33 years old and she studied until the fourth year of secondary school. She is now married and a mother of three children.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez in the District of Santa Rosa of the Province of Collao, Region Puno. With the first loan, she bought ingredients to prepare foods, and little by little she went increasing her capital. Changing businesses two years ago, she is now dedicated to selling appliances like: radios, recorders, televisions, DVD, and spare parts.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy three TVs with DVDs, two normal DVD players, converters, and spare parts for appliances.

Doña Maria always works with the support of her husband. Her dream is to make her business grow and sell in other markets like Capazo, Huaytiri, and others. She always liked doing business; she began doing sales when she was eight years old.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria vive en la Av. José Antonio Chambilla s/n Barrio Alianza Mazocruz. ella tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto año de secundaria es casada y madre de tres hijos.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Distrito de Santa Rosa de la Provincia del Collao, Región Puno, con el primer préstamo compró víveres para seguir preparando viandas ( comida ), poco a poco fue aumentando su capital cambiando de negocio hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artefactos como : radios, grabadoras, televisores, DVD y repuestos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 03 DVD con pantalla, 02 DVD normales, conversores, repuestos para artefactos.

Doña Maria siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Su sueño es hacer crecer más su negocio y vender en otras ferias como Capazo, Huaytiri y otros, siempre le gustó hacer negocio, ella empezó a vender desde la edad de ocho años.

loans.use: Buy DVD systems, converters, and spare parts for appliances.

loans.name: Maranatha 2 Group

texts.es:
The “Maranatha 2” Communal Bank has been working with investments from Agrocapital in its fourth cycle. It’s a very united group comprised of 14 members of whom three are men who are thankful for the inclusion of men in the communal banks. They use the money to improve their businesses and quality of life as is the case with Señora Segundani who works making bread. She tells us that it is helping her a lot with her invesment [in her business]. She opens her savings accounts with Agrocapital because she says that she wants to save the earnings from her business for the wellbeing and future of her children. In the same way, the other members, hopeful because of the economic support the institution provides, are willing to work for a much longer time with it. Corina, the president of this group, is a cook; Jaime is a mechanic; Felipa works as a baker; Lucy and Lucia are also cooks; Marta is a butcher; Dolly, Patricia and Miriam sell food; Germán and Adrian are mechanics.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco comunal MARANATHA 2 ya viene trabajando con inversión de AGROCAPITAL por su cuarto ciclo, es un grupo muy unido esta compuesto por 14 socios de los cuales tres son varones, agradecidos por permitir la inclusión de varones en los bancos comunales, los cuales utilizan el dinero para el mejoramiento de sus negocios y calidad de vida como el caso de la señora Segundani que trabaja con la elaboración de pan , la cual menciona que le esta ayudando mucho en su inversión y que en lo posterior esta Sra. Solicita a AGROCAPITAL la aperturas de cuentas de ahorro pues indica que todas las ganancias de su negocio quiere ahorrarlos para el bienestar y el futuro de sus hijos, y de la misma manera los demás socios esperanzados en el apoyo económico que brinda la institución es que están dispuestos a trabajar por mucho mas tiempo con la institución. Corina la presidenta de este grupo es cocinera, Jaime es mecánico, Felipa se dedica a la panadería, Lucy y Lucia también son cocineras, Marta es carnicera, Dolly, Patricia y Miriam venden comida, German y Adrian son mecánicos.

loans.use: Operating capital for various businesses

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde is 32 years old, married, and a mother of four children: two girls and two boys. She studied through primary school and she lives in Jr Trujillo in the Downtown of Mazocruz.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez of Downtown Mazocruz, in the District of Santa Rosa, Province of Collao. Her first loan was 300 Soles, with which she bought cookies, sodas, one bag of sugar, and one bag of rice for her grocery store, which she has been working for seven years. When she began to first do business she sold sweets from a tricycle and in this way went about increasing her capital and start her grocery store.

With this loan of 2500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy more products for her store like: one sack of rice, two barrels of fuel (each cylinder costs 580 Soles), five drums of gas, etc, and in this way obtain greater earnings.

Her greatest dream is to have her own house in Mazocruz in order to be more comfortable in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Matilde tiene 32 años, es conviviente madre de cuatro hijos, dos mujeres y dos varones, ella estudió primaria completa, vive en el Jr. Trujillo s/n en el Centro Poblado de Mazocruz.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Centro Poblado de Mazocruz, Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao, su primer crédito fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles con el cual compró, galletas, golosinas, 01 bolsa de azúcar, 01 bolsa de arroz para su tienda de abarrotes, que hace siete años viene trabajando con este negocio, cuando empezó hacer negocio primero vendía golosinas en triciclo así fue incrementando su capital y puso su tienda de abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará más productos para su tienda como: 01 saco de arroz, 02 cilindros de gasolina, cada cilindro cuesta S/. 580.00 nuevos soles, 05 balones de gas etc. y así obtener más ganancias.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia en Masocruz para estar más cómoda con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy various products (groceries).

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia is 19 years old. She studied five years of secondary school, is married, and the mother of a son. She lives in Jr. Puno in the Neighborhood José Antonio Chambilla.

Since a year ago, she is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz. With the first loan of 300 Soles, she was able to buy a thousand CDs to sell individually at 1.50 Soles per CD. Two years ago she began in the CD business; she sells every Saturday in the plaza of Mazocruz.

With this loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy two thousand CDs and little by little she will continue increasing her business.

Her vision is to have a shop of Nintendo games, slot machines, and billiards, and to continue with the business of CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Natalia tiene 19 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de un hijo, vive en el Jr. Puno s/n Barrio José Antonio Chambilla.

Desde hace un año es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar un millar de CDS para vender por unidad a S/. 1.50 cada CD, ella hace dos años empezó con el negocio de los CDS, vende los sábados en la plaza de – Mazocruz.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará dos millares de CDS y poco a poco seguirá aumentando su negocio.

Su visión es tener un Local de juegos de nintendos, tragamonedas, billar y continuar con el negocio de los CDS.

loans.use: Buy music CDs in bulk.

loans.name: Las Misiones Group

texts.es:
“Las Misiones” Communal Bank is maD. up of 12 people. Its president is Señora Raquel who sells beauty products. This group meets without fail every Thursday morning. Delia, Alicia, Ilaria and Anabel offer cleaning services, Nancy sells in a kiosk, Gloria sells shoes, Felix is a musician in a band, José drives a taxi and Pilar sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

EL Banco comunal Las misiones se encuentra conformado por 12 personas, su presidenta es la señora Raquel que es promotora D. articulos D. belleza, este grupo se reune sin falta todos los jueves en la mañana.Delia, Alicia, Ilaria y Anabel ofrecen sus servicios D. limpieza, Nancy venD. en un kiosco, Gloria es promotora D. zapatos, Felix es músico en una banda, Jose es chofer D. taxi y Pilar venD. comida.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Fuente De La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlan has been a major city since early Mayan times and is situated on the hillside of beautiful Lake Atitlan. Atitlan is known around the lake for the strong presence of the Mayan Tzutujil people. 

Despite this interesting background and beautiful scenery, the women from the group tell me this town can be dangerous at times. This is especially true for women, who are already greatly under pressure to keep their families running, and sometimes deal with attacks and suffer from the hard laws of the street. The troubled times caused by the Civil War during the eighties have influenced Santiago's contemporary reality very much; this is why Conception, who does most of the talking for the group, thinks that life in Santiago is, even today, a difficult one.
 
Pride and the continuing search for a better life keeps the women of this group going and they are working hard to improve their lives and the lives of the ones they love.

Most of the women work in embroidery. The Santiago Atitlan embroidery is delightful. Artisans will weave beautiful birds and Mayan symbols in their typical blouses called Guipiles.
