For almost all of the women this is their second, third or fourth loan. There are even some women who came from another group and have managed to establish their lives quite well after 8 years of microfinance loans, says Josefa, who is one of them herself. Josefa is the president of the group. While working in her convenience shop that she has managed to build, she works on embroidery too. She is also very happy to be able to help the younger members of the group to learn how to invest their credit well. 

Conception says that it is everybody's wish to take advantage of every opportunity they have to talk to foreigners. This is because talking to foreigners is an opportunity for them to show their beautiful art to the world and this can become an opportunity to sell or even export their goods to other countries. Selling their products to foreigners will generate the earnings they deserve, especially during the tough rainy season when the prices of their weavings drop dramatically and the competition increases. This is because there is too much competition in the local market and their weavings are sold at very low prices. This means they sometimes have to sell their products under production costs just to get some money for future investments. The rest of the group very much agreed with her and gave Conception a round of applause because she has expressed herself well.

loans.use: Invest in materials

loans.name: Princesa Juana

texts.es:
Princesa Juana was born in the region of Ccollipuyo in the District of Ilave. She is 34 years old and married with five kids. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She lives in the community of Pusuyo District of Ilave for five years now, because her husband is from here.

She is a member of the Community Bank Gregoria Apaza, community of Pusuyo, District of Ilave, Province of Collao - Puno. With her first loan of 300 Soles, she bought four little sheep and four laying hens. She has always been dedicated to raising cattle and sheep livestock.

Thanks to the training and education that she received a year and a half ago through the Community Bank, in which she learned to make embroideries in fabrics (craft work), she is now dedicated to raising cattle and making embroideries.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four payments, she will buy one bull to fatten up with 1300 Soles and more cloth and wool for embroidering with the other 200 Soles.

Her greatest longing is to construct her home in the city of Ilave, because she already bought her lot, so that her kids can study better and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Princesa Juana nació en la parcialidad de Ccollipuyo, Distrito de Ilave , tiene 34 años de edad, casada tiene 5 hijos , estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo Distrito de Ilave hace quince años, porque su esposo es de dicho lugar .

Es socia del Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza, comunidad de Pusuyo , Distrito de Ilave, Provincia del Collao - Puno , con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró 04 ovejas pequeñas, 04 gallinas ponedoras, ella siempre se dedicó al engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino.

Gracias a la capacitación que recibió hace un año y medio a través del Banco Comunal en donde aprendió hacer bordados en bayeta ( artesanía ), ahora se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y bordados.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles lo cual pagará en cuatro cuotas, comprará 01 toro para engorde con S/. 1,300.00 y con S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles comprará más bayeta y lana para bordados.

Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa en la ciudad de Ilave porque ya compró su lote, para que sus hijos puedan estudiar mejor y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy one bull. Buy cloth and wool.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina is 36 years old, separated from her husband eight years ago, and a mother of two young daughters. She was only able to study through primary school. She presently lives on Ave. Niños.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez of the Santa Rosa District, Providence of Collao. With the first loan of 300 Soles, she bought three sheep to sell as meat, which increased her capital and now she has a grocery store.

With this loan of 2000 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy three bags of sweets, five packs of soda, five bags of noodles, and other items for her store that are sold daily. She will also buy vegetables: one sack of carrots, one box of tomatoes, 25 pounds of onions, two bunches of gourds, etc. for selling at the Saturday market in Mazocruz.

Rufina says that since she joined the Community Bank, her business has increased and she is very happy.

Her dream is to continue increasing her capital for her business in order to be able to obtain more earnings and educate her daughters until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Rufina tiene 36 años de edad, es separada hace 08 años, madre de dos hijas menores de edad, ella solo pudo estudiar primaria completa, actualmente vive en la Av. Niños s/n.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 03 ovejas para vender en carne, fue incrementando su capital ahora tiene su tienda de abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 meses, comprará 03 bolsas de golosinas, 05 paquetes de gaseosas 05 bolsas de fideos y otros para su tienda que vende diariamente, a su vez comprará verduras: 01 saco de zanahoria, 01 caja de tomate, 01 arroba de cebolla, 02 cabezas de zapallo, etc. para vender en la feria sabatina en Mazocruz.

Rufina, indica que desde que integra el Banco Comunal, incrementó su negocio, ella está muy contenta.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando más capital a su negocio para así poder obtener más ganancias y educar a sus hijas hasta que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy various products (groceries).

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia is 24 years old, and stayed in education until the fifth year of secondary school. She currently lives with her partner and is mother to a 5 year old. She lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru s / n - Alliance - Mazocruz. She became a member of Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez, Mazocruz three years ago, and with her initial loan of S /. 300.00 Nuevos Soles she was able to buy 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar and 1 box of biscuits for her grocery store. This, in turn, increased her business capital. She currently sells alpaca meat to the public at the Saturday market in Mazocruz. With this loan of S /. 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 5 cuts of meat to sell on Friday and Saturday in Mazocruz. Her vision is to expand her business, taking her product to markets in Llave, Puno. She also wants to be able to provide for her child economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams. Kiva volunteer

Sofía tiene 24 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria, conviviente, madre de un niño de cinco años de edad, vive en e Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n – Barrio Alianza – Mazocruz. Hace tres años es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz , con el préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 01 bolsa de arroz, 01 bolsa de azúcar, 01 caja de galleta para su tienda de abarrotes, incrementando su capital cambió de negocio, en la actualidad vende carne de alpaca al público en la feria sabatina de Mazocruz. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 05 degollados de carne para su venta los días viernes y sábados – Mazocruz. Su visión es ampliar su negocio llevando su producto a los mercados de Ilave, Puno y que su hijo pueda estudiar sin limitaciones económicas.

loans.use: To buy wholesale meat

loans.name: Las Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
This is the Communal Bank “Las Tulipanes,” formed of 18 members, all of whom are women from the same area. The neighborhood is called Julio Leigue and is behind the Industiral Park, a neighborhood inhabited by the same big-hearted people. The meetings take place in the President, Mrs. Yris Libertad’s house. She is a very sensible woman who just gave birth to her first child, she is dedicated to selling cosmetics. She is punctual and has strong character. The treasurer is Mrs. Cinthia, the Secretary Mrs. Jaquelin. The majority of the members are dedicated to selling cosmetics from various brands, for example: Esika, Avon, Yanbal. The Secretary is dedicated to selling clothes. They are in their first cycle and up to now everything has con regularly, and they have a good idea of the punctuality and responsibility that they should have for the loans that they have been granted. Mrs. Chelita makes homemaD. bread, Mrs. Fabiola sells fast food in her own home. The group has chosen to meet Tuesday mornings.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Este es el Banco Comunal " LAS TULIPANES" Conformado por 18 socias todas son mujeres D. la misma zona, El barrio se llama Julio Leigue queda detrás del Parque Industrial, un barrio acogedor donD. habitan las mismas con gente D. gran corazón, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en la casa D. la Presidenta Sra. Yris Libertad una señora muy sencilla que acaba D. dar a luz a su primer hijo ella se dedica a ser promotora D. cosméticos, puntual, D. carácter fuerte, la Tesorera es la Señora Cinthia, la Secretaria la Sra. Jaquelin, la gran mayoría D. las socias se dedican a ser Promotoras D. Cosméticos en diferentes líneas D. como por ejemplo Esika, Avon, Yanbal, la Secretaria se dedica a la venta D. ropa. Ellas están en un primer Ciclo y hasta el momento todo marcha con regularidad, además que tienen bien presente que la puntualidad y responsabilidad que deben tener para el créditos que se les otorgó. La Sra. Chelita hace pan casero, la Sra. Fabiola se dedica a la venta D. comida Rápida en su propio domicilio. Los días D. reunión escogido por el grupo es el día martes por las mañanas.

loans.use: Operational Captial

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny is 30 years old, married, has two children, a boy and a girl, and stayed in education until the fifth year of secondary school. She lives in Jr. Jose Galvez No. 309 in Llave. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Gregoria A. in Pusuyo, Llave, Collao and two years ago she secured her first loan of S /. 300.00 Nuevos soles, which she used to buy 4 pigs (S /. 35.00 Nuevos Soles each), 4 small sheep (S /. 30.00 Nuevos Soles each) to raise which, when they grew up she sold for a higher price. She currently makes braid beads ('mostasillas'), which she sells wholesale weekly in La Paz Bolivia. With this loan of S /. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy more material to make braid beads and a percentage will be used to buy parquet and ten blocks of tar costing S /. 42.00 Nuevos Soles each. Her vision is to buy a house in Llave and open a restaurant on the first floor and an Internet cafe on the second floor. She has always liked to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Yeny tiene 30 años, casada, tiene dos hijos, un varón y una mujer, estudió quinto de secundaria, vive en el Jr. José Gálvez Nº 309 en el Distrito de Ilave. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Gregoria A. de la comunidad de Pusuyo, Distrito de Ilave , Provincia del Collao, hace dos años obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual invirtió comprando 04 chanchos a S/. 35.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno, 04 ovejas pequeñas a S/. 30.00 Nuevos Soles cada uno para engorde, cuando crecieron vendió a más precio, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias, en la actualidad se dedica hacer trencillas de mostasillas, el cual vende por mayor semanalmente en la Paz Bolivia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles el cual pagará en cuatro cuotas, comprará más material para trabajar con trencillas de mostasillas y un porcentaje comprará parkets, diez bloques de brea a S/. 42.00 Nuevos Soles cada bloque. Su visión es comprar su casa en la Ciudad de Ilave y poner un restaurante en el primer piso y un Internet en el segundo piso, además siempre le gustó cocinar.

loans.use: To buy material to make braid beads (mostasillas). To buy material for flooring.

loans.name: Fuente De La Esperanza Group 2

texts.en:
When I arrived by boat at the lovely town of Santiago Atitlan, I had to walk up a steep hill to reach the town square where I was picked up by Maria Q., the loan officer. While climbing up the steep hill, I recalled the information I had read about Mayan culture and urbanization. This town was built utilizing the old traditional Mayan ways. This is because the view from the town to the lake and further to the volcanoes gives it really a magical feel.

As soon as I was introduced to the women of the group they woke me up from my dreamy thoughts about Santiago de Atitlan. They exposed how hard it is to live in a town which is overwhelmed by poverty, which in this case was reflected in crime and drug abuse. The 30-year-old civil war has also left a big swath of painful memories, they tell me. Despite all this, the women are very proud of their skilful art and the culture they have managed to protect, says Dolores.

Most of the women are weavers. They weave the typical Santiago de Atitlan guipiles and pantalones: beautiful typical blouses known throughout the country for their handsome embroidery. Artisans will embroider beautiful birds and Mayan symbols. Five of the women work in the art of making jewellery as does Maria, the president. Elena sells fish she imports from the Pacific coast area. And the two other women sell clothes from a little stall in town.

Being part of the trust bank brings the women a lot of enjoyment. Maria tells me that the lessons they had 2 years ago about medicines and family planning were very helpful. They like to get together to talk about their lives. The elder women with years of experience help the younger women to set up a business. They are a close group who have been together for over 5 years!  Being able to export their goods is a big dream for some of them. This way they should be able to get a fair price for their goods to keep their families running. 

Some of the women desire to send their children to school in the city because there are more chances for a better education and a more promising future. I leave the group with great admiration of their calm but deeply-held views on life and feel they really deserve to have all the successes they dream might come to them.

loans.use: invest in materials for their businesses

loans.name: Victoriosos Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca Elena is the president of the communal bank “Victoriosos” and has her fabric business, and is a dynamic and enterprising person. The group is formed of 13 members. Blanca has three children and one of her objectives in asking for this loan is to improve her business to produce more. The members live in the Las Cabanas neighborhood, and thank Agrocapital for the opportunity to apply for this type of loan. The businesses to which they are dedicated include: selling fabrics, trinkets, furniture, tamales, macramé, Yanbal products, chocolate, clothing, food, furniture, and renting motorcycles. They aspire to grow their businesses to improve the quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

La sra. Blanca Elena es la presidenta de la banca comunal “VICTORIOSOS” tiene su negocio de tejidos, es una persona dinámica y emprendedora. El grupo está conformad@ por 13 soci@s. Blanca tiene tres hijos y uno de sus objetivos por los cuales solicitó este crédito es para mejorar su negocio y producir más. L@s soci@s viven en el Barrio Las Cabañas, agradecen a AGROCAPITAL por la oportunidad de acceder a este tipo de crédito. L@s beneficiad@s a los que se dedican son: ventas de tejidos, de golosinas, tamales, macrame, productos Yanbal, chocolate, abarrote, ropa de vestir, comida, muebles, alquilar motos. Todos tienen la aspiración de crecer en sus negocios para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.

Julia es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Julia junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería ubicado en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida principal del distrito de Carmen Alto. Al inicio su esposo vendía artículos de PVC, como tubos, accesorios de baño que adquiría en la ciudad de Lima y luego lo repartía por mayor a las ferreterías de la zona, y poco a poco fueron implementando su negocio, actualmente venden artículos de ferretería, agregados, ladrillos, los productos lo llevan a domicilio para lo cual cuenta con un carro.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.

Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar un volquete y ampliar su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Julia is a member of the Communal Prosperity Bank. Julia is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children; Julia and her husband have a hardware store located in a principal street in the district of Carmen Alto. Initially her husband was selling PVC style materials such as pipes and accessories for bathrooms that are acquired in Lima and then divided among the largest hardware stores in the area. Little by little they have built up their business and now sell many items including bricks, hardware materials and even have delivery service. Julia needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of iron materials. Julia’s dream is that her children become professionals, are able to purchase a dump truck and will be able to expand their business.

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of iron materials.
